ftnuey-KGRlHGihW92Fj-Q.text: Having grown up in LA and being a HUGE fan of mexican food I'm always skeptical about eating "posh" mexican food.  Before we get started with the review, DO NOT go to this place if you are expecting "typical gringo mexican food".  What I mean by that is if you want oil soaked enchiladas with a heaping spoonful of refried beans with 3 lbs. of cheese covering a scorching hot plate and chile rellenos, crunchy tacos, and the 3 item combo from a place like Chevy's, El Torito, or Macayos, then move along.  Otherwise, keep reading.  I ordered the carnitas street tacos.  The carnitas were tender inside and slightly crunchy on the outside which is a result of the braising process but also the pork slightly frying in its own fat.  They weren't greasy though, and came dressed with salsa, onions, and cilantro (hence, street tacos, like the ones you get in street taco shops).  But the flavors were outstanding.  No shredded cheese or heaps of lettuce either, which added to the authenticity of this food.  These were served with black beans and rice on the side which was nothing special, but really I didn't need anything overly overstated.  Yes, paying around $12 for 3 tacos is exorbitant, especially when you pay $0.50 to $1.00 per taco in Mexico.  But come on people, it's Vegas.  If you want cheap there is a La Salsa around the corner.  And when you take a street taco and refine it to up the gourmet quality, it really was worth it.  They serve the obligatory chips and salsa, and I would best describe the salsa as being a more coarse molcajete style salsa.   My friend ordered the steak nachos, which were unconventional but delicious.  They were individual flour tortilla chips with a slice of grilled steak, cheese, and beans with a jalapeno slice on each chip.  Those were delicious as well.     All in all, I would highly recommend the food, but have an open mind, especially if you are expecting the same ol' american style mexican food.  Certainly hole-in-the-wall taquerias have their merits and strengths (some al pastor anyone?!) but this place provides a more upscale spin for a tasty lunch.

TLVbdQ2sKyRfeM4LTB2e2w.text: Food was generally acceptable, but... Service was slow and snarky. The soda machine was broken so you could only have tap water or a $10 Margarita. WTF? You have to pay for chips. The salsa spread was unique, but one of the salsas looked like earwax. Mango puree? Still, it beats waiting in line for the buffet. Hint: If you need to sit on the floor to rest while you're waiting in line for a buffet, you shouldn't be waiting in line for a buffet. Try Yolos!

5fdLvLFOp9_5CAdpFoE7zg.text: They have a big bar adjacent to the casino. I had originally sat down for a drink, but ended up ordering food and I'm glad that I did. I had a couple of great tacos and a couple of beers for reasonable (Strip standards) prices. I liked sitting at the bar because I could face the casino floor and people watch.

RZjGJL0-yAY_omGHxDVaKQ.text: I've stopped in here a couple times over the years and enjoyed myself at the bar.  The food is decent, although I'd say it's overpriced.  They're trying to do fancy Mexican, and the plating is fancy.  The quality however, is just OK.  They do have a decent tequila selection however, and their margaritas are pretty good for the price.  Not a bad place to grab a drink and watch some sports, but you could eat elsewhere and feel better about your dining IMO.

DG37dYk3qe7WAPWactVx_w.text: The guacamole here is awesome.  We visit this place every time we come to Vegas. Great food. We had great service from Eric.

BlaTQNpslywcVnfjsCXVHg.text: Margaritas are pricey but good. They let you pick your tequila which is nice if you know what you're wanting. Blue corn coconut shrimp appetizer was super. Only four but that's to be expected. The Drunken chicken nachos were HOT. I like hot but this was lips on fire hot and there's nothing telling you that when you order so my sis couldn't eat them. The chicken was kind of soupy so it made the chips mushy which I don't like. Also, the chips were bottom of the bag, small pieces. I've never had that even in the cheapest dives. Makes me suspect that all those fancy tequilas they're offering are probably one cheap, bottom of the barrel brand.

XeIHcMVyZZ-fbUcUyhhmdA.text: Best place to eat in las vegas!! Try their drunken nachos.. Their off the hook... When im back in vegas im coming back here

TdEDYjkgk9no8stynlIWqQ.text: I recently had friends in town and they were staying at Planet Hollywood and wanted to eat at the hotel. So we went to Yolos and couldn't have been more pleased! From the hostess to the bartender everyone was on top of their game! I had the chicken tacos and they were delicious! We also ordered gaucamole which had just the right about of heat to it! My friends had the steak nachos which is done a little different than most people and they loved them!! Also we all drank margarita's and they were some of the best ones I have had in a long time. Nadjana was the bartender and she was so nice and friendly! She attended to all our needs! I will definitely come back because I always have friends in town that stay on the strip!!! They also told us that they had just remodeled and the place looked great!!

UDp3oFaptUP0ahfhhB9Isw.text: Top notch. Great food. Good prices. I think has Happy Hour

0nEVK5I7gdj2vg3ROJRqww.text: Yolos was very disappointing.  The chicken fajitas were the blandest I've ever had.  Guacamole was tasty though.

maGEIqRfkWa5-l0CuRCtCg.text: If you're staying at Planet Hollywood, are craving some Mexican food, and don't want to spend the big bucks, Yolos is the place to go.  Located at the corner of the casino at Planet Hollywood, Yolos' pink and green lights lure you in to their sleek but simple restaurant. They are a sit down restaurant as well as a bar so feel free to grab dinner there or take a couple of shots before entering Planet Hollywood's nightclub, Prive just a few steps away.  I always order their steak quesadillas that come with an ample amount of sour cream, guacamole, and salsa. While waiting, you are given a basket of crisp chips and their house salsa that is just the right amount of spicy.  They're never super super busy so good attention is always given by the servers. For 2 people, a check could roughly come out to $36-$40 (including tip). Not too shabby for Vegas!

6IocQbXWJpSlbupEPluuZg.text: The food and drinks were incredible and fresh. JD was our server and was awesome! He explained everything, and was very tentative. Would Def eat here again.  Oh, cannot forget to mention the $5 margaritas yum!

1fdpZUQKbvp2wWIHaQ7jBw.text: I don't know what their food is like, but I can tell you they make up really great tasting strawberry and mango margaritas for $9 a piece, but if you go to the front desk they'll give you a coupon booklet, then the drinks at Yolo's are buy 1, get 1 free.

Cl33PReywf6yJNW3dz0qLg.text: Yolos has great food, a lot of Mexican beer on tap, including Negra Modelo (I had 2), and the best bartender in Vegas, Nico (Nicolette). Nico was awesome! She handled a slightly crazy and drunk guy very professionally. Nico taught me about her favorite tequila (Don Julio Real) and bartending in Vegas. She is also the face of Yolos Tacos & Tequila Tuesdays. I highly recommend Yolos (You Only Live Once So) for their food, beer selection on tap, tequila selection and friendly service.

m68682giUvyvKjuec5GLrA.text: This place is okay, not fantastic. Especially when there are sooo many A+ places to eat in Vegas. I will say the margarona was great. It is a margarita with a corona... It is worth trying!! If your just looking for drinks and appetizers then this place is a good spot.

yq0LEx1rEO_NPVD2SzOGUA.text: Pretty tasty sweet corn tamales and huge margaritas....raspberry flavor to boot. Service was okay, but the chips and salsa were spot on, just like Chevys...yep almost my favorite. Small, inside location, quite accommodating.  Best part...didn't have to pay. Me likey.

agUHNBTXtoXwZHCDrPTvZA.text: The food was good. They make the guacamole table side and give you the option to not include any of the ingredients.   I heard the flautas were amazing, but didn't try them. I got the barbecued salmon with mashed sweet potatoes and asparagus. Salmon with 2 of my favorite side dishes are hard to beat. Perfect amount of food too. Enough to create a nice base for drinking all night, but not too much that you feel bad leaving most of it behind. Also our server was incredibly nice and not just split up the tab for us but also split the shared items so we were charged a fraction of each.

Awdb8CoMa84khmxP5RXFMA.text: I never have high expectations for places in Vegas but this one is pretty good. Decent price, good food, kinda reminds me of Pink Tacos (for all you LA ppl) It's located inside of Planet Hollywood  Came here to get a "snack" which turned into a full on meal. The fajitas are pretty good. There's about 6 thin strips and they give you all the goods to put into your fajita: sour cream, guac, beans, rice, etc.   The guacamole fresca is pretty damn good. They make it in front of you and it's just basically guac and chips.   I don't know, I thought this place was pretty good but I was also starving so at that point, I think anything is really good.   But I do recommend this place if you just want an afternoon snack or don't feel like splurging on the fancy restaurants

0Xs6eYptkgeKoFzCHkP5QA.text: Twas a good place to start a relaxing lunch day in Vegas for a party of 4 before the madness of 15 began.  The margaritas here are the best I've had anywhere. They're so sugary sweet, but perhaps if you drink a few, the alcohol will catch up and kick you in the ass...maybe, but I didn't drink that many. Fajitas were yum and the guacamole - they make in front of your face! - was really fresh.   We were easily put into food coma.

7w7zCkc-6HxJXQDlfKlGrA.text: Yolos is one of my favorite places to eat in the world.  Maybe it is because it is always the first place I go to when I get to Vegas so I am excited and in a great mood but every time I go there there food is great, it is at reasonable prices and the service is quick.  Not a fancy Vegas restaurant by any means but if you are looking for a quick sit down dinner with good food and drinks at a good price Yolos is the place.

N_as8DTHAncwieEsGXzRSg.text: This place is just as nice as it is delicious! My family and I enjoyed every bit of our meal! From the service to the guacamole, we had a great experience here. Z_dFHyWPqsSgyGNrCAbmEg.text: This was the only place I ate at, over a week in Vegas, that I'd give less than 3 stars.  First off, it's way - way overpriced. I saw some people mentioned happy hours and we missed that, I'm speaking in terms of the general dinner. We paid something like $150-200 for 4 people to eat and get drinks.  Being from Texas, my mark for Mexican food is high. We ate at Cabo Wabo too, it was a little better and a little cheaper. The food here was very plain. The chicken was just a simple white meat in rectangular strips and the tortillas were standard, not homemade. There are also no free chips and salsa (which blows my mind at a Mexican food place).  The big knock is that the queso is barely a step above the jarred stuff in the stores. There is an oil based, cream quality to it. It's just plainly subpar.   The place was clean, our server was nice and everything like that went well. But the food to price ratio (however you want to put that) was just way off.

FzjTctfownqrFEsXNi3asw.text: I had sooooo much fun doing karaoke with DJ Tempo and his sidekick. Sorry, I didn't get his name. They are both very professional and very good at what they do. If they didn't have the song you request, they'll download it for you! The DJ played songs to keep everybody turnt!!!

UTMvwtBDsu1DzY6LxH2dhQ.text: Finding a decent meal that doesn't cost you an arm & a leg is a difficult thing to do in Las Vegas.  You can also get very tired, very quickly of the long lines at the hedonistic buffets.  Additionally every hotel has soo many restaurants you can easily get lost in the websites and hotel brochures.  Sometimes you just need to explore the mystical Vegas landscape and hunt yourself down some grub. So that's what we did.  After a long day of wandering The Las Vegas Strip in the sun, we had worked up quite a hunger.  Originally we had stopped in at Planet Hollywood Hotel & Casino to grab a beverage and to rest our feet for a minute in front of a negative ATM (a slot machine, it's a joke, cause you put money into it.  Get it? You got it.) when we say the giant bright neon sign for YOLO'S Mexican Grill.    It appears quaint, yet still very active.  Like a small 10 person house party that gets really out of control.  We checked out the menu, and decided to roll the dice.  It wasn't too busy inside, maybe 60% capacity, but it was enough that it didn't feel lonely inside.  We were sat near the edge, so we could "people watch" the hordes of people stroll by.  The decor is quite modern, except splattered with neon.  Think of the design style inside Aria, but then have street artists come with buckets of precise neon and accent the whole thing.  Strangely, it works; not like neon did in the 90's  We began the Yolo's experience with a Margarona; a margarita with a Coronita inserted upside down.  We saw everyone around us drinking it, and said, "That looks fun, let's try it!"  I'm not a big margarita person, but it wasn't bad. Wasn't spectacular, but the spectacle of it cranked the "fun-ness" level which somehow made it tastier.  We ordered the Chips & Sales ($3) to start of the meal, both to curb the alcohol and the hunger gained by walking around The Strip for hours.  What came was a mountain of corn chips and a heaping bowl of salsa, almost too much for an appetizer.  Immediately after we indulged the Roasted Vegetable Fajitas ($13) and the Adobo Vegetable Enchiladas ($12).  We immediately realized how naive we were in ordering an appetizer as the portion sizes of the two mains were enormous.  Like everywhere on the planet that served Mexican food, I had to ask for more tortillas twice (12) and because there was simply SOOO much food to stuff into my gullet.  The vegetables were spiced nicely, not overly salty (as a common Mexican trend) and thankfully there was enough sour cream, salsa, guacamole and cheese (most importantly) to garnish my riotous portion of tortillas.  We tried both the Mexican rice, and the cilantro rice; the cilantro being my favorite.  It was enough of a palette cleanser to separate the barrage of Mexican flavours.  The black pinto beans were superb, and both made sure we finished the portions.  By then end, we actually had to force ourselves to stop eating.  We were so full we felt like the blueberry girl from Charlie & The Chocolate factory.  We sat to regain the blood flow to our legs and enjoyed a Bohemia draft, and a Carta Blanca - both imported Mexican brews.  Best of all was the bill, it was easily the least expensive meal we had had in Vegas thus far; yet one of the most satisfying.  Partially due to our significant over indulgence.  We did end up visiting the negative ATM's immediately after, as the gargantuan "fullness" needed a solid 90 minutes before we felt like normal human beings again.

S65ya8yPWUNthekyeYnfTg.text: Service was good. Food was ok. Although living in California I'm spoiled to great authentic Mexican food. Nice clean place. Not too noisy. Here's what we ordered.  CEVICHE - my wife ordered the ceviche. She thought it was going to come in a glass, however being on a tostada shell with guacamole was not bad  TAQUITOS - usually taquitors come in a crunchy corn rolled shell. These were soft and made of flour. Chicken had food flavor.  STREET TACOS - these were also in a flour tortilla. Again chicken had good flavor and it's hard to mess up a small street taco. Fish street tacos also had good flavor RICE and BEANS - absolutely no flavor at all.

g4wOAFD5DdNz541rL6q0Vg.text: This place rocks.  Drinks and food are great.  I am there every month and Chris D and the bartenders are super cool and make great drinks.  Food is awesome.  I get the seafood enchiladas or the steak burrito.  They do NOT suck.  I am from San Diego and eat Mexican food daily and this place rocks and definitely compares with San Diego's best.

-vXGlD2CqEe7zhmjOqPirg.text: I'm weary of eating on the Strip because of two things - the prices, especially because everything has an 18% "entertainment tax" tacked on, either in the price of the food, or at the end of the meal, and because service is either non-existent or good. There is no in between.   When my sister was complaining about being hungry when we had time to kill before we saw a 9 o'clock show last night (7/25/11,) I was dreading how much I was going to have to throw down to pay for the meal. Walking around Planet Hollywood, I noticed there isn't much in the way of food.  My sister wanted pizza, but we couldn't find any. Next choice (always the best) was Mexican food.   We walked right up to the bar and sat down. Got ID'd, were handed menus and given waters. WOW, $5 for chips and salsas. I look over at the people sitting on either side of us. They have chips and salsa and there's no way I'm paying that much for what I see. My sister and I settle on splitting the $10 "drunken" chicken nachos. My sister remarks that the margaritas come out of a slushi machine. "Ew, that means fake lime flavor. Pass" she says, with a scrunched up nose. I look at the drink menu. The mojitos sound good. $10? Eh, never mind. I'm not that interested in paying that for a drink. I'm a local, after all.   I look at the register in front of me. "$138?!" Our neighbor's tab for two is astronomical! Our other neighbor gets rung up. "$124!!" Good thing we only ordered an appetizer or else I might be in the poor house. These dinner portions are TEENSY!   My sister worries aloud that we might not have time to finish our meal when it comes out. A few minutes later a small mound of nachos comes out in a molcajete. My sister says "never mind" about not finishing the nachos. The portion is so tiny, one person could easily finish them. Good thing I'm not very hungry so it was enough for two. My sister laughs when she says we finished them in less than 10 minutes.   The taste was decent. Not the best ever nachos I've had, especially because some chips were full on black at the bottom of the pile - they probably got forgotten about under the broiler. The bottom was soggy as there was a big puddle of whatever the watery "drunken" sauce was.  The service was attentive, which is a big thing in Vegas. The interior is also fun and pretty. Even though my sister is nowhere near full and I feel what we bought was worth maybe $5, I don't feel terribly ripped off. Would I make a special trip to eat here? No, but it was good for what it was - a "low priced" snack on the Strip.

z_NjO8gndrbC2ZqXA3EcQg.text: Yolos is so amazing and the bartenders are so fun and in tune with the customers! We came in the first time after long flight, no food all day and lost luggage wah wah! I had the fajita burrito which tasted more like a pot roast burrito. Pretty gross considering I wanted a fajita burrito.   Chips and table side guac +salsa were good. My recommendation would be to come here for a beer and a snack. Not for a meal.

Pn_Z6REjOEY10wR-N0YSsw.text: We stumbled on Yolos while walking around looking for a casual bite after a show.  The hostess was super friendly.  Waiter came promptly.  The top-shelf margaritas were...yeah: top-freakin'-notch.  Wow!  Too many times we've been disappointed by so-called top-shelf margs made with mix.  Not at Yolos.  These guys break out the good stuff: all handcrafted.  The prices are stellar ($13 each) but considering the location and being on vacation, who gives a damn.  Go to the craps table and spend a bit of your winnings on a truly good drink.  The food was quite good but not as memorable.  Would we return?  Hells to the yes!

sELoP5ijkjPTn8mbkG-mNw.text: We'd come back. The total experience was nice.  Food good. Service good. Pricing reasonable for vegas.  While they do everything well keep in mind the lighting is very low. Flashlight needed to read menu.  No jokes.

UFmpLAVyDlUstXJn_CK_Dw.text: Yolos is off of the Planet Hollywood casino floor NOT in the Miracle Mile shops.  The table side guacamole was delicious. We both got the excellent fajitas.   Service was great, and the price was not unreasonable for Vegas.

dguz9J8n3FrCtakwLOIgpw.text: YOLO.....I didn't like the name of this restaurant, nor did I care for the environment...but we were too lazy to walk anywhere else on the strip so we decided to go here. The Pork Chop was cooked well, but the sauce was a bit too sweet. The Chili Crusted Mahi Mahi taco was a bit bland, and the salsa that accompanied it was average.  Service: Friendly but a bit slow.  Ambience: Most of the restaurant is open to the casino; so it feels pretty much like you're eating next to slot machines and card tables.

U9Etcq_WDCK4GUDgUUWwlw.text: My coworker and I had lunch here on Thursday. The staff is friendly and the service is fast. Aaron was very accommodating and made us feel very welcome. I've enjoyed  Yolos for many years and I always have a memorable experience. Thank you!  Mary B

MUdF0COZgSkEhOb7RWt58w.text: Food was great. Margs were bomb! Chris & Carlos took good care of us and made the best chocolate cake shots in celebration of the birthday. Thanks :)

Km9USAegWsTcDybMAVO27Q.text: in vegas like usual all restaurants are full and pricey so we were super hungry walking in the casino when we walked by Yolo, foood was delicious! i don't really dig Mexican food but this place was amazing and affordable! Thank You

EQb26svUN_iAH39lStUf9g.text: Review is for the Bar/Lounge are ONLY.  I ended up there with the hubby and another couple after spending way too much time @ Chateau last Friday night. We were drawn to this place because of ample seating, DJ, and the hookah. I know, I know what a combo right Mexican restaurant with Hookah. But whateves its Vegas I guess everything goes huh.   Atmosphere was chill and kick back, just the way I like it. I only wish we would have tried this place earlier in the week. Mixed drinks we're typical Vegas watered down and overpriced. But we had lots of fun here. People watching, was entertaining lets just keep it at that. LOL  We'll have to come back and try the food on my next visit.

594VLQUnMONNmwi5ViF4qA.text: I came across this restaurant in a travel guide (yes, my family still buys them occasionally) about a year ago.  I was looking for Mexican food and initially chose Los Dos Caminos over it because they offered free chips and salsa (silly, but important...who wants to pay for just chips and salsa?!?) Now Dos Caminos is closed (so sad) so we decided to give Yolos a try.  The chips are now free (unless they always were and I was thinking of a different restaurant).  The tacos are delicious as is the cilantro rice.  I have never had rice like that before and it was amazing!  The margaritas were also delicious.    I'm surprised at the complaints about the price.  Our meal at Yolos was cheaper than any other meals we had on our trip.  I felt that the price was comparable to my favorite Mexican restaurant in Chicago.    We ate early, so the restaurant was almost empty.  The atmosphere is cool, dark booths illuminated by the drink menu.  Our service was excellent.  I will definitely come back on my next trip.

eZ6-GDWB_cVSEvtj1egUsg.text: My wife and I are extremely pick about where we eat and hang out.  Chris the bartender makes this place a must stop for us anytime we are in Vegas.  Besides making our drinks on point, it's that extra special touch about remembering who we are that makes the trip worthwhile.  The appetizers are good and it's simply a cool little spot.

UxhgJq5-pvRSWiYQpnC08A.text: Pretty good place! We went here after seeing the line and the wait for Spice Buffet, especially in respect to closing time; and P.F. Changs also having a wait.  Turns out Yolos was a good choice.  There was no wait, plenty of tables, nice atmosphere despite practically being in the casino and fast service.  The Tortilla soup was great. The mahi tacos were ok and the chicken fajitas were decent. I'd give the food three stars. The service was phenomenal and courteous; and very timely. Our food came hot and fresh, and a bit faster than we were ready.  It's not a bad place to try out. It isn't cheap, but not many places in Vegas are. It's not that expensive either.

2CkK-WbzQ7nkIb0RZbalDg.text: This place gets five stars only because of Nico!!!! She's amazing! We never had an empty cup and she was so nice so we decided to come the next day just for her,

rPNFTakpvk-vbNbCvAiK5A.text: Happy Hour review only!  $4 hh specials - Margaritas, wine, tacos, flautas and tequitos.  Yes, very Americanized but the flavors were excellent!   Don't bother ordering the wine as I believe it was wine from a box quality. The Margaritas were decent (for $4) and it is available only at the bar.  The carnitas flautas were suprising delicious. It's lighty fried with a green avocodo sauce on top. The tacos and tequitos were just OK.   We've ordered 8 things all together and the bill was only $32. If you are up late and looking for a snack at 2pm, this is the place to be!!

CeMdpwnRfgRMyrxa4vFO_Q.text: Came into Yolos and sat at bar, it's a great spot to people watch at PH.  Open to the casino and you definitely get an eyeful.  The food and service were spot on!  Nico and Mo took care of us.... Top Notch!! Food, service, drinks were all top notch.   Thanks Yolos!

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7Ok868B47NJWMLwfCoYKGw.text: Great authentic food.  Friendly servers and attentive. We were seated right away and the house margarita was good.

CGVPyTndwBvRq_WX_FoXDQ.text: This is a casual and fairly quick place to eat if you are just looking for a nice Mexican meal. It's located right in the casino area if you don't mind that atmosphere. The fajita quesadilla was a nice dish and the tortilla soup was average. Our server was super nice and accommodating so from my experience the service was good too.

hCoH_Sd1WiU0vjrS3B-a0w.text: Food is really good. I enjoy getting guac, which they make table side to order.  Taquitos are good, tacos are bomb, and so are some other things....but I was too drunk to remember.  Recommend, yea. Return, yea.

tnNmTOkUrbCuz1hXoStkvA.text: The food hit the spot. Get the enchiladas! The meat was so tender and fall off the bone. The rice and beans were a little cold but the flavor was there. Decently priced drinks. I will be back

6TFQr4oLahK_VyNlg2ZOeg.text: Reasonably priced for Vegas. The food was descent. Nothing exceptional.  There are lots of great Mexican places around.   If I go again I will stick to pork beef of chicken. The fish was not that great. Too over cooked.   Nice service. It's right inside the casino at ph.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In the ph casino

_DpUJjRkzqYDhoat7o7lCQ.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch bite while at a show.  I had my service dog in training and they were very cordial. Food was tasty too. Would come back again.

5MV951sGmoDFeQCLmxdOvA.text: Service was great!   Street corn is magnificent.  Had the fried potato street tacos....delicious.  Husband chicken burrito and said it was good.  The house margaritas are stronger than i like but still yummy.

YcpWesJgZH6KUCDMXOhWXQ.text: Freshly made chips and yummy salsa, although you have to pay for them.   Carne asada tacos were awesome, although had too much onion and cilantro and could've used more sauce.   I was happily surprised by the ceviche. Really fresh tasting, although also heavy handed on the onion and cilantro.   Our server, Roy, was running his butt off, but that didn't stop him from taking excellent care of us.   Considering its on the Strip, prices were reasonable.

8pyJmpaw5aG-vBHuMvKi5A.text: This place is awesome!!! Service is great, we ordered our food and it came out in seriously 10 min, I couldn't believe it! The bartenders are great drinks are delicious, would recommend this place to anyone!

sxHeucTdXkUMcmHq4Ua93Q.text: Great food! We ordered chips, guacamole and salsa for starters, the guacamole was amazing. A combination veggie/chicken fajita, the veggies were nicely cooked and very tasty, and a carne asada platter. The carne asada was cooked to perfection, very tender with fingering potatoes. Randal was our server. The was very friendly and accommodating. He even changed the basketball game to the hockey game so we could watch it. Definitely recommend this place.

1KppboONs4jcy-jF2VlBIA.text: I hardly ever give bad reviews but the nachos were burnt pieces of tortilla chips with little chicken and cheese.  Worse, the mojito was watered down,  very disappointed way to end the evening yesterday :(   Maybe it was just a bad night.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Notice the character on the chips, no Bueno.    At least the guacamole was good?

os5VSR55EaMnfLkdRRAnKQ.text: This place does not have a name brand chef, True that. The price is in line for the food served considering this is Vegas & the strip. The 2 of us ate for $54. Our bar tab for 2 delicious Margo-Ronas was $24 pushing the tab & tip up. Perhaps I'm not feeling the pinch because a similar drink in DC would cost more.   For entrees, we had the Pork-Pibil (4.25 stars) & the Steak Picado (3 stars), service by Gustavo(4.5 stars), ambiance (4.5 stars), drinks(5 stars). Average = 4.25 for rating. That is a-okay in a city with so many big name chefs and prices. If you are not a buffet grazer, this is a very decent alternative.  This restaurant is inside Planet Hollywood Casino, near PF Chang's.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita with a Corona. I&#39;m a newbie! Yummy. In Planet Hollywood Casino.

-R-pnHlS0X0ZwuBQixfQGg.text: This is an alright Mexican restaurant inside Planet Hollywood. It tries to be more of a bar/lounge atmosphere late a night. They do karaoke some nights. On my most recent visit, we opted to sit at the bar and have some drinks and appetizers. The bartender was friendly and attentive. The margaritas were the best part of our experience. They were large and really well-made. You choose which type of tequila you want, how you want (rocks, blended, etc.) and if you want any added flavors. It's a pretty cool way to have a margarita menu. The queso I had was pretty tasty and it was served with fresh tortillas. The salsas were pretty good too. Though, chips and salsa is not complimentary, you have to pay for it. All in all, it's an a-ok spot. I wouldn't make a special trip to PH just to eat here. But I would eat here again if I was at PH and hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AS1vinkrwfRR5K4hyaMJKw.text: Happy hour 3:00 - 6:00, good selection of drinks and food. Margarita was perfect, and  chicken quesadilla so good! Large portions.

tg_-ZvnHMp0kBv9Z-Up_jQ.text: Eh.  Just ok.  Nothing special about this Mexican fare, bar waitress was unfriendly and there are so many other much better food options in the area.  This is a skip in my opinion unless it's your only option for food.

984ABIvk18ruZyzjkfWAhg.text: Decided to give them a shot for happy hour, most due to proximity from staying at planet hollywood.  Had nachos and a couple other forgettable items. Service was sullen and inconsistent at best. They won't even come from behind the bar to serve you at their own tables.  If you're truly desperate for uninspiring typical Mexican food and drinks, perhaps this will work for you. But I'll just leave it next time.

4SgaYYt74zO2Pt9Tu5l4nA.text: This place was a good deal! Mexican food. Who doesn't love Mexican food right ? I do! As a Mexican I'm very picky with this. We had the whole place to ourself only another table. We had a queso fundido, what can I say it was so good and very Mexican  my boyfriend had the burrito, he just loves a burrito that can stand on itself. The price was average for Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Queso fundido
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burrito

VYUxraGtGPMtpRwcyNSY4g.text: The food is great and the place is neat and clean. Felipe was very attentive to us during dinner today. The rest of the staff also gave great customer service. If you are ever in Las Vegas are you need to stop by

bdxQGGBsPbkkw4LWR_koVA.text: I went here for a quick dinner before the Backstreet Boys concert! Although the name was a big part of our decision to go there, we were pretty impressed   Three of us split the chicken nachos, and a taco plate which came with three tacos, and you got to pick which ones you wanted!) It was the perfect amount for three women. The food was definitely good, but it was pretty standard Mexican food. Nothing super special or out of the ordinary, just a standard Mexican place.   One bummer was that they didn't offer any sort of birthday celebration or free dessert. We were celebrating a birthday, and I was really shocked that they didn't offer a complimentary dessert or something. They also didn't offer complimentary chips and salsa. I know it's Vegas and everything is more expensive, but I was surprised that chips and salsa weren't included.   I gave the restaurant 4 stars. The service was good, the food was good, but honestly, I don't think I would go back. It was a standard Mexican restaurant. I enjoyed it for what it was, and have nothing too bad to say about it, though.

ADG5M7W3vDua4gQRdINb5A.text: The service provided by Nadjana, the bartender was excellent. She was very attentive to my husband and I. In the mist of a full bar of patrons our was wait time was practically non-existence.   A very pleasant experience. Out of all the eateries and buffets that are available on the strip, we returned to Yolos for the excellent service and food.  Although our chips were salty we still enjoyed the rest of the meal.  Good place to check out whenever you're in Vegas...

DJ7WURHvthYxdFIqsiSvYQ.text: This was a horrible experience. We sat at the bar and it took 10 minutes to be greeted. Then he dismissively gave us the drink menu. He didn't come back for a long time. Then when he did, we asked him for food recommendations and he rushed us along so fast that it was a horrible experience. We got up and left and went to another restaurant in the hotel and the people were much nicer.

fOWnTYnOqFneAZJP4f5low.text: Awesome restaurant first off , Me and my friends were hungry so Yolos got a beautiful atmosphere so we got there hostess sat us down awesome girl music is playing our server got there I think his name was Roy ask us if we like any drinks so we started it with some jalapenos margarita Mmm delicious we got chips and salsa then he took our order I got some mix tacos shrimp, shredded pork , fish my friends got tacos as well carne asada & chicken , so we waited for our food it got here pretty fast so I started eating my tacos OMG there were AMAZING juicy the right combination of flavor and I can't cook haha but I know food when I  eat it haha that's my experience enjoy guys I'll be back for sure!!! #Yolos #1 #LV #PH #girlsnightout

8F3DQurkrVbahcRVAsBpGQ.text: Micheladas are ok.... Chips and salsa were good... Service was great! Very attentive... Sat at the bar

KUMiGnw5Y3w03uCmFdhPCg.text: Came here for a drink with a buddy working off my high from Ditch Friday.  Place is low key.  In terms of price, the drinks are about average.   The food did look really good, especially the salmon.   Note: they have a dj playing around 10:30, BUT, place is still dead, so don't waste your time thinking its going to turn into a happening scene.

RaGpcqS8HbHsl1hVpW_HJQ.text: Reagan at the restaurant is the best server hands down!!! Such a wonderful experience here. The food was phenomenal. The bartender Maurice, known as Mo, was excellent as well. Be sure to get Mo's Blended fruit martinis. My favorite was the Strawberry and Mango blended martini. OMG you all have to try it!!!! Excellent place. Thank you YOLOS!!!!

gTiHuNAwhpFubhtPf03Mmw.text: My boyfriend and I hit the Yolos bar last Saturday night, before catching the early performance of Peepshow (terrible).   We each had a Margarona, which is a bottle of Corona tipped into a giant Margarita. It was really refreshing and delicious. We decided to have some appetizers- chip, guacamole, salsa and a shrimp dish. The food was excellent and I wish that we had decided to have a full meal here.  In the end it was a little pricey- three drinks and the appetizers came to around eighty dollars. However, we enjoyed everything and our bartender was very nice and personable. She even took care of fixing a mistake from the kitchen, walking back there and getting our order done right.   I would definitely go back here.

BJ19vhr2NBla_HSv8DssoA.text: Karaoke DJ sucks balls. No profanity in Vegas. Claims he called us for karaoke, but none of us heard him. Terrible.

IUFRQ3YmMuSbY0vxy1j-NA.text: This is a great stop for a quick patron shot or rendezvous with friends/family before heading out for a night on the town. I knew I was really in Vegas when I saw that this place had patron on tap. LOL! I had to stop. Patron on tap is something I'd never seen.

_nrI8C_gj7neIzr9NvnfVA.text: ***Do NOT waste your money!***  We went here for a birthday dinner and it was our first time eating here and since we were staying in Planet Hollywood we decided to give it a try. The decor was really pretty and I did like the vibe, but it was kind of empty so that should have told us something. I ordered shredded beef enchiladas and my cousin ordered the carne asada tacos. They both cost about $15 each and came with black beans and cilantro rice.   When the food came the rice was cold on both our plates and the food was not well seasoned. The shredded beef tasted like pot roast and the black beans tasted like they came out a can.   The only good thing that I can say about the place was that when I told the manager the food was not good, after I took two bites, she agreed and we immediately left without having to pay.

KESptzBlgXpf-VYe-BRknw.text: My friends and I had a decent enough dinner earlier in the evening. Our server had hyped up their karaoke lounge that started at 11, telling us each singer would also get a free shot. And indeed, there was a sign in front stating so. We came back and it was a mess... The karaoke DJ lost my friend's slip, went on some extended break where he just stood there, maybe checking his email or bidding on an eBay auction. I did sing a song and when I asked the KJ where to get my drink, he handed me a slip and told me to take it to the bar. When I did, the bartender gave me... a cheap, plastic EMPTY cup with the Yolos logo. When I asked him what he was going to fill it with, he laughed. And the I said, "no, seriously. Where's the shot?" and again, no laughs. I can afford to buy my own drinks but don't advertise something you're not going to deliver. Shady and cheap.

O0Sj9ymBmXKH0HuIELUlrg.text: If you go here the staff will recommend drinks for you and even give you ideas for a great meal, awesome staff was definitely impressed as. I come to Las Vegas 7-9 times per year and this place has definitely figured out how to treat their customers right, can't recommend this place enough, GO THERE NOW !!   Ask for Maurice

MUwTBleFlP3pihDuS-BlgQ.text: Been here twice both for bachlorette dinner parties. First time a friend set up the dinne, it was pre-fixe w/chips and salsa, salad, and entree. During this time had filet mignon and it was great. Second time I set it up the dinner and this time had Flank Steak which was delicious as well. However my steak took soooo much longer to get to me and by the time i started to take a bite of mine the rest of my party was done, and as you can imagine was very annoying. However, it was made up by the manager providing our party an array of desserts on the house. This made me get over it quick, as it was not only free but very tasty as well. This move saved the 4th star

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GUgM0Ey8bc2oHe0zK-WTEg.text: Portobello mushroom fajitas yum! For Vegas, this place insite PH was a great stop and not terribly expensive. The fresh chips and salsa were fantastic - tasted home made. My fajitas were nearly enough for two people had we ordered some additional tortillas. Onions, peppers, thick cut portobello, and some cilantro rice and black beans....YUM! I would definitely suggest coming here. No 5 stars because service was a bit slow....even when hardly anyone was in the restaurant and my eating date's mahi mahi tacos seemed a bit skimpy.  But overall great food.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G40dmGM8LNvcPmbLQn60GQ.text: The food is good. I had red sangria...i wouldnt really have called in sangria...not too great but The staff is very friendly. I would come back again just to watch the extremely sexy man they have making the table side guac.

K3QDTrhfsUk7DmC0S2yLxw.text: Awful food. We went here for dinner and ended up sending 2 of 5 dishes back. Of the 3 dishes we kept we had a few bites because the food was inedible. Service was not very good either. The manager seemed annoyed we didn't like the food and didn't even apologize for the poor quality of food sent out.  Do not recommend this place to anyone.

u5DbquIrUKPh0JQNSju84g.text: We were wandering through the PH  shortly after arriving in Vegas and wanted something lite to eat. We decided to try YOLOs. It was ok. We had the nachos and the taquitos and chips and salsa. Everything had ok flavor but I guess I was expecting more out of a restaurant in the PH. I don't think I would go back,  not with so many other options on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h3A7P6EfpOh_aFSYum7uyA.text: The food was good, very good portion size. Although a little pricey but the food was good so it was worth it. We were there last month on a Saturday evening it was pretty chill not too pack. Although the waitress asked us if he had a reservation... (the answer was no) She made us wait 10 mins although half the restaurant was empty.  That was pretty ridiculous considering there was a lot of tables available for us to sit. She got very lucky because we almost left....

r8WljjAqYOBtF8eEvtY-3A.text: Back again and yolos was excellent! The wait staff was so professional and the food was terrific.

APBiHPzPSzhsPQ-BOuR-pw.text: I had read about Yolo's on Yelp prior to my Vegas trip so I had an idea that I wanted to try it. I got a strong craving for Mexican food so we went to Yolo's on Christmas Day. Originally I wanted to come for the lunch special but I ended up coming after that time slot so we ate off the regular menu. When we went the restaurant was pretty empty but we still had to wait 10 minutes for a table (odd). We were seated and our waitress was nice.  I got the chicken street tacos with rice and black beans. I liked my food but I couldn't eat it all because I was getting full. The price was reasonable at $12. I got the Razzarita drink, which is a blended drink of raspberry schnapps, vodka, etc. which was  very good and just my style, fruity adn blended. My sister got the steak nachos which were somewhat small. Her only complaint was that the steak tasted weird but overall the nachos were good.  The total for the bill for 2 people plus one alcoholic drink was, I believe $38 which is a very good price for a late lunch/early early dinner meal on the strip. I would go back.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak nachos
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QYjpDbrW6hAsedJoTweUew.text: The food in my opinion is very Americanized but was pretty good.  I was there with a group of ladies for a Bachelorette Party on a Friday night so they were somewhat busy.   The chips and salsa they leave on the table are delicious. I love the baked chips and the salsa is the perfect blend of spicy but not too spicy.  Once I had a chance to look at there really cool electronic drink menu I decided on a frozen strawberry Margarita. The drink was super delicious! It was pretty awesome that you could create your own Margarita though. One side of there drink menu was the create your own Margarita and the other was a list of cocktails they offered.   I decided on the Pork Carnitas street tacos for dinner. They came with a side of black beans and a choice of rice either Mexican or cilantro.  The meal was three small tacos with guacamole and salsa on the side of the plate. The tacos were just ok in my opinion. Personally nothing spectacular but not horrible either. I thought they were kinda of dry and needed just a little more sauce to make them better. I just used extra salsa to enjoy them a little more then I would have normally.   Now price wise this is pretty expensive for Mexican but it is on the strip so that is what you get. People should not be surprised at how expensive it can be. On top of being a pretty expensive meal for one person because I was with a party of 8 or more thy added gratuity. Gratuity ended up being $6 for everyone which I thought was decent for Vegas pricing.   The thing I really enjoyed was the decor and ambiance of Yolos. I loved the colors and lighting. Also we had excellent service from a very attentive waiter who was wonderful at helping a large group.

SDsziwKhOW668tEcAGqVYw.text: I'm a big fan of Planet Hollywood.  The ambiance is pretty nice and the staff is friendly.  YOLOS is conveniently located adjacent to the entrance and the casino floor.  I ordered three bottled Miller Lites, which were delicious as always.  The bartender was an attentive hottie wearing a black tank top and yoga pants.  So I've got no complaints there.  My friends and I, who were killing time before the BRITNEY show chatted with a couple of young ladies at the bar who were also seeing BRITNEY that night.  All in all - this is a nice place with good energy :-)

lt3qBmEb4T_XawJiUojPrg.text: Ordered the tosada salad w/ steak. Wish I would've known it was spicy because it said nothing about it being spicy. Ordered their Corona with margarita (I forget what it's called) & that was tasty. Seriously, the only highlight. I went with a bridal party of 15 girls. Waiter cost 100$ service fee but failed to fill waters & tend to the table for that amount. Not worth it in my opinion. Food is OK priced but there's way better places on the strip.

I0y3R8uHQhGSRv0Z5NNYiA.text: I really think they out crack in their chips and salsa because I've never had chips and salsa taste that good!  I had their fish tacos, which was pretty good.  Also tried their Cucumber/Jalepeno Margarita--which I was NOT the business.  I took two sips and was done.  Didn't like the flavor.  Service was not bad. I was there for a bachelorette party and we told them we had a show to catch and they had the food come out quick.  But yeah, the chips & salsa--ridic. good.

0QPyZSLh_d0q9iYHfmSA2w.text: Fun little bar and restaurant located inside Planet Hollywood on the strip.  My husband and I were in Vegas for 4 days and visited Yolos three times.  Our bartender Chris was very engaging, setting waters and menus down in front of us before we even got completely situated at the bar.  He kept the drinks strong and coming.  We ordered chips and salsa to soak up some of the booze, and were pleasantly surprised with the huge portion size.  We couldn't finish them, and they were only $3.50, which is a bargain for the location.  We will definitely return to Yolos on our next Vegas vacation!

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0fBgd7ZOs7HOJEQGbd_ltQ.text: This place is really good. There isn't anything here on the menu that I didn't like.  My fav at this place is of course, the fajitas.  I mean, what Mexican restaurant wouldn't be good if their fajitas sucked??  Def not this one!!  I had the steak fajitas TWICE in my Vegas trip ( I mean, there are only so many meals you can have in your weekend trip to Vegas, right?).     My only complaint is that the waiters could have checked up on us a little bit more...I had to run over to the cabinet area to fetch my own water (boo to that)...but otherwise this place is awesome.

htywMoppGrjZZ-7F1HKEFg.text: Nady makes me want to move to Vegas! What a gem! We ended up staying for hours just because her energy and drinks are by far the best thing in the whole casino! She invented a drink called the black swan and I think it would make an amazing martini or shot! We did not eat any food but it looked pretty! The dragon berry tea is scrumptious and the margaritas are spectacular!!

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mady
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So fun
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday

Pg3u_WpOnbbGVqgyi76cfA.text: Visited Vegas this last weekend.  I had to stop into Yolo's, as it is my place to go while I'm there.  Of course they didn't disappoint.  Not only do they make me feel welcome while I'm there, but they were doing it for all the other customers at the bar.  It has a very positive atmosphere and the staff is very inviting.  My group enjoyed margaritas, shots, and some food.  We were well taken care of and our drinks were never left empty.  It happened to be Karaoke night, so it was truly a sight to see.  I want to give a special shout out to Chris, Memo and Bryan.  Thanks for taking care of my family and I.  They had a great time!

sWdhsuF7k0qpa7XxB_GHdg.text: Probably the worst tacos I have had to date. I ordered the shrimp tacos. They cost approximately $15 for 3 tacos, rice and black beans. I absolutely love all Mexican food and rarely find places that get tacos so wrong. The shrimp was very chewy (although I will admit they do serve a large portion of shrimps within the tacos - they were just barely flavored and the texture seemed off - not worth it at all) The cilantro rice wasn't bad, but I won't say it was good - it also lacked flavor. Lastly the black beans were inedible. They tasted as if they came right out of the can, barely cooked.  I hate to waste food but in this case I took a couple of bites and paid the check. I was in no mood to explain how terrible the food was but it would have been nice if I was offered an alternative when the tacos were suggested by the staff and barely touched.

BjyFROvDNvKaipeTw5QGgA.text: I'm a huge fan of Yolos.  I've eaten here probably a half-dozen times in the past two years, and it's on my short list every time I'm in the general area.    It's not really "authentic" Mexican, but they do put out some damn good food.  They've got their own spin on some Mexican classics, which I like.  The happy hour deals (3pm-6pm M-Th, 5 items, $5 each) are all outstanding and a great value.

p4Krjqa9mme7sSjEWoi9Ww.text: Hair in my desert. Understaffed will wait a long to get food and check. Food was average.

bHEfJ4lqXgQ6TXQaOR3-cA.text: This place is definitely more on the American side than it is on the Mexican side. Food was good but for Mexican American food it was deathly overpriced. Then again we are in Las Vegas. I'm giving them three stars because I was not impressed with the food. Along with this the waiter started off with an attitude. He did turn it around right away however, first impression is everything.

zix6OIbhy4LkjKLP9EATRA.text: well what can I say, we decided to give it a shot, we were seated very quickly since the place was pretty empty. After we were seated we looked at our menus for a good ten minutes or more and still had not gotten any service not even our drink order was taken.   Still minutes later more people began to arrive three more tables were filled up just around us and as I kept glancing from the menu to the tables I realized two tables that were there after us already had drinks, one had chips and drinks and our table was still empty.  Its not real Mexican food and we wanted to try and it but since we got no service, not even acknowledged we got up and took our asses elsewhere. If your in Planet Hollywood I recommend heading to the Sandwich Of Earl and Chef Ramsay Burgr.

upV_jEHQIK1y4vj9P9xaWQ.text: Dinner on a Friday night with 6 people.   Mojito - good. actual mint leaves. decent portion.   Tortilla chips - fresh, home-made. good with the salsa.   Quesadilla with shrimp - very good. lots of shrimp. came with guac and sour cream. lots of cheese, good flavor. came out hot and fresh.   Service was good. Nothing over the top, but no complaints.   Not too expensive, and a good place to go if you're in the area and hungry.

dI2qCDrQQ2UNon8H1RfgmQ.text: Fantastic street tacos, tasty mojitos, and friendly staff. You can't go wrong here. Located inside planet hollywood right in the middle of the casino. I'll be back

X1f8vjHtcCQxaBPuerc9Iw.text: We are Canadians from Calgary been coming to Yolo's since 2007 they have amazing food & drinks but mostly enjoy the outstanding warmth of service by Guillermo,Chris ,Nicola & their team. We don't stay at PH but it's a must to do on our list to come stop by 4-5 times a year that we come.  Try the steak(Rib Eye) it won't be a mistake! Or the mouth watering die for Street Shrimp Taco.

edEK0livpmeUJNcAU5Ak8w.text: Out of all the places I've been in Vegas, this is probably my favourite. We ended up here completly by chance, and I was blown away. The local was casual and not crowded, and the staff were very friendly. Make sure you order a cocktail (or three, it is Vegas after all) and no matter what you have to eat make sure it includes the guacamole they make for you at your table. Best guacamole of life! Can't wait to go back!

Yyes3HmCqtD_LGw13YpXiQ.text: Nothing special. Soggy enchiladas and hard grains of rice. Food just wasn't that great.

KK-khPMX3KI1CeGfz2O6Pw.text: Go for the top shelf margs.....stay for the drunken chicken nachos! OMG! Wonderful favors and such huge portions! I think the location of this eatery, just steps from the latest in slots play, has to be taken into consideration in advance. It's not a place to feel like you've escaped the strip for a quiet meal! However, it's DEFITINTELY a place for a good time, some incredible munch-ables, and an easy transition back to the gaming floor!

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken Chicken Nachos

Z9t8dptalZaZFUll2C5SuA.text: Good food and fun atmosphere.  Staff was friendly and quick.  The guacamole was made to order and the street tacos were the perfect amount.  Would have liked more beer options.  Sat in the back booth overlooking the casino, made for a great place to people watch.  I would go back again.

JROlDu8-KLmzKxB8Mnh4HQ.text: Came here for a late dinner on Saturday night. The restaurant was pretty empty, maybe 5 tables sat total. Therefore our server was very attentive. I ordered a chicken tostada salad and it was really good. I was disappointed that chips and salsa were not complimentary and were $5, BUT they were really good and fresh so it was worth it. They were doing karoke in the bar area which was definitely entertaining. For being a restaurant on the strip the prices were not outrageous either.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Light up drink menu

zy1fdKpJ6VsLkSYexsYMzA.text: I got the carne asada tacos. It came with a side of refried beans and rice. The plate was very delicious great flavor for everything. I also ordered the raspberry margarita which is one of the best drinks I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mihAMkxFabhZSREH46zz4A.text: We came here on a Saturday night right before the Backstreet Boys concert & our server was Dez! She was very attentive, friendly, & knowledgeable of the menu which was great because I'm kinda picky when it comes to food. The food was alright but the service was excellent. She made mine &  my husbands anniversary very memorable!

cLm1fS-fuWOwtTgIZsfwFg.text: They have fantastic food !! Great service and alot of food for the money !!! And ask for Reagen he is a great server he'll take great care of you !!!!! We'll be back again and again !!!!

BayImIEFDej_NH-AdVrohw.text: Ok so the price of this place in comparison to other Vegas restaurants: much better.   Of course, we were also there at lunch hen they had the specials as well as $5 margaritas.  The food just seemed so-so mexican food and the margaritas not any better.   But service was great, and the decor of the restaurant is pretty cute. Plus it's in a pretty convenient location inside the casino.  I'm not super excited about this restaurant, but if it's convenient - there's nothing wrong with it.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uLG4xrSJU8EfHF6Bza2Xfg.text: I am staying at Planet Hollywood and wanted to try out as many different restaurants as possible. It was a slow Tuesday evening. The restaurant was not full so I stopped in. I chose the chicken street tacos. Presentation was ok. The tacos were quite dry especially the chicken. I did try compensating the dryness with the spicy guacamole sauce but ended up just pouring the taco contents on my rice, which was good and ate it that way.   I came I tried, not overly impressed.

Px1VqFQqTJr5aFhBiWjXLA.text: Poor bar service! Female Bartender sucks making drinks..Drinks are made with no alcohol they add water and juice to mix drinks but charge full price! DJ is maybe the only good thing bc he plays good music.

lCealKQ3hpo9XasTN7RTSg.text: Alex and Chris were the most fun and professional bartenders that we have ever met. This will definitely be our go to spot every time visiting Vegas. Thanks so much for making our trip such a fun and memorable experience!!! #WatermelonMargaritas #Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_Hfn66RF3OL5Z4hxQLNOyQ.text: Ordered shrimp fajitas and they were tasty. Last time it was a horrible experience. Staci said come back and we'll redo your experience. Totally different experience. Great taste and service.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rCYmQVtgK7LrVnlIVTTbbw.text: We had dined here several years ago and remembered it being pretty good - unfortunately, tonight's experience was the complete opposite. My family ordered 4 meals and three of them had to be sent back for various reasons.  We asked for no cheese on two of our meals (and it of course arrived to the table with cheese) and we ordered a plain bean and cheese burrito for my son which came smothered in a spicy red sauce. The chicken enchiladas that I ordered (requesting no cheese) came out with a spicy red sauce (while the description included tomatillo sauce and that's what my husband's chicken enchiladas came with). Our waiter took the items back and brought them back prepared which we thought were all correct. My son started complaing that his plain bean and cheese was spicy and then started pulling out long strips of jalpenos and bell peppers (obviously it was not prepared plain). We like spicy food but the chef had thrown jalapeno juice into everything and my lips were burning). Besides the spice, our food was very mediocre and nothing tasted or looked fresh. What made it worse was that they charged us $12.95 for the plain bean & cheese burrito (and I forgot to mention that we asked our waiter if we would be charged the same price as a meat burrito which was $14.95 and he said no, that it would be less). Our waiter tried to be friendly but didn't seem to actually care. We are in Vegas 4-6 times a year and this was probably our worst dining experience ever in the city. Needless to say that this will be the last time we will ever dine here when in town. I guess it explains why there was no wait for a table and a few other restaurants at Planet Hollywood had an hour plus.

dFCzaN9fMkb1ncNUQLYkOg.text: The lunch special is one of the best on the strip I've had.  $10 for a very delicious big burrito and $6 for a good margarita.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1Jzijp17qDp7rukmMKs9cw.text: This place is great. They had a great DJ playing good Latin music when me and my friend visited. Alex the bartender was very nice and helpful with everything me and my friend needed. The manager Roberto was also very friendly and made sure we were having a good time and if we needed anything. I would definitely recommend!

V2pj2OroFTtYK-IwWVpRgw.text: Had some lunch heat after a gambling session .  We ordered the beef Street tacos and chips and Salsa . Everything was Great . Good flavor and Quick Service. A nice place for a bite .

QJdz9QljEYHC9TawtUCAbA.text: Came here around 9 pm on a Monday night and the place was empty. We were seated right away and our waiter was nice and took our order, however he didn't write it down and of course he made a mistake with the order.  We ordered one veggie burrito and one steak burrito but they brought out two veggie burritos instead. (Not a good thing to serve a full on veggie burrito to a hungry meat eater:P).  Anyway, they corrected the mistake and the burritos were really tasty! I also appreciate the amount of guac and sour cream they serve with the dishes. We swapped out the rice and beans for guac and sour cream instead.  I really enjoyed my meal and if I ever stay in planet hollywood again I would definitely go again.

ihzFZOdNMQ0GqJ69EqUvJg.text: We ate here twice bc I craved their street tacos. So yummy!  They served chicken, carnitas and steak street tacos.  I requested no onions and guacamole on the side.  They were excellent.  My fave was the steak, which was seasoned perfectly.  Also,  you can expect excellent Margaritas!

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. street tacos
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loved their Maragritas!

n_q8w0O6WKiWsvyzsORYHA.text: Came for a late lunch a little before 3pm and the awful experience started from the very beginning. They didn't have any sort of lemonade (regular, strawberry, etc.). Half of their menu is varying levels of spicy, without any sort of indication. Usually menus at least try to put a pepper or something to indicate spiciness. We ended up ordering the steak nachos without the jalapenos and a caesar salad. There were 7 nachos in total, with a small piece of meat on top - completely ridiculous for about $12. The steak was very chewy and the portion size was laughable. The caesar salad was okay, nothing that special, but then again, there aren't a lot of ways to go wrong with a caesar salad.   Service was awful, we were not checked on at all during our meal and considering there were 2 other tables there, the service was horribly slow. I can't even begin to imagine how their service would be during peak hours. We were given our bill when we had just begun to eat our food, which made it feel like our server was just trying to rush us out, when the restaurant was nearly empty.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. caesar salad and steak nachos
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. iced tea

UIZVd8_lgHxcI0lAZmqVTA.text: Walked up and there were maybe 10 people in the place. After we sat down it filled up. Sat at the bar. Friendly bartenders. They gave great suggestions on how to order the meals. My wife's food came out and was to spicy for her. They took it back and gave her a new meal with no sauce.

n8qBN_MLvE2cHV-eVqzITw.text: Service was fantastic, our server was fun and had great recommendations. The carne asada tacos were amazing, very tender steak! Never had flan so this was a first time for me and I loved it! Highly recommend!

7z6uPLbxjCc3aDfK4z4eiw.text: If you only live once then I would probably skip here. Had the shrimp tacos. Nothing bad, just very average, which is the definition of average.

W5WNBFmk6k_zShjLFi5Zuw.text: Terrific hidden spot in Planet Hollywood!  Deliscious sea bass Veracruz and table side made guacamole!  Best service with Roy as well!  Very

sE85EfG2xCzQMJ7sgXNQ9A.text: We wanted something a little different so made reservations for Yolo's for dinner. We got a table near the front where you can people watch and the seats were nicely coushened.   We started off with chips and salsa, which were pretty good. There wasn't too much spice to the salsa, but it was good.  For dinner I had the beef enchiladas. They were good, but kinda "eh". There was no spice and not much extra flavor to speak of.   We had a coupon from the hotel for BOGO margaritas and the margs were definitely good!  Our waiter came by about 45 seconds or so and asked if we were okay or needed anything. We kept telling him no and he kept saying "Good, no rush". Having someone tell you "no rush" every 45 seconds kind of makes you feel rushed. I don't think we were in here 45 minutes.

0BJ9H4TEKrpX8BWW4hNl6g.text: The host was not very friendly and almost turned our party away based on our size. We sat in the bar during happy hour and our party was crammed into a tight corner and told we couldn't order for happy hour. The bartender was flustered as she was a server for the bar as well. When our drinks arrived they were watered down and had to be remade. Fingers crossed for our entrees as they came out within a reasonable time. So far not impressed.

GKoVlZsrtpduY8-1pPHOZA.text: This place was absolutely perfect for a quick bite (and drink!) when we got to Vegas.  We sat at the bar, which was probably smart as we didn't have to wait for much.  People were friendly, and the pricing was fine.    The food we got was scrumptious, but I'm a sucker for flavorful tacos.

nZGBRbJV0iJ50aZZP-xQ8Q.text: We went here for a late dinner. Food was great and well priced! Our server Roy was very accommodative. Great deal on Tequila shots also. 3 shots of your choice for $15. Overall very impressed.

Qa9GbwFuDT9ZTlBwY8ZIeQ.text: Would love to review this restaurant but unfortunately when we tried to have dinner there we were told it would be a 45min wait. The place was lucky to be a quarter full with empty tables throughout. The server told us we could eat at the bar but could not sit at any of the numerous empty tables! Obviously couldn't be bothered having any more customers. Wouldn't bother trying again.

bGzixDVedCIBrG0O4V0jBw.text: Went for apps mid-afternoon before late, late dinner reservations. Sat at the bar. Cool ambiance, cool people. Moe, bartender, was sexy, to be completely honest! The food was delicious, perfect sized portions. I had the chicken quesadilla app, and it comes w a scoop of guacamole and sour cream on the side. Tons of fun, would def go back.

quhcyc_jzXwVJj2O74mLSg.text: Let me start with the best part: the guacomole dip is excellent and freshly prepared at your table! Also great margaritas (TIP: try the jalapeno margarita if you're in for some new experience!) to bring you in the mood, and service is very nice and friendly. Certainly better than average on the Strip. I ordered the fajitas and they were quite good. Prices are reasonable and therefore a great dining option on the Strip which is no rip-off. I would go back again for a causal lunch with friends.

pGvKJ209To5C4Z16sKlnYA.text: Really enjoyed the food here, the salsa is killer and the mahi mahi is very tasty as well. Also tried the steak fajitas and they were excellent would deff eat here again

quK2Oa7vanVo8DHlwFPh1Q.text: A cool modern Mexican restaurant tucked away on the main floor of Planet Hollywood.  Great bar view of the entire casino.  I had a Dos Equis Amber for $6 which tasted like a burnt Mexican Bud Light - yes it was awful.  Should have done the Fat Tire.  And a grilled chicken tostada salad for $12 that was not bad.  Good food and drinks, good prices, hip atmosphere, all at one of the newer Strip properties strikes me as a great deal.    One complaint: the bartender - who gave me the Dos Equis when I asked for a dark beer? - was very pretty and just as rude.  Just a lot of unnecessary attitude.  She reminded me of a quote by the travel writer Bill Bryson:  "I have no problem with poor service - it makes it so much easier to not tip."

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_SeqS76A3i_ravPlyt5Rwg.text: It was just ok! I liken it to Chevy's or Chili's but way more expensive. Save your $$

S-R6-U5OdTe2Z3aQUspuAA.text: Looking at the other reviews I think that maybe I came on an off day. Though I do think it's kinda interesting that there is such a things as "Mexican-American" food... wouldn't it just be American food? Or "Food of the Americas", I like that better....  Anhyoo, the food was only ok, and I was the only customer at the time so you'd figure I'd get better service. But the plus was the drink. So if you're in the mood to go to a bar and the Heart Bar is too busy, go to Yolos for a drink, but skip the beans and salsa.  Enjoy a Martini for me!

xeyLZT2kpMQvXCy85ZcnfA.text: Incredible Cadillac Margaritas!   The tableside guacamole is a must!   The ambiance of the room is very appealing.

3Ff_GZR2WjFKHT2WxTeX5w.text: The food and drinks were great, but the service and personalities behind the bar were even better! Mo, Brian, and Niko were awesome!

k06t57KqyvSxhNCoZCJzwA.text: Came here for a cousins closed wedding reception a few months back and we had a blast! Dj was good playing new music and bay area classics..drinks were good however the food was not, actually the food was disgusting. But we didn't care because we were all wasted anyway.. I'll alway b back though,  this is home of the margarona!!! Which is a must try when and PH and why not?....YOLO!!

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yolos to go Margarona! How u doin?

1R2B4_BNrGnoyPChj6FPIw.text: I love Yolo's! Def a great spot to get some bomb Mexican food. Their drunken noodles are amazingly delicious as is their spicy chicken tortilla soup. This place will def be visited every time I come to Vegas.  They also have a hookah night on Saturday's for $25 a hookah (so I was told) and they had a DJ Sunday night.  Service was very polite and courteous.

vWteBdgYpF8UWLt3i4DBYg.text: Delicious food! Got our own personal guacamole expert Brody to mix it up at the table! I usually don't like guacamole but it was just perfect!

4b3enBXcDOvIvndUxwusQg.text: The food here is always great and the service is some of the best you'll find on the strip. I've been here countless times and never been disappointed. The food is hot and fresh and I highly recommend the guacamole and the grilled fish tacos.

RjBsYDbCnSCkdxW7RENW4w.text: Made reservation for 8:00 at the desk. Arrived & they said our reservation wasn't in the system. "Sorry we are full". Nothing we can do".     Just rude!

TSEdzZzt1tVwir_Rtsmh_Q.text: We were looking for a place that wasn't super expensive and Mexican food sounded good.  So we stumbled upon Yolos in Planet Hollywood via Yelp reviews.   It looked great and my husband and I both being vegetarians liked the looks of the veggie enchiladas and the veggie fajitas.  That's what we ordered. They were great!  I don't know what they do to their veggies but the spices are amazing.  The veggie fajitas were our favorite.  So good.  A little loud due to its proximity to the casino but hey, you're in Vegas.  We would go back. Plus $5 beers (tall ones!).

fAztFrevmg9Ut7ZVx4fh3Q.text: After participating in classic Las Vegas nightly events, our party found Yolos to 1. have an appropriate name and 2. be conveniently located in our hotel. As mornings/afternoons can be a rough time, what's better than good ol' American Mexican food.   We got the queso fundido, which was alright. Cheese after a Vegas night is not such a great idea. Quesadilla was decent. Fish tacos were bland. Taquitos were apparently great. The carnitas taco was pretty tasty as well.   Overall, an accessible and medium-priced place for that time that you just want food.   Later in the night, we noticed that if you sing karaoke, you get some sort of deal at the bar. We were intrigued, but did not follow up with the offer.

3hHKUKVP95jZ6sXrriQFZA.text: Overall good service and drinks - recommend especially if you're going to a show or club inside Planet Hollywood for drinks or dinner beforehand. My mom and I went before Britney Spears and got margaritas, chips & salsa and dinners. She got steak and shrimp fajitas and I got a salad with steak. Her steak had a lot of fat throughout so she said something to our server. He immediately was understanding and offered some extra shrimp or chicken and then at the end they took the fajitas off the bill altogether! I'm honestly compelled to write this review because of that - the way they handled it. Wanted to call out the strong management and this would probably bring us back.

-pQ5w9LqN0NSg3Vuk_iVAg.text: Very nice place food is great. Our server Eric was very polite and professional because of Erik I would totally go there  Of course the food is awesome but service is priority for me..

cZMldYDS6RC-f1jsNqGHfA.text: The jalapeno cucumber margarita, so good.  The guacamole that they make fresh, eh.  (Salt people.  It is a necessity in guacamole.)  Otherwise, standard Americanized Mexican food.  Good but nothing to write home about.  And... exactly what we were looking for.  They did accommodate this vegetarian and provided me a plate of grilled veggies to replace the meat.  Delicious and appreciated.

YDyO88lu-yivJ5xiF2JTYg.text: We came here for dinner on Monday night. We were waited on immediately by a very nice waiter. Our orders were placed and the food came out relatively quickly. They definitely know how to serve a good sized meal!

x2YV8LS1AKQFFDyFFlqEpQ.text: First restaurant we saw as soon as we came down from our room after hours of drive and we were hungry and tired to find other restaurant besides buffet. Got me some carne asada taco with beans and rice and it was nothing extra ordinary. Taste the same as my local taco place w/c is like a dollar each. Hubby did not like his taquitos and complained about his dash of parmesan cheese on top of his taquitos (not your grandmas cooking oozing w/melted cheese).

FeJefkt7DhfG6ZT7_1bYww.text: The service was really good and the food was pretty good.  Nothing spectAcular, but I've yet to have anything amazing in Vegas... Chips were a little too dark for my taste and my enchiladas were mediocre, but the cilantro rice and black beans were really tasty.

KysOpoJHqNWUfxmx_ZCEOg.text: This restaurant is inside Planet Hollywood near the slots. Me and my girlfriend were walking inside the hotel and saw a couple of restaurants. I saw there menu outside and we went to try it. There food was delicious. I order the chicken street taco with cilantro rice and black beans and she ordered a chimeyhanga. Our waiter was professional and time efficient. I got one of there peppers and it made my mouth hot. I will come back to Las Vegas by the end of the year and I will definitely come back here. One more thing, they had a poster that stated that if you sing karaoke no matter now bad you are you will get a free shot.

S7ZatCL8fznij9KfDY69vw.text: We brought our family from the east coast to Vegas for their first time Vegas experience. After checking in we were all in need of a cold drink and light fare.  We had made dinner reservations for later in the evening but needed a little snack to tie us over. We happened upon Yolos and noticed it was happy hour time. Perfect !  We had their margaritas on the rocks and blended and they were both delicious. Just what we were looking for !  Happy hour Drinks and food was $6 each. We ordered chips and guacamole, chips and queso and chicken and steak tacos. While the menu is basic the food is good. Great drinks and good food ! Yolos Happy hour is just what we needed after a long drive in the car. Service was great and servers were friendly. A great start to our Vegas weekend !  I would definitely recommend Yolos for happy hour.

b5C0AzshiZ3fC5KWLGyp5Q.text: I'll be honest... this place is not great.  I was killing a few hours before my red eye flight, and came here because I was craving some Mexican food.  I really should have gone elsewhere.  Pros - friendly service. The guacamole was actually pretty good.  Cons - The tortilla chips did not taste fresh and were not very good. They didn't offer burritos.... what?  They only offer burritos M-Thurs (or something like that.) The chicken quesadilla definitely tasted like something I could have made at home and was unimpressive.  Part of it was soggy (with what?  no idea), and there was dead space along the whole outside of the quesadilla that didn't have any fillings... so it was just bland tortillas.  Meh.  YOLO, so you should probably go somewhere else.

HfkK-V8nQSn-eLpUtX-ViA.text: Great service but the nacho rancheros were dry and barely layered. The meat was cold. Not impressed.

ntuw7i6XX2rHaIB6xrs1sA.text: Came here for our dinner Friday night around 9pm, and it was pretty dead. Our server was very nice and my cucumber jalapeno margarita was delicious. For a $14 plate I would have expected a little bigger of a portion. It's a good place with tasty food if you need it while in PH.

8D710t2BHJWihCDOutMKYQ.text: This place is very friendly at the bar and and the patron margaritas was everything. I bought the chicken fajita burrito and I must say shit was worth the bite. Can't speak on anyone else  but this girl knows what she likes

Vi718koNqiJTJUWtB8YMIQ.text: Super good !! We had the street tacos and we loved them and trust me I know good Mexican food. The tacos had a lot of flavor  I would recommend coming here for lunch  The guacamole salsa was great!! It's inside of planet Hollywood
