EHNl5Q-wA3yEUCGBoNsuxg.text: Waited forever to sing a karaoke song. KJ decided to take a 1.5 hour break and then they did not have my song.

pU1pd-m3tPTy5UmKNts78Q.text: I had the street tacos they were amazing! Hubby had the chicken enchiladas and love them as well. Service was great!

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Assad street tacos

oBM2aHR7o_px_DmHsA4mOA.text: Came here for dinner before a concert due to its convenience. The service was good but the food was very bland. We both had fajitas that were not very seasoned, they tasted more like grilled chicken breasts served on a hot plate with peppers and onions. The drinks were definitely better than the food.

fNHo_qQy4G5WghJ7kzQJPA.text: We wanted an afternoon drink with a snack. Yolo's is so easy to find on the casino floor. Nadjana served up chips, salsa, and delicious Swirls. Delicious!

H4zfA111BXR3gzRvbDRr6A.text: Highly recommend! The bartenders and servers are very friendly and make this place a super fun place to eat. Ask for Alex & Chris, they're great and made our experience AMAZING :)

T_a06QxBIZx_Htr7lr6e5A.text: In a city with so much competition, how this place treats customers is appalling. While the food was decent, the unfriendly, inattentive, pitiful service is inexcusable. I felt invisible and literally had to ask for everything. Both bartenders had an attitude and the lady who appeared to be a manager looked as miserable as anyone I've seen. I would have liked another margarita, but I felt asking for one was going to take an act of congress. Shame on you Yolos for ruining my decision to stop in. And just in case anyone thinks this is just a disgruntled ex-employee, rest assured, I am not. I try to eat at different places in my travels, and this was truly disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I would have enjoyed a second one had it not seemed like it was an inconvenience to get it.

nzbflDDW0vdR5ktrFK5MVw.text: Nothing special. Came in for lunch on a Saturday around 1. It was rather empty for a lunch time crowd. Regardless, the service was terrible. It took 15 minutes until someone came to take our order and double that time to get our food. For such an empty restaurant, I would have expected better service. The food was fine, nothing I would run back to. The cilantro rice was good.

W7DvG043tUr63Yt0wgZecw.text: Amazing food and service, When you go ask for ERIC, he was kind and answered all of my annoying tourist questions. My cup was never empty and their steak tacos are superb. The atmosphere is clean and comfortable with the casino within a few steps.

AXMjeeD1VAGyaQqkI98axw.text: I will give this place two stars because the service was pretty good. The food was another story.  Our waiter was very attentive and offered some great suggestions to start. One of which was the "drunken chicken nachos". We ordered a couple of them for our group and when it was brought over, one of the first comments was - " wtf is that smell?" I really am not sure what was added to those nachos, but it looked like a pile of crap. It didnt taste any better. So for entrees I think the majority of us either ordered the short ribs or the filet mignon. I guess since this was a Mexican place I should've ordered something else, so maybe this was my fault. But the waiter who took our order described the steak to be comparable to some NYC quaility steakhouse cuts. Steak looked nice and plated well but it was lacking some seasoning. Overall I would not recommend this place or ever go again. Afterwards I began to understand the name YOLO, I felt pretty sick and thought I was going to die. You definitely only live once after eating here.

nRqOAsylN1ciiNIb0_DQiA.text: The service is great, very neat interior design.  Lots of flavor in every dish and plenty of tequila in the ritas.  I would have ate here every night. Moderately priced as well.

mpl0lS1Y8hBXKOxJe3Z1-Q.text: I am from Texas, love Mexican Food and consider myself a connoisseur. Nonetheless, Yolos held up pretty well.   We went on a Saturday night and were seated immediately.   They start you off with some delicious salsa and chips. The salsa was tasted great with some smokey undertones. The chips though were a little flavorless, but that was remedied by a dash of salt.   For drinks we ordered the house and cadillac margaritas on the rocks. I am purest and would drink tequila and lime juice if they offered it. I am not sure how "pure" the house margarita was, but it past the taste test. I don't like cadillac margaritas as there are too many liquors in it so I won't review it.   I read some Yelp reviews about the street tacos so we had to order them. One order of chicken and one order of fish.  They brought out 3 soft tacos with sides of pico de gallo, guacamole, rice and beans. This what Mexican Food is all food: simple and inexpensive. Both were cooked perfectly and tasted great. The fish tacos were made with Mahi-Mahi, but I would have preferred a more authentic fish taco made with Tilapia.   I think I will try some other Mexican Restaurants before I come back.

tWEaJJfJ4YcRLZd3-Qdttw.text: Host was rude, rice was disgusting, their silverware was dirty. Won't recommend this place to anyone.

ZUrmKC3whn7MvyVWW_0HPg.text: Yum! Easy, semi-casual, DECENTLY PRICED (for Las Vegas? In a casino? A rarity!) and great service -- special birthday shoutout to our amazing waiter, Austin!  Pretty standard Mexican fare, and the margaritas are MEGA! The tableside-prepared guacamole is delicious and larger than expected, and the warm homemade tortilla chips are a pleasant diversion before the meal.   One tip of advice for the ladies: the floor here is practically made of ice. Meaning, if you wear heels, prepare to tiptoe across the super-slippery surface at the pace of a snail, or else you WILL fall, and it WILL be embarassing!

_s7wD7YZLDjTlno28nNydw.text: Do not go here!! Worst restaurant experience I've ever had!!  My boyfriend and I wanted to go to Earl of Sandwich, but when the line was too long we didn't want to wait so we decided to give Yolos a try. Worst decision EVER! When we got there the restaurant was empty and it was 12:30 which is prime time for restaurants. While that should have been a red flag we decided to give it a try anyway. When we were seated the hostess warned us that the waiter would take a while to get to us which I didn't understand because they weren't busy at all. Turns out she was right and we didn't get any service for a good 10 minutes. We thought about leaving but unfortunately stayed because the lunch special was in our budget.    When we finally ordered, our drinks didn't come out for another 10 minutes. The salsa was alright but not very spicy. I ordered the tamales and my boyfriend ordered the burrito-both on the lunch menu for $9 each. My tamales had barely any chicken and tasted bland, the rice had absolutely no flavor, and the black beans tasted like they were from a can. Not to mention the temperature of the food was scorching hot so I could barely eat it at first. My boyfriend stopped eating midway through his meal because he lost his appetite and he is quite the foodie. His burrito steak tasted like pot roast and there was no spice whatsoever. Burritos are not supposed to taste like pot roast people! GROSS! Our server was very polite but he was busy waiting on the entire restaurant by himself so service was extremely slow.   The only positive thing I have to say about this place is that the drink menu is illuminated which is pretty cool, and it has a hip vibe but looks can be deceiving! I was born and raised in Texas so I know how good Mexican food tastes like and this food is very far from it.  Bottom line is don't go here unless you want slow service and bland food.

ct0mnFAL_0VDYD8W2oczXQ.text: My wife and I hosted a 2 hour party on Saturday night, November 10, to celebrate my son's 21st Birthday.  We had about 30 people attend.  Staci Green and her staff were wonderful in their preparations and duties during the party.  Niko and Tony were outstanding in their duties behind the bar to ensure everyone had exactly what they wanted in very short order.  The food served was excellent and the drinks were top-notch as well.  We received many compliments from our party guest about the location, ambiance, food, and drink service.  If you are looking for a fun spot to host a gathering of party-goers in Las Vegas, then I can highly recommend Yolo's Mexican Grill and their bar area.  We had a great time and I'm sure you will too.

dFbKw6DFUJNbXVDqeS0EdQ.text: Yolos you get 4 Stars. You can only get the 5th star once you give Free chips and Salsa!! The Salsa selection though NICE!!  Out first night in Vegas and we can here. It was about 7:45 or so and the place was pretty full. We didn't have a reservation but were told it would be a 20 minute wait to be sat. No big deal. We saw two spots open up at the bar so we jumped in there!  It took a while for us to get service, but i can let that slide a bit when a place is busy. After getting service i was impressed =)  I ordered up some Chicken Fajitas and well those were the best i have had! Lots of chicken, lots of peppers. It came with some black beans and rice which were also very good. The GF selected the chicken Enchiladas and she said they were on the yummy side as well.  From sitting at the bar, the restaurant its self looked cool, but i never made it inside.

p3WnnnxmX5pHeXFIu84_2A.text: Hilary is the best manager ever, if you have an issue see her.   Christina the bartender is the best, she is there to serve and OH so hot. She has your beer down before you even you know.  Guillermo, what can I say. He backs up Christina and the two of them will make your day/night. Both can mix a strong drink.  Love this place!

i_zdBBUlowGVQQ1tsLO7yw.text: Picture it! Vegas...after a full day of drinking in the hot sun by the pool you wake up in the hotel room after a 2 hour power nap and you're ready to get ready for a big night out but then you realize you haven't had much to eat! We rolled into Yolos without a reservation around 11pm on a Saturday night and found 4 seat at the bar. The awesome bartender Chris was nice enough to first hook up our dehydrated asses with some waters and he kept our glasses refilled throughout our meal! I give him credit for not getting a cramp in his wrist! He made some great recommendations and answered our questions. The DJ begun playing some music just as we were getting settled and he was damn good! I was dancing in my seat from the minute I sat down until we paid our bill, I actually danced outta there. I think we should have just stayed at Yolos with the awesome DJ and Chris all night because the rest of Vegas was a bust that night. Anyway, I had the beef enchiladas with the cilantro rice and it was delicious! Yolos has fairly good Mexican food for Vegas and it's very reasonably priced! We'll be back Yolos!!!! See you soon Chris!!!

wG1gwjggDTAWrgFP-BRWRQ.text: The food wasn't very good. The enchiladas were more like microwave food and he fish tacos were dry :( The location isn't very nice too, right of the casino lobby. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

0qpBXqNhSFZRfAnyAHla6g.text: Order the ceviche!! You will not regret it..ask for extra tortilla chips though bc they don't give you enough..also on Saturday nights they have karaoke and if you actually sing you get a free shot!! Not a bad way to start off your night on the strip!

sDBrW-WEKldpV_4LgPIzPA.text: I always make it a point to stop here for the lunch specials. The salad is amazing with a dressing that has some kick.  What makes me come back every time is Nadjana, who makes me feel welcome and remembers me!  Talk about awesome service. Sit at the bar and Nadjana will make the meal taste better!

abD9PMzQBU5YWIC0FbGT6Q.text: we were gambling at planet hollywood and we were starting to get hungry. i noticed this place and it looked interesting. i was playing the penny slots and i ended walking away with 58 bucks.yay.. i treated mr h to yolos for lunch with my some of my winnings. it doesn't taste super heavy like some mexican food spots. i ordered the chicken street tacos and mr h had the chicken quesadilla, which he devoured. the food is so delicious and fresh. i can't wait to go back.

EAJR3weKXOqqkOwzvm-37A.text: Great service, easy to get a reservation, reasonably priced.  We had vegetable enchiladas and fish tacos, both were pretty good. Other friends had mushroom stuffed chilis...and yes their food looked better tasting than ours! oh well next time! :)

uEHVyKGZyCE5dR5q6CDfLA.text: I was excited to go here after reading reviews that said it was awesome - plus it was a late night at Planet Hollywood and our party of 4 was looking for some good food.  Instead we got poor service, mediocre food, and a high bill. Our party had fajitas, taquillos, and enchiladas, plus we ordered chips and salsa. Which would be worth a big bill if it the service and food made it worth it - which it didn't. We will never go there again, and recommend you don't either. There are so many choices in Vegas, why waste time at a crappy one?

90BDvq4HUKhxlQfG0cphug.text: This place rocks!  Glad I decided to stop here for dinner. The Salsa Trio was well worth the 5$ and the Fajitas were cooked perfect. Best of all, that Yolos Margarita!!! DAYUM! perfection. I will definitely become a regular at this place when my business brings me to Vegas.

lopaghGcgvC5QdQgFSzp2g.text: Took advantage of the lunch special. Ordered caesar salad and steak and chicken fajitas, and tortilla soup and carnitas.  Salsa and chips were far better than I expected. Both the soup and salad were quite good. The chicken fajitas and the carnitas were very bland, but nothing a little salsa couldn't fix. Tthe steak fajitas were delicious.  Service was good.

bSyZgcIX2RuqaHX2glx91w.text: Nico is the most amazing bartender! Just go to her section and have the best time. She's prettier than all the girls and gives you life!

HGx29mxEYEsHindxzbJ7Lw.text: had a blast drinking at the bar, drinks were a lil pricey but great...i think are bartenders names was damian or damon something like that but he started off kinda like whatever with us, then he saw we actually tipped and he hooked it up all night

op0paCZFJ9qTDTxJlgNATg.text: This review is for one of the friendliest bartenders, Guillermo (aka Diego).  He was very informative and welcoming. I dined alone at the bar waiting for my bf to finish up work and Guillermo was so helpful and kind.  He was accommodating of all my dietary food restrictions.  Thanks again, Guillermo.  Great job!

LmCQWK1PttYBYcfklzq_dA.text: My wife and I were quite hungry, and there was no wait time here, so we decided to try this place. She ordered the Quesadilla, which was quite ordinary, and I had the Enchilada, which was weird. The service was not the greatest either. I would look for a better restaurant in a place...

5KF74jVHE-oKL5sjdlOEvQ.text: Excellent enchiladas, especially for being on the strip. Drinks were strong and delicious. I kinda laughed though when the waitor made the "fresh" guacamole in front of us. I dont really think that was necessary...but the hostess was amazingly hot and there are a few good people watching tables in the restaurant

2xLfGcWVEDmhYIaotiIUzA.text: I am always on the strip working for the casinos. This is one of my preferred stopping places when I get off because they have a great happy hour special, unlimited chips, hot bartenders and really solid, authentic mexican food. That and unlike every other restaurant on the strip my wallet isn't $40 bucks lighter when I leave thanks to their killer deals.

s_bg0Czlw7BJtZnABbNxNQ.text: Excellent service from the bartenders, especially Christina.  I'm in town once a month for business and always make it a point to stop by and have dinner and drinks at the bar.  Usually Nico is bartending with Christina, and they are a great team.  Very friendly and outgoing.

HXcO_FnfkmBnLsMjAZq_vQ.text: Excellent service, surprisingly cool interior for a casino floor restaurant. Food was excellent but different. Went here for my Birthday craving nachos and got some very unexpected takes on what I ordered. Delicious, don't get me wrong. The salsa/dips were fantastic. Super friendly staff. Definitely check it out.

3nYIq4THGUOgQCAF-mkd7w.text: Very good and reasonable in pricing! The steak nachos are delicious! (Served prepared on the chips- you get maybe 6-8) We got that and one of the fajita dishes. For two people it was the perfect amount of food after alot of constant eating. And it was one of the cheapest meals we had!

fKt14iup6i6e1HRoc1Cg-A.text: I'm sorry to have to write this review because my wife and I have been to Yolo's often and have enjoyed it.  We own a store in the Miracle Mile shops which is attached to Planet Hollywood so we go by often.  On Froday September 9 we were first told we could not have a booth because they were reserved.  During our entire stay, the booths remained empty.  Then the chips were old and stale. Finally, the mahi mahi came out in a big cube and was absolutely raw in the center.  We sent it back and said we just wanted to leave, but were still charged for the other entree (also not eaten).  Unbelievable!  Never will we go there again.  They lost some very good customers....

70Q9o7rGzAFThC5NtooL8A.text: I wanted steak and my wife wanted Mexican. Guess who won. Arrived on a cold Wednesday night and there weren't many people so sat right down. We ordered the chips and salsa. It was pretty good. My wife ordered the drunken chicken nachos. Not your typical nachos. They said they were a little spicy. Not really. They were really good though. I ordered the Gaucho Steak. Appeared to be a sirloin and was supposed to be rubbed with red pepper. Looked and tasted a lot like black pepper. I was over cooked as well. Luckily the mushrooms, asparagus, and potatoes were good so not a total loss. Although not worth the price tag. I mentioned the doneness issue to the waiter and a manager offered us two deserts. We decided on the key lime creme brute and cheesecake. The creme brute was pretty good. The cheesecake was average but good fruit.

EK68DgExirwmT8GHSKKpAA.text: I am mistaken and I am sorry.  We were looking for your place and landed in obviously the wrong place called La Salsa Cantina, which is a useless place.  That place stinks.  We were at Planet Hollywood in the "shops" section.  We will definitely come and visit YOLOs  next time we are there and make it up to you.  Again, I do apologize.  The other place is bad and for all those who read this, avoid La Salsa Cantina!!!!!!  GO TO YOLOS!!!

sVvne24DH7q9Og_b979RdA.text: Used to visit Yolos every time when I used to commute to Vegas weekly a year or so ago, they used to have a white boy chef (used to see him doing table visits, very cool!!) and the food was always great then and consistant. The last few visits food has def' dropped off, doesn't seem like they have the love behind the scenes (kitchen). Service has improved, as they finally obviously have a mgr in there that cares to train the staff. I'll always be a fan, but GET THAT WHITE BOY BACK!!!!!!

QKYyAn22qgaQQ-0lcaIVqQ.text: We found this place on yelp and the reviews for this place are spot-on. The portion sizes are huge, the drinks are good, and the prices are reasonable. We went in for happy hour and got 3 large appetizers and 4 drinks for $25 bucks. The bartender was very nice also. The only reason this didn't get 5 stars was because of the hostess. When we asked her if we could have happy hour, she looked at us like we asked if she would eat us and then sat us in the dining room area (where they don't offer happy hour) and then proceeded to glare at us when we moved to the bartop for the rest of our meal. Other than that, Yolos was great. I would really reccommend it for happy hour if you're in or around PH.

H4ttqpZMh3fMk3cl3p6niQ.text: For the price, you really can't beat this place. It's not like the other overpriced restaurants on The Strip, so you can eat your fajitas and get filled up without getting your pockets emptied at the same time. Bring your appetite, as the portions are more than large enough.

tRAlK4qCaUiRwjrCElATIQ.text: So it's easy for me to review this place, because I only came here for one thing: a drink. The bartender was sweet, chatted us up, and made us a marvelous mojito to start off our afternoon. We even got a free shot of cachaca when we asked about it! Can't speak for the food, but hey, when a venue meets your needs and exceeds expectations, it's an easy recommendation to make!

GbGStdmOqZpns2FVxX5MuA.text: This was my first time at Yolo's. Chris the bartender was the best. He made us some unreal margaritas and everyone had a great time. His fun and friendly service definitely made it the best night it could be. The food is amazing and the portions actually fill you up. It's affordable too. I thought the guacamole was awesome. Super fresh and well prepared. I'm so happy I found Yolo's, it will be a go-to place every time I come to Vegas.

D1h-nhpvmrGgNQKBUHfcEQ.text: Reading the other reviews, I think we must have been here on a very off day for Yolos. There were 7 of us, all ready for a late (2pm) lunch. There were 2 other tables with customers when we were there-each with only 2 people at them. I say this because our service was terrible. Terrible. It took several minutes to get a table ready for us, because the hostess was so careful about getting the napkins and menus placed "just so" on our table. We were there for 1.5 hours total, and had time for only 1 drink because of the poor service. We were thinking that perhaps we were on a "hidden camera" show because we truly felt ignored. The worst thing, however, was a long hair found in one of my group's dish. I know it does happen, and was thankful it wasn't my dish! Having complained about service, I must say that the food was quite good. Sadly, the service really pulled the star rating way down. Again, having read the other reviews, I think we had to have been there on an off-day.

Xb806rxO7CdhNcDnUcLPzQ.text: This place has been consistently consistent! In terms of food, service, prices every time I visited Vegas. I give them a solid 4 stars:-  Was in Vegas recently and after many hours travel time, checking in, and dropping bags, was not ready to have a full dining experience. What I really like about this place is efficiency & good quality for $$ spent.  I believe kitchen closes at 10 pm, we arrived 9:30 and sat at the bar. Bartenders shared what's happening that weekend, and gave some good tips. I ordered the Mahi Mahi street tacos, delicious, plentiful, hit the spot, highly recommend them. Cost was $16, ordered Dos Quis Draft Lager $6.. very reasonable as well.  There was a DJ there spinning tunes and we are feet from the Planet Hollywood casino, so lots of energy all around. I'll def be back!

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mahi Mahi Tacos!

CpGGQqZXb1_azPvVHQw77g.text: Well, the Service was fantastic. The food was good, not great. For as many places to eat in Vegas, I'm not sure if this would be at the top.

6eOaC60rNJjZcnLDjVoPAw.text: Decent Mexican food at a good Las Vegas price, service on point and quick, and drinks that appeal to anyone.  And it can easily accommodate large groups.  On the drink menu the Pink Cadillac is listed before the Best Buddy Margarita.  This is also representative that the Pink Cadillac (aka Watermelon Margarita) is better than the other margarita flavors (strawberry, raspberry, or mango).  It is sweet (it is a flavored margarita after all), and comes with a slice of watermelon so it must be healthy.  Also watermelon liqueur, which I need to go get some now.  A lot of drinks were ordered by the table, and everyone was satisfied with their choice.  On to the food, and first the appetizers.  It's a Mexican place, so of course one needs to partake in chips and guac.  The guacamole is made fresh at your table, with tomato, onion, jalapeno, cilantro and lime juice.  The presentation is nice, the guac is fresh, and the flavor simple.  The portion of chips is appropriate for the amount of guacamole, but you can ask for more too.  Also under the appetizers are Tostadas, which can come in Chicken Tinga or Beef Machaca.  These are large open tacos with lots of fixings.  The Chicken Tinga came with more flavor than the Beef.  By the time that my entree, the Mexican Gulf Shrimp Street Tacos, arrived I was pretty full.  All tacos come with the options of black or pinto beans, and Mexican or Cilantro rice.  I opted for the cilantro rice, but did not detect any flavor from the cilantro, only the green coloring.  The Shrimp Tacos themselves were seared nicely, and the pineapple-garlic marinade was reminiscent of my time in more tropical locations than Las Vegas.

F-dBW24TH-xyu84idV6iGQ.text: Dined here for the first time tonight as we randomly stumbled upon this spot while passing through Planet Hollywood. Our server by the name of Reagan helped us and was extremely friendly and helpful as to what dishes he recommended. We ordered the fried fish tacos, and the Fajita combination with chicken and shrimp. Both were delicious! We also ordered the Flan per his recommendation, and we weren't disappointed!! Reagan was very attentive and very knowledgeable on the food. Service was excellent, and food delicious!! Would definitely recommend this place for a quick bite.

dF8x1IUMOj440dKAFb5HIQ.text: Coastal Ceviche -- loved the acidic punch of the lime. Very refreshing. But more shrimp chunks than anything. Was good, but nothing something I would get again.   Steak tacos -- dry steak meat, and nothing flavorful about it either, and no toppings. The rice that was provided was kind of hard and crunch, as if old, or under cooked.   Nice bartender, who took our takeout orders, and she also gave us glasses of water to sip on while we waited.   The atmosphere/vibe here might be better than the food, but it was conveniently located, and the food came out quickly. Good enough for a quick bite/snack on the go.

vcaMSuhAqdQEHTvrQEiEXw.text: The server was nice but the chef got pissed off at us. We asked for a bean and cheese burrito for my sons twice and put onions and jalapenos in  it with spicy sauce on top they messed up on my wife's order. Then they charged us 13 dollars for the burrito. We will never come back here again. Because of this experience

ddgZfCRZX1mmHQY71L62_Q.text: Meh kinda says it all. There is a reason the only restaurant at ph that have a wait is the two that are worth eating at. This is not really one of them. The wife liked her enchiladas and the chips and salsa are good but it's a tourist trap on the strip. My fajitas where bland and lacking the cheapest thing in fajitas, the veggies! The guacamole is pretty good however the service is also just meh. The managers kept eyeing the room wanting to help but didn't really know where to assist. Not a bad spot to grab a snack at the bar but loud club music and meh service and food make it no bueno for dinner.

Q0DUqhge1C2jKSkrkPerWg.text: Stopped by yolo to eat dinner before a show. We all got margaritas- very good. Table side guacamole was awesome as well as the salsa! We all ordered the beef burritos and one of us said it was the best burrito they've ever had. The waitress took a while to greet but once our order was placed, the food came out in 5 minutes. Very good!

Bomw-7LadqC__bvzkav39w.text: Omg I love this place. Came here for karaoke one night and had a blast. Was kind of disappointed a little because they had it advertised that if you sing you get a free jello shot and when we were there they werent doing it anymore. I always come here for happy hour after work. I work in the mall there. The bartender Nady she is amazing and always there when i come, super friendly. She knows exactly what I want ( the quesadilla and margarita on the rocks) always my go to after a long day at work.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cant beat this.

6Ow2MiOxGm_M6X40YifIRw.text: "Amazing service from Nico and Thays!!  I can't say enough good things about YOLOS!  The ambiance is great, the food is exceptional and the bar crew of (Nico, Thays, Moe, Alex and Max) is SUPERB! They took care of our entire group of eight and made the entire experience a lot of FUN! The Street Tacos are.... AMAZING and the Chicken Taquitos are great for starters. I highly recommend this bar and restaurant inside of Planet Hollywood!!!

uutWNMepgSqIYwILuBfLOw.text: The food was delicious, and the service was phenomenal.  We had Reagan as our server, and he was fantastic!  My 8 year old son accidentally dropped his drink and broke the glass, about 5 minutes after we sat down.  The poor kid was mortified, but Reagan, the hostess, and the busboy were so quick to clean it up, and incredibly understanding and kind.  For dinner, I had the Papas y Queso street tacos, and my son had the chicken tenders.  Our food came out quickly, and was great.   I'm so happy we chose this place for dinner.  Thank you for a great evening!

NLJA_gmfMlzBFkyaCefbGw.text: My review is mainly for the drinks as I haven't ate there. I ordered 1 Big Daddy Caddy and 1 Pink Cadillac. Both of them being margaritas the Pink Cadillac had actual watermelon flavor slightly sour but it's as expected and tasted delicious. As for the Big Daddy Caddy had a more sour lemony taste. So out of those 2 I would say the Pink Cadillac is a must try. You can also build your own margarita if you'd like which I thought was pretty interesting. Bartenders were really friendly and didnt mind explaining the drinks. Not to mention the drinks and good service they have really great music Saturdays if you like Latin night behind the bar they have a decent sized dance floor. Overall it's such a good time.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Pink Cadillac
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Daddy Caddy
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build your own margaritas

243eOXPec4ATUski-6ItGA.text: Wife and I stopped here for a quick lunch before heading out on the strip. We had the lunch special and some ceviche. Food was excellent as well as the service. I'm always looking for a good taco for a decent price. This was one

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7lbvWB3gcSYrL8DDf28FDw.text: My friend and I stopped in to Yolos before a show at AXIS in Planet Hollywood.  We had never heard of this place but it was close to the entrance of the theater and we were craving margaritas.    We decided to sit at the bar and were promptly greeted by a bartender.  The service we received was excellent.  The girls behind the bar were very attentive and friendly.  Both my friend and I ordered a margarita which came in a huge glass and was delicious!  However, the food left something to be desired.  we placed an order for queso but it came out looking (and tasting) like cheese in a can that had been melted down.  In addition to that, I ordered a taco trio which came with a generous portion of rice and beans.  But, when I picked up the first taco, it immediately split in two and the taco filling fell onto my plate! I would not go out of my way to visit this place again.  If I do end up in Planet Hollywood again, I'd opt for just drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JARq70gr_NH4RnlkdW2J-Q.text: For the overpriced food this place is ehhhh. Worst customer service.  Waitress never came back to the table to see if we needed anything. Don't eat here

fT5Xntk6X-aYr2Mo73CgWg.text: Delicious food! I was pleasantly surprised. The margarita was also delicious! Fun place.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g4ndKgOfUERRsFTzawSu1g.text: Cool little Mexican spot in the Planet Hollywood hotel that offers a great happy hour menu which includes drink and food specials. The bar is fun to sit at, the bartenders are there to make sure you have an enjoyable experience. The steak tacos were full of flavor and overall delicious. We had a couple beers and then it was time to go so they poured our beer in a plastic cup and we hit the strip. Stop in for a bite.

jwh9z8c8DEvtmPMVoz51eg.text: I have lived in Las Vegas most of my life and this is by far the worst food I have ever eaten in town. My friends and I stopped here because it was the closest thing when we decided we were hungry and it was a huge mistake. I ordered the carnitas enchiladas which came with a side of rice and beans. The table unanimously decided the rice tasted like microwave rice and the refried beans were so pale, thin, and runny that had they been shown to me anywhere else I would not have guessed they were supposed to be refried beans, they certainly didn't have any refried bean flavor left to them. The red sauce on my enchiladas was weird, closer to a marinara then anything I've ever had on Mexican food. When we were initially served 2 of our 5 orders were completely wrong plates. If you are hungry and near here please go anywhere else.

JKoPUnFX7Hdjw5ImYCOqWQ.text: Our group of 6 women enjoyed our experience at Yolo so much! Food was delish, service was kind and fast! We will be back!

ul3ehmehcZWnousKtN2b5A.text: Put it simply... food was awful and the service was just okay. Plus, the prices were high for such bad food.

VvNZOeVYcP7wsIy_Q2BSgA.text: This was my favorite spot while visiting Las Vegas!! Alex, Max and Chris were the best bartenders I have ever had. I highly recommend this place for dinner, drinks and late night entertainment!!

sm4PIRscuf-n-T-0hexPkw.text: This place needs bar rescue. Drinks are horrible. The food was so undercooked. We left most of it. If you want cafeteria food, this is the place to eat.   Don't Order the Sangria, unless you want grape juice and wine.  Tasted like a tin can. The steak picado was raw was half the fat on the steak with each bite.  The entire Planet Hollywood is less than favorable.  NEVER AGAIN !!!!!!!!!!!

HbwfxJhNgBiOiendVju3WA.text: this place is a bit tricky to find but it is a great place get the margarita you will be disappointed

xfDlt_ocQqDgJJ8g5L6h8g.text: I've been to YOLOS many times and while I can always be assured that the roasted vegetable fajitas will be delicious, the quality of service is a hit or miss. Usually it is leaning on the bad side, though.   Their fresh fruit lemonades are tasty and fresh, as well, but I am always disappointed that I pay $4 for only a few ounces of the stuff (about 1/3 the size of their sodas), and that there are no free refills! Come on, YOLOS.  I would give 3 stars, but the fajitas are just that damn good...

7dsVvhofwqJRC24HJVV6Qw.text: I had the large shrimp fajitas and they were fantastic. The service was fast and friendly. I will return!

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qjFoDRr77SYCp3zoBD3S1w.text: Alright for a hotel restaurant, very dry beef. No flavor to fajitas. Staff was attentive and the food was served quickly

Jlio7_AYNywJJdTmPAXkbQ.text: So we hit up Yolos since we were staying at Planet Hollywood and it had some pretty good Yelp reviews.    It sits off to the side of the casino floor and the bar seemed to be the place to be!  The restaurant was empty on the other hand.  When we stopped in before the Donny Clay show there were a lot of empty tables and a lot of dirty plates and napkins on them.  I don't know if they were short handed or what, but even though they had 20+ open tables we had to wait for the hostess to clean one up for us.  The plus was she let us pick the table we wanted so we got a nice spot to people watch.    Service was attentive - almost overly so - we had a waiter who came by every 3 minutes to see if we needed anything else.  After awhile it was like yeah - a moment to ourselves!!!  That aside the food was good.  I had the street tacos and they were tasty.  The house margarita was huge and had a nice kick.    It was a good spot, but doubt I would be back.  Been there, one that.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips &amp; Salsa

PvWmFImzZxMFvtDzmLgu6Q.text: NEVER AGAIN! Came here last Saturday for lunch some friends of mine got the chicken tacos and i got the sea bass. Chicken tacos were completely dry and the sea bass gave me the worst case of food poisoning. Definitly ruined my time in vegas. Thanks yolo's please shut down.

SEFlnvdlXE0Qqdg_KUgVbQ.text: My girlfriend and I met my dad here for a little Cinco de Mayo treat while we were visiting for the week.   We had Gustavo as a server....he was pretty bad. He was either overwhelmed or distracted b/c he only checked on us a few times, and we ended up drinking somewhere else b/c of how bad he was. We were ready to spend a bunch of money on margaritas, but his service left us w/ a bad taste in our mouth.   The hostess...on the other hand (not sure what her name was, but she had dark hair & was pretty cute) did a GREAT job. She was very welcoming, professional, and friendly. Plus, anytime were called her over (which was a few times) she took care of us immediately  with drinks, water, etc.   Food was pretty good. They make the guac in front of you (I'm always a fan of that). My dad got enchiladas (not sure which ones). He said they were just okay. He mentioned a few times that the enchiladas and the black beans were missing something. My GF and I had some tacos. I had the Shrimp ones (Shrimp Baja  perhaps?), and they were pretty good. The shrimp was a different flavor than I had expected, but different in a good way!  The location wasn't bad, and the "ambiance" was pretty good. It was a little on the darker side (not like Darth Vader dark, but with minimal lighting LOL).  I know it is Vegas, and every drink is $15+, but I would have appreciated a bigger margarita glass. The ones we were served was not impressive for the amount. Overall, the flavors for the margs were pretty damn good.

B0Xu--oE8RTlt5mR0YsggA.text: A) the shrimp and Carne Asada tacos are Fantastic. Spanish rice is delicious. And the steak fajitas are legendary. B) and more importantly, sit at the bar. Nico and Moe are awesome, enjoy their great personalities and Stacy has a fabulous smile. A hidden gem. We will be back!

56kSatjFL6TnE9zmm7eGQA.text: I was pleasantly surprised with Yolos, I'd say it gets a 3.5, but I'll round up because I was not expecting to like it.   My husband and I had just checked into our room at PH and were borderline hangry, so we needed some food in our bellies pronto. We downed the chips and salsa like it was our job until we could have a rational conversation again, and then ordered some drinks. I tried the jalapeno cucumber margarita, which was excellent, but my advice is to drink it fast because after sipping it for a while the jalapenos definitely infused the liquid and it got SUPER spicy.   For my entree, I ordered the vegetable enchiladas with cilantro rice, and they were excellent, stuffed full of lots of grilled veggies. The rice was very flavorful as well.   All in all, nothing spectacular, but a tasty, reasonably priced choice.

hQCg_EyzUnRCLs9HOtmu1w.text: No id, no admittance. No shorts, no table. Take out it is. It's cool, I like room delivery anyway.   Tortilla soup was way too salty. Quesadilla was bland.  Three stars alone for THE BEST guac and chips I've ever had! And to think in a Vegas hotel of all places. This is their saving grace.

5RL2NDBVobkZrG9dLpCKTw.text: I went to Yolos during my recent stay at PH for dinner on a Saturday night.  At around 7, the bar was pretty full but there were plenty of tables available.  I ordered the tortilla soup to start and was forewarned that it was spicy.  The small was a nice sized portion with big chunks of chicken.  It was very spicy and needless to say cleaned out my sinuses (but still, very good).    For dinner I had the tostada salad with grilled chicken.  The salad was pretty big with roasted corn, black beans and avocados.  The servers were very friendly and the food came out really quickly. I wouldn't mind coming back and trying their margaritas and nachos!

6d6Bw4wQRpnTvVkvJMzIaA.text: I've had better but I've also had worse.  That's the best I could say about the food at this place.  It's a bit overpriced as well.  It's not a 3 star... more a 2.5 star.    I ordered the pork poblino and it was decent.  Nothing really to shout home about.  I'm from San Diego so of course there are tons of Mexican restaurants down here and fast food places that you can get tastier food and pay way less...   One thing that bothered us though was that our friend ordered the steak nachos.  The guy brought out steak tacos because that's what he thought she said.  Instead of saying "oh I'm sorry, let me fix the problem," he basically said, "i heard tacos"... like he it was her fault and he wasn't going to help... that was a bit rude... part of customer service is being nice and making sure that if the ordered is screwed up then you see how you can make it better... he did not attempt to do any of that... FAIL!   I really wouldn't come back but I wouldn't tell someone they should never eat there... I would just tell them to find a better option for Mexican food if they can.

SwxLYFFaci1MmmgDA-e3Kw.text: We ate here for lunch with friends who were visiting from out of town last week. They had a decent (for the strip) lunch special which was various entrees for $9.95 with optional $5 margaritas.  Everyone except me opted for the special.... sadly, there were no veggie or fish options on the special menu, which meant that my food and drink came out to a whopping $29.  My shrimp tacos were pretty forgettable, I barely touched my beans and rice, and you have to pay for chips and salsa. Lame.  I'm not normally a cheapskate, I swear, but for mediocre food at lunchtime? No thanks. Instead of bang for my buck, Yolo provided a whimper.  You only live once... so go eat somewhere else.

4VQT7tJMw1HARGSYsNE_Qg.text: Great food, great staff. We were very well taken care of and the food was fast and amazing. I highly recommend the steak fajita burrito with the green Chili sauce. I will eat there every time we do to Vegas. Large portion sizes and excellent value in pricing. Very clean and not packed in on top of other diners.

wP9sdXjctUFJrSQK8USnkQ.text: It's funny I've never heard about Yolo's mexican grill inside Planet Hollywood before. Some friends and I were starving and were looking for a place to eat. We used the touch screen menu located in the casino and then glimpsed at the menu Yolo's offered. It sounded really yummy so we all agreed to eat there. I must say..I didn't expect Yolo's to be so wonderful.   WOW! What stood out the most was the fantastic service we had! Thanks to our server CJ (lady) she did a fabulous job. Friendly, funny, and a delight. We asked for her recommendations on food and drinks and she delivered. I had chicken enchiladas with cilantro rice and black beans..YUM! We had steak nachos as our appetizer - double yum! and for drinks, I got the strawberry mango margarita! that topped it off. The prices are moderate ranging from $8-$30.   I recommend anyone to head to yolo's for lunch or dinner. I will definitely bring my family and friends here :)

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken enchilada with cilantro rice and black beans
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Nachos for appetizers
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xljBFWaGahEtEPK4HN7-iQ.text: Pleasantly surprised with this one.   We just wandered in trying to find a quick but tasty lunch that wasn't a burger or sandwich and were pretty impressed with the quality of food here.    I had the carnitas street tacos, which come three to a plate.  There are also shrimp, chicken and fish options.    The big hunks of shredded pork were plentiful but they were a little bland on their own.  With the addition of some great fire roasted salsa and guacamole though they were delicious and very filling.  I definitely couldn't finish all three.    The double white corn tortillas were very lightly fried just to give them some tooth so they were sturdy enough to hold up.   That was great.  I hate when the tortilla tears and falls apart and you end up with a mess.   My companion had the beef enchiladas, which were topped with a green chili sauce.   They too were moist and the beef was shredded and plentiful.. but they were a bit too salty for me.    Each plate comes with rice and beans.   We tried each type of rice and the cilantro rice was the clear winner for me. The other option was "Mexican rice" and it was your standard tomato-based concoction, just not super flavorful.   We didn't bother trying the black beans, we were both just too full.   Plenty of beer and tequilas to go with... all in all a good bet (ha.. no pun intended)... and quite a substantial amount of food for your money.  I would go back.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnitas Street Tacos

foGWDdkIUStOeekTiviXJQ.text: In the mood for Mexican food, I decided to try YOLOS for the first time on this recent trip. I found the food to be excellent and right to my liking.  The service it top notch, friendly, food delivered quickly and the food is tasty.   After trying it for the first time on the second say of my trip, I made it a point to eat there every day on my trip, and I did.  And I'll eat there again. The location is great, right near the casino action and by the sports book. I had the chili relleno and I loved it.  I also tried the tamales from the lunch special menu and enjoyed those.  The chicken enchiladas, which I had for lunch on my final day in town, were good. I love the black beans. Well seasoned. My favorite drink I had there was the Mexican Sidecar.  It was very good. I'll be back to eat there next time I stay on the Strip.

FKsOpZYpp8mJs0UGSHBNnw.text: Always recognized and welcomed by Nico and Chris. Service at the bar is excellent and friendly. I only visit Vegas a few times a year, yet I am always welcomed as a regular here.

ivKzfX5P0-DdpNa4Ms2o-Q.text: I thought this place was delicious and priced fairly. Service was great, as was our food. My favorite thing, however, was the hostess. Some...older....gentleman proposed dining with my friend and me, and would not leave us alone. The hostess saw what was happening and swept us away. She put a reserved sign on the table next to us so those gentleman couldn't sit there and ruin our dinner. Perfect!

4JKieUcHPYyRpcFH5PBjiQ.text: Grabbed lunch here - and it was OK - nothing stellar, but OK.  The super nice (read: HOT) bartender told us she 'accidentally' made our margaritas strong.  Except it seemed that the margaritas were pumped out of the spout that coke and seltzer came out of.....so.....not so strong  The food was good - and the salsas seemed fresh and interesting.  and it was a nice place to perch and watch all the people living it up and getting rowdy midday on a Saturday....a little extra hot sauce for your fish tacos....without a $20 cover.

Ll-e633wTH1cJW71OUoMnw.text: We stopped here for lunch and were pleasantly suprised. They have lunch specials for $9.95, my husband had the steak street tacos with rice and beans and I had the chicken burrito with rice and beans.  The food was delicious, very tasty and filling. The street tacos(3)  had real steak not the usual carne asada and the beans were whole black beans that were delicious.  My chicken burrito was shredded white meat with onions, cheese and sauce on top.  A lot of food for the price, we were not hungry until very late that evening.  Their chips and salsa were also very good.  The service was excellent, we loved the music that was playing.  I will definately return to eat here on my next trip to Vegas.

NAFe-ZZ1xChYwcFLzvPo2Q.text: I had a great experience here at Yolo's Mexican Grill! I would consider it the best restaurant that we visited during our trip! I mean it's not super fancy or anything but the atmosphere was great, the food was great, the customer service was awesome!  Our server, Todd (i believe), was extremely nice. They make the guacamole right in front of you which is fun! It was hella good! The chips were hot and fresh!! Then when you add the freshly made guacamole.... OH MAN! I can't even describe... lol You definitely need to order it if you eat here!  They had a lunch special with a salad and an entree for 12.99 i believe... that is what my friend and i did. You can also add a margarita to your lunch for 3.99 which is great!  Our server was great with making sure that everything i ordered was made vegan friendly and he was extremely nice about it! It is amazing how much your server's kindness can affect your experience at a restaurant! Anyway, i ordered a salad minus the sprinkled cheese that was on top and i also got the veggie enchiladas without cheese.. The rice and black beans were also vegan. The food was amazing and i was super excited to be eating a REAL meal after the previous day of eating nothing but bland, cooked vegetables at other restaurants because those were the only veggie options they had.  If you're staying at the Planet Hollywood Resort or you just want a good lunch.. come here! =)

JxAAH96xNWVOc2BeedYg9A.text: worst. nachos. ever.  Service was not great, and the place only had a few people there. Only 3 people were in our party and the server charged us gratuity and tried to sneak it in by just giving us the total for the bill. Not impressed

1W4Afi83yWRiQRyiWwyEng.text: Hidden gem in Las Vegas! I would not have found this place if it had not been for another conference attendee who mentioned it to me. I went with a group of 5 and we had an amazing time. The server was full of personality and made the experience very enjoyable. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and made quite a few suggestions on items that we would not normally have ordered. Most of the group ordered the street tacos, but my friend got the pollo rostizado (which was amazing!). The chips are hot and fresh with yummy salsa. We also ordered the guacamole, which is made at the table (highly recommend). I actually may go back tonight....and with all of the awesome restaurants in Las Vegas, that is saying a lot!

M-uvhAdT2Vg3nyk4dirarw.text: the girls and i decided to have brunch here because we needed to stay close by the hotel to wait for our arriving friend and my sister recommended the spot.   before entering, we preview the framed menu on the wall to see if there's anything that looks or sounds appetizing.  apparently, there was a lunch special for $12, that included (from what i remembered) the house margarita for $4ish, a choice of entree on the Lunch special selection, salad and chips and salsa. i remember looking at the entrees separately, and thinking the lunch special was a better deal.    from the lunch special menu, i ordered the carne asada street tacos with mexican rice and a margarita,  which i had  frozen. all were really satisfying. having sides of guacamole, salsa and lemon really helped add a zest of flavor to the tacos. the margarita was extremely refreshing. kinda frothy, but super tasty. sometimes i crave their margaritas, and then start craving margaritas in general. ahh! im craving it now!   the decor of the restaurant is up to date and chic. really neon bright crazy hues. a very fashionably hip mexican restaurant thats for sure.   the only complaint i have is the service. we came around 11am, and the restaurant was hardly packed. it took decades to get the waitress to get our orders. then it took another 6 years for them to bring out our food. we spent at least 130-2 hours there.   im definitely dining here again, when i'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bean and rice that came with the tacos
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne Asada Tacos.

2iZiscRy3JUOMCh3Nt8LTg.text: Full bar, One of the best in Vegas. Partly because of the food and the ambiance, but mostly because of the staff. Everyone was helpful, knowledgeable and more importantly all around fun! It was easy to spend hours there just drinking and having a good time before going out to the clubs. Britney was by far the best, between her original custom drinks, she was just so much fun and took care of everyone! If this review hasn't persuaded you to give this place a try, at least give it a shot for Britney! She'll make sure you have a good time and you'll end up coming back.

audZpSfVj3UYP30Fy919jQ.text: Ignore the reviews about this place being expensive. It's not Taco Bell! The prices are very reasonable and the food delicious. On one of our visits the service wasn't up to par and I found out the server was let go shortly after. They really do care about customers at Yolo's.

j_vfUSuWn3nHJs4DgxzaJA.text: The salsa was good. The fish tacos were kinda boring. Needs a zesty creamy sauce. Also, it was about 30% more expensive than it should have been. Service was iffy.

Vhb_rmsVChT11Wwg_9LtOw.text: Not the best.  Queso was horrible by my husbands standards.  He said Chili's was much better.  Skip this place and go somewhere else

FR6ICw5Gslef0DuGzhoKbg.text: I was VERY pleasantly surprised with their Mexican food.  I ordered the combo lunch with a beef burrito and carnitas street taco with cilantro rice and black beans.  The burrito was huge and so was the taco.  Way too much food for just me, especially when you factor in the the salsa trio and Queso Fundido (a glob of cheese with charizo mixed in...YUMMY!) we ordered.  I suggest them all.  And the Chile Crusted Mahi-Mahi street tacos...I sampled them off a friend's plate & wish I had ordered them too!

nXCugLJUVhJt-KG1_u8RPg.text: The drinks are very good and priced reasonably. The food is good, but not great. The staff are very friendly and attentive. The atmosphere is relaxed and fun. I will definitely be back!

kBusmBI-xTaL_mRScBJPgg.text: I would normally guve Yolos a 5 for great Mexican food, but the salsa is so bland since they changed it!  Beer selection is good.  Enchiladas are good - but someone needs to taste that salsa!!  No kick at all!  Come on Yolos!  Bring it back!!

wTwPMyBtGDaEXScmWTqd3g.text: What happened to the amazing salsa they were famous for????  Everytime we're in Vegas we make sure to have dinner there, but not anymore.  Their salsa and food have lost the flavor we loved so much.

mMdJlk3KcgBJdZ_DXgAQAA.text: Christina was awesome! Great food, good atmosphere, great service.

wXhgsyI7uP5tbt2HavnY1A.text: One of the top bars in vegas, it's a really great time...bar tenders are awesome nico,nady, and moe

0E-I3xH2cy_bwiZhrKBOZg.text: I was really, really impressed with this place. We walked in on our way back from north-mid strip to the Luxor for a bite to eat in the midafternoon. It appeared to be a really basic hotel type restaurant -- mediocre food for a high price. But we were hungry and had 4.5 hours until our 9pm dinner reservations. We just needed a snack.  The chips and salsa were really good (the chips came out so hot it hurt a little to eat them at first), the guacamole was good, and both the ceviche was good and the taquitos were fine. My girlfriend claims that her strawberry margarita was the best she has ever had. They use real fruit to make their fruit margaritas, so I suppose it's not all that surprising.  The prices were perfectly reasonable.  Vegas' latest trend appears to be the "sexy" mexican restaurant. This was not that, but it was tasty... surprisngly so.

5k-i2tyofdhXp88nyWgU8g.text: Got in late from the East Coast and I was hungry from a 5 hour flight. I love Mexican food (See reviews) and saw that my Hotel had one.  Hard to think that any of these enormous hotels on the Strip would not have a little of everything hen it comes to food!    I made a quick choice of the Mahi-Mahi Taco's and a Fat Tire beer.  A good combo for me! The Taco's were outstanding with great flavor and a nice piece of fish in each one.  The Guacamole was not so good, might have been the batch, but it had to much lemon/lime juice in it.  This is a good restaurant.  I sat at the bar and the service was good.

BTVdB1HrrZ22OalLYRpxlw.text: We tried this place a couple of times and really like the food.  Drinks are okay and small though. Recommendations: Guacamole and Fajitas - we found these to be really good dishes

MwQyRUId_OncaThORbp6uw.text: Sunshine Mejia was great...just as great as the Margorona! Good Times!

ylnzoW_1A3Ep0S_bR-d91w.text: I ate here for a work dinner in and it was alright.  We had chips and salsa, asada, strawberry drink, tamales, and it was all decent.  The carmel flan looked nasty and none of us would eat it ;))  Service was  a bit slow in the server bringing us drinks and water.  It is in odd location towards back.

4z8vmY2EF3Kaf2r5vJB6Wg.text: It gets two stars because the guacamole was really good. We had a work event so I tried the Filet Mignon. Very poorly cooked. Dry and grey on the outside. Not sure if the Mexican food was any good. I would not go back even if I was staying at PH. There is better Mexican food on the Strip

tsrm5I67TyBifpTkcBzTcA.text: I went to Yolos a few months back for a friends birthday. We were very excited to go here because of their fresh fruit margs they advertised online. We got to our reservation on time and the 2 girls standing there told us it would be over an hour wait. Well, needless to say we had just walked all the way from another hotel and we figured we could wait.  When we got seated we got served chips and salsa immediately and we were starving so that was nice. We obviously ordered drinks right off the bat. The server that was bringing us our drinks got knocked into and down went a margarita all over my leg and my friends. They apologized, but didnt offer to give us a towel or comp one of the drinks.   We werent going to let that put us down- we are in VEGAS! so we got our food and that made up for everything. I got the roasted vegetable enchiladas and my boyfriend got the street tacos. I also ordered the cilantro rice, which I was expecting to be bland. It was probably the best rice I have ever had (and I'm not a big rice fan)    I haven't had Mexican food better than this yet.

zVIBt5U-_4W6n_Cg-xKhOw.text: Great Margaritas, standard food.  Any time I find myself in the PH, I try to find a reason to mosey over to Yolo's bar so that I can down 1 or 5 blended strawberry margaritas.  I've only eaten here twice, and both times the food was acceptable, but nothing to write home about.  One time a person in our party didn't even get an order taken, which was rather frustrating.    Overall a cool place, just not a place I recommend for a bite.

0eF_UdhLdHNRHHvFWDk-dA.text: I had a romm in Planet Hollywood and upon checking in they gave me a coupon Yolos. Buy and entree and get a free margarita... So I decided to go there for lunch Why not right?! Free margarita? I'm so there!  I was in Vegas solo for a business trip so I sat at the bar. The bartender was friendly and recommended a few things on the menu, talked to me from time to time. She was very nice. I chose the street tacos combo since she said it was the best on their menu. She was so right! I had the combo of steak, carnitas & shrimp. I also received fresh salsa and chips, rice, beans and fresh guacamole. The shrimp had to be hands down my fave! The mango salso/sauce with it complimented the marinated shrimp excellently.   The margarita was huge! Took me a while to finish it but I savored every last drop. =)

GSjXpBbMViRG2gEixKDBrg.text: Yuck. Without a doubt the most tasteless, bland Mexican food ever. Salad was greens with a jalepeno vinaigrette  that equated to oil covered field greens. Dinner was a steak that lacked even salt served with bland rice and watery black beans. Margarita was passable but short on both lime and tequila. Friends took us to dinner, so I shouldn't complain, but no one should pay for this disaster. Avoid, avoid, avoid.

umd3FMXrVEacrWAqdJ8-rQ.text: Ladies, if you're checking into Planet Hollywood for a girls weekend, stop here before you go out for the night! Men, do the same so the ladies have something to look at!  I was the un-official "concierge" of our Las Vegas weekend and knew that upon arrival we would be starving and ready to eat. I Yelped PH for on-site restaurant so that we could eat...stat. Yelp came through and gave us this tasty jewel! Upon check-in, I asked the gentleman at the desk if he could make a reservation for us, which he happily did! Bonus!  Atmosphere was inviting, hip, and un-pretentious. I was very impressed with the price-point vs. atmosphere...in Vegas, many restaurants depend on a so-called "hip" environment to allow them to boost their prices. Not Yolos! $12 for 3 tacos and rice & beans....and this is after you fill up on their complimentary chips and salsa!  LOVED the chips & fire-roasted tomato salsa. You know you're food is going to be great when the chips are fresh and warm, and the salsa is fresh and tasty. Our server, Todd, made sure that he kept them coming. He also prepared a beautiful table-side guacamole (worth the $8, both price and presentation were spot-on.)  My girls each ordered an alcoholic beverage (I don't drink) . The raspberry margarita was made with fresh berries and Todd even brought a to-go cup for the left-overs...which is why we love Vegas that much more!  Ok...the food, I know I'm taking forever, but you know you want these details! Three of us ordered tacos (carnitas, steak & shrimp) & three of us loved them! I ordered carnitas, cause I'm a pork junky, and I tried the shrimp which was outstanding! Friend the fourth ordered chicken fajitas which were your standard fajitas platter with all the fixins' However, the chicken was plentiful and tasted great!  My only disappointment was the rice and beans...not enough flavor here, AND the margarita fountain that wasn't! I was expecting some kind of rockin' show-piece and it was a lit-up tower with a nozzle...behind the bar. I totally had visions of "weezin' the juice!" Boo!  I would come back to Yolos on another trip, and I would sample a few of the appetizers next time! I'm looking forward to it!  Go here.

mlRixIttpt8-5fYi18_Bew.text: Friday night, after check in, before night on the town.... quick meal and margarita at the Yolo's.   The food was okay, the margarita was splendid, but the service was HOT! He looked like a Freddie Prinze Jr! Also, he checked in on us 4 girls like every 2 minutes... gave us the line that we were he's "favorite table" line too. We also found out that he is a poor soul that went through a series of misfortunate events.... mother dying, wife in an accident and then leaves him... poor Freddie-look-a-like.  But for the first meal in Vegas, it was fun and filling. I had a brain freeze when drinking that rita tho... it was sooo good!

yASxcO3oqlA3Z-rdKtjJNg.text: Clean atmosphere and expensive tastes go hand in hand here as far as Mexican is concerned. I ordered the Drunken Chicken Nachos to cure my (eh-hem) drunkenness and to my surprise, the plain cheese, chicken and salsa had a mild spicy kick due to the perfectly cooked green bell peppers in the green tomatillo salsa.  At first sight I was EXTREMELY disappointed. Plain cheese with the chicken sprinkled over the top splashed with a 1/2 oz ladle of tomatillo salsa.   At first bite I knew what I ordered was right!!! The explosion of the rich cheese and marinaded chicken along with the bell peppers on the salsa made up for the plain look. Lesson Learned: Do not judge a book by its cover!!!  It also helped that the Dos XX was from the tap and much more delicious than the Coronas everyone been drinking. The bartender was sweet and cute as hell!!!  :)

PQfTYqeynWRz1hhsxfcZlA.text: GREAT SERVICE!! GREAT FOOD!! GET THE CILANTRO RICE!! I would go back just for this rice! oh and maybe a margarita too!   We booked a birthday dinner here and the entire staff was amazing starting with the manager's emails and ending with the servers & staff at the restaurant!

H5xYdRae20azmqi9qVf0Mg.text: This is only for the food as I got carded and forgot my ID. Sadly. I so wanted a margarita!  Good points: great location, polite staff, amazingly fast service- we were done in 35 minutes!  Bad points: my fajitas were so bland! Underspiced and underseasoned. I understand it's not possible to please everyone but they could at least ask how you want them done. They actually had no spice. My date didn't enjoy his enchiladas, too flabby and underspiced again. I ordered rice but couldn't have it because I was allergic to the butter in it. Now, it's great that they were looking out for me but could they not make a fresh batch?

TxtoZ8Pfo5qLwiwseD8fFQ.text: One of our roommates got take out from this place and took it up to the room for us because we were in such a time crunch. Don't know anything about the ambiance of this place, but the food was bomb! We had the crab cakes and the nachos and I lovvvved it! And I normally don't like crab cakes! The nachos had like 7-10 chips, each already having carnitas, guac, salsa, sour cream, etc.. on it, and it was deeelious! I'll definitely come back here and visit the restaurant :)

VnooZZRrb6z3i2K2RxEuSQ.text: The food is really good. The quesadilla and the guacamole are the best as appetizers. I ate the mahi salad that was actually filling. My friends ordered the tacos which were also really good. Try the watermelon margarita. Brittany and Reyna are the best servers, very knowledgeable and friendly.

rUVre8b0IxNHDWyqZwvPhg.text: Love the late night dance and hookah lounge. Always have a good FREE time there!

nsaAIYvaTt_Ylwf0NPsOzQ.text: I thought Yolos was great! The margarita I ordered was literally the size of my head....ok my head is small....but still....  We started with the Guacamole. They make it fresh right at your table! It was excellent....perfectly seasoned with all the right flavors.  The tortilla chips were hot and fresh and the salsa was nice and spicy. For my entree I ordered the Portobello Mushroom Fajitas. The Portobello Mushroom came served on a hot, sizzling skillet cut into strips. It was so meaty and delicious! They served the fajitas with cilantro rice and black beans....SO GOOD! For dessert we ordered the cheesecake and the chocolate lava cake. I didn't really care for the cheesecake but the lava cake was good. My favorite part about the desserts was the home-made cinnamon flavored whipped cream that came with them. That was something really special. I would definitely recommend Yolos! Food and service were excellent!

ul9_Mh8UbW8uL1l49IjFQw.text: Is that Billie Jean?? In Spanish? Why yes it is! I had such a blast at this place. The bartenders rocked, the people hanging here were great too. My friends left me to fiend for myself while they went back to another guys house. But I was ok. I had plenty of Latin boys to take care of me!

BQYV4MHaJedCN1nyN5gjZg.text: Great bar. Great music. Great food. Great management. I went there with a large party and it was very impromptu. The manager Trey got us a table and took good care of us. If you're looking for a party during or after-hours, Yolo's is awesome. Stop in and party.

-5wkwfaqoTfPulqg6mCF5Q.text: When we called inquire about vegetarian options and whether or not they use lard in their tortillas and beans, the hostess was clueless about food ingredients and I was placed on hold for an inordinate amount of time. After speaking to the manager, we decided to try it out. I placed an order for a less spicy pico de gallo and when it came it burned the roof of my mouth. I asked if something less spicy could be made and was told that everything is pre-made. When the entrees came (we ordered the quinoa salad and fish tacos) I found everything so incredibly spicy that I ended up finishing my kids' quesadilla! Normally love Mexican food but am for sure going to skip this place next time.

hXK-R1XrbSAVyolfnnCutw.text: A nice little trendy spot inside Planet Hollywood. Prices were actually okay for Vegas. Our drinks could have been stronger and the food was decent, but our server was awesome. You have to order chips and salsa, it isn't provided.

L7vqOOQXfATEUIjcdirQaQ.text: I had the luck of being maid of honor and had never been to Vegas! So in turn I was in charge of he bachelorette party. I looked up some spots and Yolos seemed to have all the options and variety on the menu that I was looking for. I ended up getting in contact w Jason Carr, who was super knowledgeable and broke down my options for a party of 14 girls to fill their stomachs for the night ahead. He was very accommodating considering I was making plans from Ft. Lauderdale, FL! I We conducted all business via phone and email. Once I got there I was honestly expecting disaster BUT everything went smoothly! Our server, I unfortunately forget his name, was great and on top of things! I was also hooked up with a Blue Long Island or 2 for all my hard work and planning. (thank you Jason&Server!)  Our group chose from the Three-course menu which was great and posed a lot of options for having such a big group. They served appetizer of Chips n Salsa, Salad: Mixed Green or Caesar. Entrees we all had the options of Petit Filet Mignon, Glazed salmon, or Pollo Rostizado. I had the Filet Mignon which was flavorful and tender. :)  Everyone was fat and happy, pleased with the options. We paid per head a flat rate which was a great price and worth the quality of the size meal we received and gave us a great start to our night in Vegas!   Thank you so much Yolos for maing my job as MoH easy and successful!! (;  Kiara~

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner w the Bachelorette party

C8MMR90-eD_PfEXMu0eGDg.text: We stopped in for just some quick appetizers before a long night ahead. The chips and salsa were great and the mini chimichangas or whatever were actually really good. For the price, good service and ease of this place during lunch time, it was pretty fantastic. I've also came here before by myself for dinner and it was equally as good.

WZii6njVfzr_UcuZCIqq4Q.text: Convenient bar to kill some time at, grab a drink or watch bad karaoke performances (well on Thursdays at least).    You may gasp at this, but for $13 you can order a "make your own margarita."  Where you can pick your tequila brand.  I mean, why you would pick anything other than Patron is beyond me, but to have a set price for Patron is a score in my book... and probably a "cheap price" in Vegas!  We ordered a nacho platter which was pretty pitiful.  I think there were maybe 10 chips in it and a spoonful of gauc.  Pretty lame nacho platter if you ask me!    Plus, after midnight, well drinks are only $3.  Now THAT'S a jackpot in Vegas!

WqVlJXbY751jKUW6qjifrg.text: We had so much fun sitting at the bar talking with Alex and Chris! The high energy atmosphere made it the perfect place to start the night. We just happened to be there on karaoke night, which was all the more entertaining!   Great place!

xKcpoDktnE9q8PBiwWZbZg.text: Stopped and had lunch here with our kids on Thanksgiving day... The place was fairly empty. But it was a cute little place.   Our server was really quiet nice and on top of everything. Very friendly and efficient.  Our food on the other hand, was much different... I was very disappointed, especially the cost of what little we received.  My son wanted the steak nachos... However the menu doesn't tell you that what you get is 5-6 tortilla chips with a single piece of steak, jalepeno, and cheese on them and that's your "nachos"...  My son was not impressed and was still hungry... I shared my mediocre taquitos with him.  The tortilla soup was less than impressive and was fairly watery.   Lots of money for sub par food. Not worth it in our books to return.

qSwzRg-ObqDX3OuRyQPL-g.text: Good custom margaritas starting at $14. House chips seems right out of the bag and cheese dip tasted similar. Over cooked or dried out rice. Plus everyone walks right by the glass if you're in the booth. Besides rice and Chip scenario, not too shabby. Tostada salad was good. Manager took dish with bad rice off the bill, offered a substitution. Good service.

cbuEqRwbuzOPhz1BMNvj7A.text: This place ins hidden in the maze also known as Planet Hollywood. They serve up delicious drinks and food at decent prices but beware they do not take total rewards comps... They do allow for room charges but only if you are staying on property... Not sure why they don't do it - was told their data base / system has not been updated yet.    Give this a place a try when in PH.  Definitely worth it especially if Earl of Sandwich or Pinks is too busy.

Oz5W82fqMyOl8Td4BbwA3g.text: There's a scene in the dark knight.  I've seen it like two thousand times.  Seriously, I've seen it a lot.  When I was a kid I watched Star Wars over and over again.  It was on cable and my parents liked to leave me at home alone for really long stretches.  I watched it so much, I memorized pretty much all the dialogue and songs in the movie.  I'm old now, though.  So I calculate I'll need to watch this batman movie at least eight thousand more times to memorize it all.  Anyway, the scene where the joker tries to shoot the mayor; the only glimpse we get of him without makeup.  That was about the time I ordered.  About two minutes later, literally, my food arrived.  It felt like I had traveled back in time and ordered before I arrived.  God damn I wish that was possible.  The self I send back would always be waiting in line.   So I got nervous.  Like, this one meal could ruin my whole trip to Vegas.  It still might. I'm writing this waiting for my check.  But the food was decent enough. The service was friendly, and very boobalicious.  Oh, there's was also a very fit, attractive male also.  Vegas must grow em on trees or something.  Good looking people, not hot guys. What?  The bottom line is, if everything else is crowded and you're so hungry you could eat a dead rat off a sewer grate, then try this joint.  Otherwise, earl of sandwich is right around the corner.

_w9PYt1260Y7bncNZNc3Fw.text: Great customer service & guacamole,  but that's where it STOPS!!!  It's like a Mexican Food version of McDonald's!!! Great management,  my group complained about the horrible food and we only paid for the guacamole!! NEVER TRY THE MARGARITAS!!!

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Extra raw rice..Dry shrimp tacos

4BedshdQJ5WW5xVwbZBX-w.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch. $9.95 lunch special accompanied by a $5.00 margarita! Not a bad lunch right on the strip! Friendly bartender too!  Came back again 3 days later.  Nadjana, our bartender,  remembered us.  She's the best and food was better than last time!

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian burrito
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burrito on left and tamales on right

Ja85XfPBkoDOth-NDv-N0w.text: The bar was nice and the female bartender I had was awesome. She had to go and switched to another bartender who didn't pay attention to us at all. The food was just OK, nothing special and it did not fill me or my wife up at all and it didn't taste all that great. the atmosphere was cool and fun and loud if you're in to that .

6QDNOyyC93sOefk-USTl4w.text: Great people and fantastic drinks! The people at the bar make you feel welcome. Very friendly and inviting. We've sat at a table before but the bar is the place to sit and socialize.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yep!
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside Planet Hollywood

xykuAtnTKtSTocbGuKV0og.text: Just relocated to Vegas, and stop with some co-workers to have lunch, and I have to say in such a busy atmosphere our server Deztanie made us feel as if we were the only ones in the restaurant.  When I asked what she recommended she smiled and told me the tacos were amazing, and I have to say the carne asada tacos were pretty amazing!! Thank you Yolos and Deztanie for making my day and first lunch outing a hit!!!

iJiuUZDL5AtL6zwuP1Cu3Q.text: This was our third time eating at Yolos.  The guacamole is very good!  The chips are thick and they are plentiful.  This is our second time in trying the coconut shrimp.  It has really been overcooked both times.  This time, it was almost black.  I believe it is more a case of Yolos not changing their oil (this was a Sunday night) as compared to overcooking.  They need new management.  $13 for 4 black shrimp which don't really taste of coconut is ridiculous.  Sitting at the bar, the service is okay, the bartenders seem more excited  to talking with girls at the bar than waiting on people who are willing to tip 20% for good service.  This place is a last resort to eat at.

WK9KQF-oZWhpZ2DY-W8mEA.text: Yolos, Mexican Grill,Planet Hollywood,Las Vegas, Nevada. Overly pretentious fare, not even close to authentic. Over-priced & teeny tiny appy style entree's,...Yes, You Only Live Once So,...save your dough and find somewhere else to go!

L91xDNAMYRKXKJkD11k_7A.text: Some friends and I stopped in for karaoke. We ordered drinks ( I had the $30 margarita)  and had some nachos. Omg the nachos were so bad. The drinks were fine. The kicker was when the bill was dropped off I noticed it seemed high. I asked for the detailed recipient. The server added 8% gratuity and there were only 3 of us in our party. Totally deceiving and glad I asked for the itemized receipt.  Request an itemized receipt!

PC39ttyFDtX6fiQLYuyDWg.text: Have been here more times than I can count when visiting family in Vegas. The service is some of the best I've ever had. Staff always remember us and are very prompt and friendly. The guacamole is my favorite guacamole. Their holiday options are delicious. Drinks are always made well. Kind of love this place.

pXk_i4tbwFTWCKeMtF9obQ.text: Place is very nice and the bartender (niko) is amazing and very attentive and nice! Place is great for a snack and some drinks, will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ySl91TN_4OruFfhZrR5dIQ.text: I just wanted to take the time to recognize both bartenders Chris,Guillermo,and Nico for their customer service! They are so fun and friendly! Yolos is the best Mexican food on the strip!!  Their fresh guacamole is the best and the fish tacos!! the drinks are amazing too! Everyone must try this place! Love love love it!!

DhuhECXVRIL5oUZRFptaCg.text: We tried streetside corn and vegetarian tacos. They were full of flavors. We had ordered quesadillas which were not up to the mark. Overall a nice place to chill and have nice cocktails.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xAMkXCT-3Hs88in3IAIfBw.text: CHARGE for chips n salsa is LUDICROUS  how HARD UP is this place No wonder there wasn't anyone here Bartenders has BAD ATTITUDE  She thinks she's too good to be here My tip...QUIT

fRHSBqFRavbiIWEJYdSXNw.text: In A Nutshell:  -For some reason, I always end up grabbing a drink or food at YOLOS when in Vegas. -The drinks are decent, the 1942 Don Julio is $25 per shot, which is the average price. -This time, I also ordered some of their nachos and they were very, very good. -Crispy, cheesy, chewy, hit the spot prior to dinner.  Overall, it's very easy to find inside Planet Hollywood, the bar usually has plenty of open seats.

Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1942 Don Julio Tequila.
