JptgBLJhxDIOUT89XrrSRw.text: We were looking for something light to eat and stumbled upon Yolos. Am I ever glad we did! We arrived just after Happy Hour started and chose from the $6 Happy Hour menu. We ordered the salsa trio and the quesadilla. The queso dip and salsa were delicious, but we didn't care for the guacamole. The quesadilla was excellent.  This is a great, inexpensive little spot if you're in the area of Planet Hollywood Resort and Casino. It's located just inside.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ce2SOnOHW8Fsz84eTL31UA.text: Good place to go and not that crowded, food was ok not authentic Mexican. Staff very friendly and good price.

vdbVr2PEKLA3GB4NdWzXmA.text: Love this place. BUT BRING BACK THE OLD DIABLO SAUCE!!!!! Solid margaritas. Good/ borderline great fajitas. Good salsa, but used to have great salsa including a dark and lovely picante sauce dubbed Diablo. Very fresh, cant deny myself a visit when i come to sin city.   Come. You wont be disappointed.

N1CH4guiIxxpyJvmqd3W1g.text: Start off, I have eaten at Yolos quite a few  times over a three year period.  To night was with out a doubt the worst experience of all.  Food has always been first class and tonight was no different.   The service by the waitress (when she could come by) was on par.  Management SUCKED.   We ( four of us) were seated and drinks were ordered,  fortunately we all had reviewed the menu on line and ordered with our initial drink order,  The staff then set up a table(s)  that looked for 30.  So our drinks arrive, then our food, but my wife and I are without forks, knives or napkins (setups).   I mention it to the fellow who delivered our food, and he found one setup I gave to my wife.  And he said he would be back with another because THEY WERE ALL OUT! I the waved down what looked like a manager, explained the situation and he found setup, lifted from another table.   We ate our dinner without another visit from the waitress, nor water service, or offer of more drinks.   The large group sucked the air out of the room.  To be fair, I don't blame the waitress,  I blame the pathetic manager who did not have sufficient staff on hand to handle his expected guests ,  And his pathetic response of "Oh I am sorry".

2NHdAaOkuTaAC_oBB_idCA.text: Food was okay, didn't give more stars because after eating most of my salad I found a hair and the server didn't seem to bothered with it. I'm a server, so in my opinion it should have been taken off my bill but wasn't. No big deal but figured it something that should be addressed.

pnQtHbEnvE-AC5fgsGOevw.text: To start, I've been to YOLOS over 20 times.  Have always loved the food and margaritas.  One of the great things about Yolos is that they offer a free Margarita on your next visit.  I went back to Yolos last Saturday and presented them my receipt for the free Margarita, but was told by the bartender, that Yolos has new owners and that they no longer honor the free Margarita coupon.  Ended up paying for a Margarita, but apparently the new owners limit the amount of tequila in their Margaritas and I basically paid for sugar water.  I ordered the steak fajitas which were good, but without a couple of strong Margaritas like I've had in the past, didn't totally have the enjoyable dining experience I had in the past.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free Margarita (?)

B-IM-LKJ9dcV2ZgWWwBqdQ.text: Located in Planet Hollywood, this Mexican restaurant offers all the usual - nachos, tacos, Margaritas, fajitas etc. They also have a bar if you're just coming for cocktails, with the obligatory chips and salsa.  We had the carnitas and tacos. Both were fine. They give a nice portion of sides. I especially like the beans. Be careful not to eat too many chips and ruin your appetite. I know from personal experience.  The decor is fun - very Vegas. Like everything within casinos, it's expensive for what it is. But that's standard.

HMePeEdAvp7AXlz7wDtxiQ.text: Delicious chips and salsa!!! It's really on point, especially if you want to enjoy a snack at the bar with a drink or two!  Dined early in the afternoon, service was excellent and lots of tvs to enjoy any games playing. Food was good. Definitely not your authentic Mexican food restaurant but still delicious and well prepared / presented. Shrimp enchiladas with green sauce was very yummy!  Will go again since we stay at PH often. Thanks!

DLnoTNmlNfBBt0WIP7zYxw.text: The watermelon margarita is so sweet and yumma!   The guacamole at first was so spicy but a few more bites and I was loving it.  I wanted so bad to steal gallons of their spicy salsa.   I love the waitress brought out a salsa dish for me and my friend so I did not have to worry about him double dipping or hogging it!   Also........You gotta get the FLAN :)

ovpdIdY9ut4NdVCPlmyicQ.text: It was really difficult finding somewhere to make a reservation for dinner in a city I've never been to.  How do I know what's good?  Luckily, Yelp came through for me.  I was torn though because the ratings were kind of low, even though the food looked good.  I took a chance, and I'm glad I did!  Service was friendly and fast for the most part.  The chips, salsa, and guacamole were all delicious, although our guac was not prepared table side as others were :( We also had the queso fundido which was really great.  My first drink was the pink Cadillac (watermelon margarita) and it was great.  My second drink was even better though, and I continued to drink them throughout the weekend - it was the "opposites attract" (I think that's what it was called?  It was the cucumber/jalapeno margarita).  It was SO GOOD, but not very consistent.  Sometimes the spice was overwhelming, sometimes it was tame.  Everyone enjoyed their food.  I can't remember what all we had though!  I know I had the steak fajitas and they were good.  I don't remember any complaints really.  They don't mess around with the margaritas - they are made stiff!

fpBfEVKtrhCBlyVf5AWBcg.text: A must try if your into Mexican food. It's American Mexican but very tasteful. I had the camarones a la diabla and they weren't spicy but very delicious. Their queso fundido was good as well. A lot of onions but their chorizo was good

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish shrimp and asada tacos very tasty
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Camarones a la diabla and queso fundido very delicious

fRlQ9I0EaBrkMPjpzM02-Q.text: Didn't eat here but did stop by for a few drinks at the bar with my brother and his fiance . They were very well priced compared to many other Places on the strip/in casinos. Nico was our bartender, she was quick, super nice and very friendly.

QGs1Zr6DSyH_et_Cu9d0RA.text: Oct 2018: My fav bar in vegas where I met my girlfriend of 6 years and counting.  Friendly staff, great lunch specials and wonderful mexican food. (LARGE portions)  I always drop by when in the area and say hello and have drinks and food with this great group of folks.  Located near LV BLVD exit in casino).  Kinda like an upscale cheers if you are a regular.  P.S. please bring back the DIABLO SAUCE

0c0GOrO7VTXcQ8KI7UK1SQ.text: We decided to eat here without reading ahead of time.  Zero expectations. My wife and I each had the lunch special.  The street tacos were a little plain, but still good. Overall a good place to get Mexican food on the strip at a reasonable price.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burrito lunch special

GCJYdWIApEdmWiWAbqKoDA.text: We wanted a quick bite for dinner and our food was good and came out quickly, but we hardly saw our server. The prices were high and you had to pay for chips n salsa. Was just okay, wouldn't come here again though.

OlXyU4mtzT0h1tlL6tkQLA.text: Ate here with 3 of my friends before the Backstreet Boys concert. Service was great, food was pretty tasty (I ordered the carne asada street tacos), the guacamole was so so, and the drinks were very good. I would definitely recommend for a pre concert meal.

ic8m3Nd-xiThy_rmpX_r7Q.text: The food was pretty awful but the service was good so I gave them two stars. The chips were soaked in grease, the salsa was fair, the guacamole wasn't special. My quesadilla was also soaked in grease. I can see why people have had stomach issues from eating here.

_BhlIQvJJwN_L10Blmp5oA.text: Best bartending staff in Vegas! stayed in planet Hollywood for a week and some of our best moments were sitting at the Yolos bar eating great food and enjoying some drinks.  The steak nachos are amazing!  The staff made us feel right at home, by the time we left we knew all the bartenders by name, christina, nadjana, chris, and guillermo.  I will miss this bar when im home!

TECExtM3pmoUIxHqjFbyIQ.text: Went several times to Yolos with friends during a recent Vegas trip and had a great experience all of the times. The restaurant is a great stop while gambling at Planet Hollywood. It is a good alternative to PH's excellent sit down restaurants upstairs in the Mezzanine area in that it keeps you a bit closer to the casino action.  Our server Damian was one of the best servers we've had on many trips to Vegas and he ranks among one of the better servers we have likely ever had, period. And, in personally eating many times in New York, Chicago, L.A., and Vegas, and with my friends having traveled a lot around the world, I think that is saying a lot. The guy was good -- especially in trying to find the best tequila selections for our group's different tastes. He was like a tequila sommelier. His associate Chris was also very good, and it just stresses one point to restaurants, hire good people. They keep the customers coming back.  Good points -- Yolos is a great higher-end casual restaurant choice that the Planet Hollywood area needs a few more of. It is a step above a bar atmosphere without any sacrifice of fast service, fun, and a good price. And, it is faster than a 1-2 hour sit down restaurant without sacrifice of food quality or unique offerings that are of course expected with some of Vegas' great, higher-end restaurants. All of the food was good and unique. The service was excellent, fast, and friendly.  Bad points -- We were lucky to always sit at the bar area. So, we had good access to the service. Sitting in the other parts of the restaurant might not have been as good or as much fun.

wVCgPhjOTjy1HkeZBzEUYg.text: the best margaritas i've ever had... fresh fruit, and a tasty aftertaste  despite the huge probability of this being an americanized version on mexican food, the corn chowder tasted pretty authentic - definitely NOT from a can like the soup i had at another place...  nice portions (except for the crab cakes), and awesome chips/salsa... definitely a good place to dine...

YYXT2T3pk1RQ6A4iANms5Q.text: Dont eat here unless you like being treated like garbage.  I was recently at Yolo's in Planet Hollywood for lunch on 3/10 around 2-3 pm and had some of the worst customer service I have ever experienced.  The experience started off pleasant  with me and my two friends being seated promptly and we were very excited to try the food.  After the tableside guac was made the rest of our group called and decided to join us for lunch and our party of three grew to a party of 12.   I asked the waitress if we could move to a larger table to accommodate the rest of the group and she said she would have to ask the hostess so I went to speak to the hostess and she said she had to talk to the waitress.  All the while there were 3 empty tables right next to each other that could be easily pushed together.  The table to our left was a very nice couple that offered to move seats so we could add to our group but we told them that was a very nice offer but not necessary because there was room elsewhere. The table to the right of us was more interesting because it was the manager on duty who completely ignored us and made no efforts to help us obtain a larger table for our party.  After the three tables had been pushed together and everyone was seated, we started to move our appetizer and drinks over when we were stopped by the waitress, not the manager who was still sitting eating her lunch and staring at us, and were told that every member of our party of 12 was required to order a meal off the menu or we couldn't eat there anymore.  We let the waitress know that a few people may not be eating but everyone was going to be drinking but they still told us that we wouldn't be served unless everyone ate.  We were obviously upset by this since we are such a large group and the waitress would have gotten at least the min 18% tip that is added to large groups so we couldn't understand why they wouldn't serve us.  She told us that her manager had instructed her to tell us this, still while the manager is eating at a table less than 3 ft away from us.  The manager never once came us to us and talked to us directly or even tried to explain her position, the waitress said it was because they were too busy to seat people that weren't eating even though there were at least 5 empty table in the restaurant and plenty of room still at the bar.  We paid for our guac and my beer and left the restaurant to go somewhere more accommodating where every member of our group did in fact order food and several drinks.  The total bill ended up being over $500 for our group and we had a great time elsewhere.   I am so incredibly mad at the manager for being a coward and not even having the "balls" to tell us herself that she wouldn't serve us and very disappointed that at a great casino they allow staff to treat guest like garbage.

zXtjKockOqS-5XTxRL3jpg.text: Dined here in January and not worth the effort. Terrible service, way overpriced for just a notch above Taco Bell ! Don't waste your time until management gets their head.... When is Vegas gonna understand people are fed up paying gazillions for substandard food drinks & service

kh6gI4Ni860iD3z0rOW4MA.text: Our server whipped up some guacamole that was just divine (if you agree that slightly supple, perfectly ripe avocados bring you closer to your chosen God anyhow), and the small talk he made whilst combining fresh lime juice and pico de gallo, avocados and onions, struck me as genuine and pleasant. He actually provided the friendliest, most timely restaurant service during my entire Vegas stay. Huzzah.  The Mahi Mahi salad is filling and well-balanced. The ceviche, though lacking in scallops, glides down your gullet with the greatest of ease. Their free baskets of chips are lovingly sprinkled with cayenne seasoning, too.  And don't forget the snazzy pink and lime decor, bold without jarring the senses. The rest of Vegas, you could take a lesson from this place! Actually, Vegas, I want you to dance 18 inches apart from this gal and keep your hands to yourself. She still seems so darling and fresh-faced.  PS: This place is in Planet Hollywood.

apkEEZhP7aDIAfNOP5rmmw.text: overpriced garbage.  the 12 dollar toastada salad (with three tiny bites of steak) was nothing more than a side salad.  they are so cheap that they charge for chips.  they also do not take total rewards comps (there are no signs to tell anyone in the place or on the menu), and all they could say was sorry.  how about putting up a sign that states you do not take harrah's comps!!!  much better places to eat than this garbage, overpriced place.

RbtqUuQIME-rEG8_VKFIYg.text: This is the best Mexican restaurant I have ever been to, I live in Washington DC every time I come to Las Vegas I have to stop at Yolos. I recommend that you have the fresh guacamole and chips, also the Enchiladas are the best.

3HgMF4CGEndbib_b99JklQ.text: I was out in Vegas 2 weekends in a row and went to Yolos 4 times. The food was great! I had Fajitas and Chicken Enchiladas and you got to get the Guacamole it was perfect. Service was a little slow but the manager really took care of us and entertained us while we waited, very nice guy!

ONLO0kmQXu9qafFLelzVmQ.text: hated it.... waiter was a douche pretty hot but definitely knew it tried to pull the whole winking thing then dissapear for 20 minutes and expect us to be ok with it puhhhlease bud.  The whole place is overpriced i mean i know its vegas but still 15 dollars for a margarita in a martini glass?! wtf... we get the chips and salsa and they are pretty good chipotle salsa decent chips.  I ordered the cheviche and it shows up made out of oj and has mandarin oranges in it blecccck way to sweet cant even taste the shrimp laaame.  My friend got the veggie enchiladas and the veggies tasted like oil not even butter which would have been better they did use cotija cheese though.  We high tailed it out of there after that thank goodness

lR0OHe5M9uMYYYwxfu5VMQ.text: Not good at all.  Started with the Queso Fundido which was string cheese with a mass of onions and mushrooms heated into a flat iron pan with a few tortillas.  Hard to even figure out how to eat and the cheese was flavorless.  Waiter suggested the Steak Picado which was a barely legal cut of steak with undercooked rice and black beans.  My wife had the street tacos carnitas and could only get through one.  Guacamole was good, but that was about it.  Should have kept looking for another place to eat.

DKUkdbo2mEq8Du8QqLLNSw.text: my friend was begging our group to go eat here for lunch since shes been here before and fell in love with this place, but i don't see whats so great about it.  i do like the decor and the lighting and everything, but the food is really just meeh to me.  i had the chicken enchilada and all i can say is, it's super DRY! i had to use their salsa that they give you with chips as a way to moisten it up and add some flavor.  i hate black beans (it's part of their side) and i did not like their mexican rice.  it was just not cooked all the way or something cause it was pretty hard.  umm i'd rather be at el torito.

HrSMS6x45j-_NTD8Ak1jlg.text: This was the first place we ate on arriving in Las Vegas, and we went back every night. The servers are great, Guillermo, Christina, Chris and Nadjana kept us happy with drinks and unique foods, they are all great fun!. The Drunken Chicken and Steak Nachos were both fantastic and I will miss them when we go home. The location is great, in the mix but not in the middle of the casino. Go see them and tell them Joe, Jackie and Matt said Hi!

HAAYTLgWoGhRaZ3SRxdEiw.text: Get the table side guacamole...it is money!  I had the carnita's street tacos and they were just OK, the pork was a little on the dry side.  Our service was spot on and our waiter was hilarious.  Make sure and get one of the free margarita with an entree coupons before coming here.

XPHmIvxEvjAY58ics0GJgA.text: They have a basic menu that provided a foundation for the next 12 hours.  Friendly staff, moderately attentive.  We got our food to go because it was a bit noisy.

pqj6rNjSS8kbzsgQqU0SWA.text: hmmm...... I went here cause my friends said that this place was really good. But I was pretty disappointed. I forgot what I my sister and I ordered but it really wasn't that tasty. But I heard that the soft tacos were pretty good. I actually thought that this place was pretty pricey. It was around $10-$12 a dish. But the chips and salsa were really good.

qpjwTrvMOXsc2i7OWHW_eA.text: We ate here on a recent trip to Vegas, and really enjoyed the meal and drinks. It's a great, mid-priced option in an expensive town. We got the table-side guacamole as a starter, which is plenty for a party of four--we were only two and barely made a dent. We had chicken tacos and steak fajitas for our entrees, and both were delicious and good sized portions. Service was great--as was the huge raspberry margarita I enjoyed through the meal. I would definitely go back to this restaurant while in Vegas for a meal that's tasty and in a fun spot (Planet Hollywood) but not wallet-emptying.

QBcs0Wsb1T_pNEB2PPGMDw.text: I was really pleasantly surprised by this place.  Planet Hollywood has two other Mexican restaurants in the Miracle Mile that get so-so reviews and I expected Yolos would be like that but it was actually great.  The food was really good, with more complex flavors than your standard Mexican place of this price range.  We were there for Sunday brunch and they have a special brunch menu which looked good but we ended up ordering off the regular menu so I guess I can't comment on the brunch menu (although it did have a very tempting "Hangover Stew" which I would ask you to try just to tell me how it is).  The queso fundido was the best I've had anywhere, and the nachos were really good as well, every chip had a ton of yummy stuff on it.  The tortilla soup was spicy and they poured it over the tortilla strips as tortilla soup should be done.  The guacamole that came on the side of the dishes was very good so I would bet the guacamole appetizer is even better.  The service was a little too in your face, but that also meant that it was very attentive so I guess that's a toss up.  I would recommend this for a good casual lunch.

kuQCzQlyiPxN5vTl-f4IyA.text: This place was really good! Try the steak nacho appetizers, they are yummy. I thought it would be more like a Baja Fresh kind of place, but it was a lot nicer than that. The prickly pear mojito was just okay though, I should have gotten a margarita!

fII8sip6xtQFIMijgKh3zg.text: Last night in Vegas and we were looking for something casual.  Headed next door and grabbed some seats at the bar - great view of the casino and the Steelers game on TV.  Yummy margarita, good guac, salsa was tasy but could be a little thicker so it stays on the chip.  I had soft shell tacos which were yummy and the hubby had enchiladas - both dished were very good.

GH-uZTmNK511wnV1xTNcRA.text: We went here before our Britney show at PH and the food and drinks were just okay and the service was horrible! He kept forgetting to bring cups for our sangria pitcher. The food also took about an hour to get and all we got was 4 appetizers and the place wasn't busy at all. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

FCfu0yCNq0ZOfWJ6kO9Pog.text: The service was amazing, quality and quantity for the price in Vegas was amazing. Our server  Eric even brought my boyfriend some hot water, honest and lemon because he was losing his voice. - appreciative girlfriend

1HSOLZC0fH3SEBLrxH73yg.text: Feeling alone is scary, but dining alone could be one of the most frightening thing a man can do, and doing it in vegas? Dont even go there!  After some sporadic gambling with various outcome, i decided to stop here for some food. Im not young, but i was alone so i decided to get one of their open bar seats. One thing i noticed when dining alone is that service often is ridiculously good. No matter if you eat by the bar or not, they seem to care for you more and want to give you all the attention you need.  The sizzling fajitas combo was generous and tasty as it should and they have quite a few interesting cocktails as well. This place is located right off the casino floor so if you dont want the uptempo you should go somewhere else. Service was speedy and precise and they seem to have a great coordination in between each other. .  The name of the restaurant is actually YOLOS which quite randomly involves the Swedish letter "O", but in this case i will not make any scene, just go with the flow.  Dont be afraid dining alone at this place in this crazy city, you probably end up having a great dinner, with excellent service while finding some new friends.  Y - You O - Only L -  Live O - Once S  - Solo

V9hw_PHNw_hLgwCOtapcpA.text: Stopped in here to hang with some friends and most likely won't be back. The music is way to damn loud. Seriously you can't hear the person sitting right next to you let alone sitting across from you. The booths are so cramped together that you play a game of "kicking footsie" with others at your table. My wife accidentally got kicked from the person sitting across from her and she was bleeding. Like missing a toenail bleeding. The food tasted decent however you don't get enough for the cost and it certainly isn't authentic Mexican food.

cgtoE7OvtZN4NR0vuXt8gA.text: Great happy hour!! The food is fresh and tasty and the margaritas are suburb! At $6.00 per item its,a bargain! It is a fun place!

dEyHpqRBxPpnQs8uHmoSgA.text: This place was really nice! My niece and I were hungry around 3 pm on Saturday. We stopped in here for some lunch.  The decor is awesome. I loved the colors, the lights, and all the light fixtures. The booth was roomy and comfy.   Our waitress was over right away with yummy chips & salsa. We figured out what we wanted for lunch - shredded beef enchiladas for me, carnitas street tacos for my niece. The food took awhile to come out, considering there weren't many people in the restaurant.  The food was worth the wait! My shredded beef enchiladas were some of the juiciest, most flavorful enchiladas I have ever had. There was a perfect amount of cheese, and the green sauce was really delicious.  The rice was really bland, and the beans were just alright. But the enchiladas themselves were amazing. My niece also enjoyed her tacos. Great portions, good prices.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing shredded beef enchiladas.
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips &amp; Salsa.
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty decor.

N4wb6B3L_dVlC5Q72kMxTQ.text: Not really authentic mexican food, but it's a step up from a Chevy's - the food is still very good for the price, especially during happy hour.   They have Margaronas!   They have a "skinny" menu - low calorie drinks + meals, i ordered the vegetarian burrito with the Skinny Margarita, which was very strong. They also have a decent happy hour menu - burritos, enchiladas with sides for like $10.   Not bad, it's worth trying.

-YmSvBtlgLLuWgAm3AGJMg.text: Really great food! And our server was pleasant and helpful and checked on us several times. Chips were served warm and the Salsa tasted homemade. I had the seafood enchiladas. They were fantastic. My husband had the carnitas enchiladas and also loved them. I wish this place was close to home so we could eat there again.

3KbtZI0wD6Ac4sG8Lmf2sw.text: Pretty good margaritas. But in happy hour you dont get them in the nice glasses, instead you get it in a plastic cup, still delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r_-mjSKNHE35itSRi7nPSw.text: I got to Vegas super early and was craving their Queso Fundido so I went hoping they'd be open. I had to wait long enough to lose a few hundred dollars as they don't open until 11:30.   I had the Queso and street tacos as normal. I also thought I'd be a tough guy and order the salsa Diablo. They were nice enough to replace it with the house salsa after I swallowed my pride. I think they may have noticed I was sucking down ice water like it was keeping me alive.   Anyway, you won't believe this. I still don't believe it myself...  Towards the end of my meal, the manager came by and recognized me from my past yelp review!  I was kinda freaked out!  But how awesome is that!  She had messaged me previously asking how they could improve their service so there was correspondence, but wow!  I was impressed. She walked by and did a double take and was like are you, did you, are you the guy I talked to who left a yelp review?    She was really pretty. Lol. So I may have gotten a bit nervous after that!  Regardless, great food as always, and the Queso Fundido with chorizo is simply fantastic. The service was great. I had multiple people take care of me.  I will go back for sure, maybe even again on this trip!    You don't find sincere personal service like that at very many places and it is appreciated. That's how you gain loyal customers. They gained one today!

IDfP9xw8Oa_-Btdk9ArP6Q.text: I visited this restaurant around 4pm and it was practically empty. I was hesitant about going but I'm so glad I did. We started with the table side guac which was delicious. I chose the side car tacos which were excellent. Everything was seasoned well and every bite was flavorful. To drink I had the mule which wasn't very strong but still tasty (if you like ginger beer of course). Service was excellent as well. I would definitely return and recommend for a good meal.

CVnTCQ6NnOggGoZGH65_FQ.text: My fiance and I went here for lunch on Saturday and oh my god was it amazing!  We started by ordering some guacamole and expected to get the normal bowl of guac with some chips; we were so wrong, they brought out avocados and made the guac table side. It was so fresh and delicious! My fiance was happy that he could also ask them to hold the cilantro.  I ordered the tamales with the cilantro rice and my fiance got the vegetables fajitas. Both entries were very tasty.  The service was excellent. Martin, our server, was friendly and attentive without hovering.  We will definitely be going back.

GmSo8pkk5na61jWMT6c2Tw.text: Definitely over priced! Especially for the 3 tacos for $10+? We had 9 orders of it one time and it took an hour to make... We were getting very anxious and annoyed. When we told our server we wanted to cancel our order she finally went to the back to check and brought it out. SMH. An order of tacos comes with 3 tacos, rice, and black beans...  It does the trick if you're stranded in Vegas and can't find any tacos if you're craving some. Interesting name too. Can't say anything else about restaurant since we did a to go order.

fIMj9qPa88vsfjHPlrrv3Q.text: This was our first place to go for food when we arrived in Vegas on Saturday night. It came as a recommendation from a coworker and we figured we'd check it out.  The Mexican food itself is decent and the prices are reasonable given how fancy the place looks. We ordered tacos and enchiladas, which came with sides of beans and rice. We weren't disappointed in our food at all but I guess we were hoping for something that would blow us away. Or maybe we're just spoiled by awesome quality Mexican food we can get back home?  The winners of the evening though were the margaritas. My partner ordered a classic and I picked out the watermelon. I was actually shocked that my drink came out refreshing and smooth tasting! I was expecting an overly sweet, super intense watermelon "juice" flavour that I've experienced in mixed drinks before, but this was very light and smooth and everything I've ever wanted in a drink that involves this fruit.  My suggestion would be to come here for some drinks and maybe a snack or appetizer. Or have many drinks. The tequila menu is kind of mind-blowing.

_By0wP1CLyNhj3GHVs0QIw.text: Brody our PROFESSSIONAL Guac Man rocks the avocado...best ever.  The wait staff was great - can't say much for the food though - it was pretty average (expensive but hey its Vegas).  The Guac however was amaze-balls!

bUAIyJaipVT59p9DmOBtvw.text: OH YOLOS. I barely remember being here half the time, but seriously, I spent a surprising amount of time here during my 4 day Vegas Birthday Trip. First- as a restaurant, it's pretty good Mexican food. Try the cucumber jalapeno margarita! So delicious. The table side guacamole is worth it too. The bar tender had to be one of the dumbest people I've ever met- he messed everything up. From us asking for chicken on our nachos (So, beef, right?) to my bell pepper allergy being translated that I am allergic to everything in the restaurant. Whatever. Except for him, service was excellent. HERE is where the magic happens- At night the place turns into a club-bar. WITH KARAOKE. Yes, karaoke. It's cheaper than the actual clubs, you actually get room to dance, the bar tenders serve strong drinks quickly AND you get to sing off key to a bunch of strangers. The 10 of us ended up drunkenly stumbling here two nights in a row. It was actually a lot of fun.

7ft99z4L-OYDfTnBNBUQlw.text: It was delish! We had chips and dip, all three were amazing, the pork tacos were good. The portions were large. Would def eat there again!

q2ySxmI06EhsWp22bVZA9w.text: Located in Planet Hollywood. Came here twice while in Vegas! The happy hour is AWESOME! I tried guac and chips (so many chips!) and the quesadilla (comes with the option to add onions and peppers- I suggest that). Both were amazing and just $5! $5 also can buy you an excellent frozen or on the rocks margarita (any flavor you want). Came back the next day and tried the chicken fajitas (comes with all the fixins and it was amazing). Had a bite of my friends ceviche- it was okkkkay. Not very fresh tasting but I still enjoyed it. Also it was very spicy. Everything else is awesome! Shout out to Niko for being the best bartender!

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour menu

nAR6PQyOc_v5P3onWUsM4g.text: I wouldn't call this your traditional Mexican, of course. I went here with a very large party for a pre-wedding dinner. I wasn't sure what I was expecting, but I was really surprised but what I got!  At the time, I had no idea what 'YOLO' meant. I regret fully that I do now, but alas. ANYWAY.  The food was fantastic. Had a little bit of everything -steak, chicken, fish, some appetizers I had no idea what they were but were delicious. The desserts were amazing as well, a mixture of many different things you could just pick out.  Oh, did I mention for this particular event there were unlimited margaritas and beer? Oh yes.

_3nJZmJ_hkTDTNSskt8gOw.text: Yolo's was great!    4 starving (and quite dehydrated) ladies couldn't wait to be seated at a table, so we sat at the bar where Chris, the bartender tended to us.  He was GREAT and super friendly!  Gave us some tips on what to order but I ended up with the shredded beef flautas and it was delicious!  3 fat pieces of flautas, covered in some green sauce with very generous servings of guacamole and sour cream. The chips and salsa that came before the meal was perfect too and totally hit the spot.  Chips were fresh and still piping hot when served and salsa that was just right - not too spicy, not too mild!  And did we look totally parched?  Cause I've never had my water filled so much in such a short while!   We arrived around 11pm or so, so the music was bumping and had us dancing in our seats!   Great time was had and I'll definitely be stopping by again for those delicious flautas and to say hi to Chris!

9T0tCXq0y44xsd_0uV_aTA.text: We have been here about 6 times and have loved it every time.  A must try in Vegas!! It's kinda tucked away in planet Hollywood. If it was in a more open area is would be packed. So there is short lines. I love the slab of carne Assad but I like to order it with beans and rice verse the potatoes and veggies.  Chips and salsa are great. They just started charging for chips and salsa which is a bummer.

42hdlXWSLab8xlo6N7uc5g.text: No, it's not earth shattering Mexican food, but if you're looking for a good lunch spot on the strip that offers affordable, strong drinks, friendly staff and good atmosphere... this is it.  I've been coming here almost annually on business trips.. There's always a spot at the bar and quick, attentive bartenders making strong, from scratch margaritas. You can not beat their $10.95 lunch specials (Served Mon-Friday 11:30am-3pm) where you can add a Margarita for $5. At 3pm, their Happy Hour starts which also includes margarita specials. You can't find this quality of food for this cheap price anywhere else on the strip. I always get the steak street tacos that's served with refried beans and spinach rice. Can not beat it!

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can&#39;t beat the lunch special. Delicious steak tacos and side for 10.95
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious, strong &amp; inexpensive margarita made from scratch
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent lunch specials. Shocker on the strip!

X2PWgJ6npSHVVxeduFHlIQ.text: The service was great, the employees were personable. We went for Happy Hour & my husband ordered $5 taquitos & I ordered two street tacos, also $5. He enjoyed his taquitos and those were some of the best street tacos I've had. Killer choice!

vLLUM7Ryn1LncF8-GQ-KBA.text: Last minute dinner decision in Vegas led is to Yolos. There was little to no wait on a Saturday night. We ordered the table side guac, nachos, and fajitas. Our food was ready fairly quickly and everything tasted good.  Our waiter was slow to refill our beverages and chips and salsa. Also, it took a while to get out check and we had to have them fix it because they charged us for the wrong items. The food was very good, but the service was sub par.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table-side guac
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry margarita

gJJ54Df4aczKEEMAXbHzDA.text: Located in Planet Hollywood, this Mexican grill restaurant has many "traditional" items you'd find in a Mexican restaurant. Bring your appetite because even the salads and appetizers are big.   The Yolo steak salad was amazing: fresh, flavorful, and pleasing to the eye. The quesadilla had a lot of cheese...was a bit on the oily side but when you pair it with the guacamole and salsa Fresca, it balances out nicely. The bartenders were cool and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Quesadilla
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M0GY-b3xKpXl9OgIxww-rg.text: If you are looking for a quick hot meal with no waitstaff service after you get served  while at the Planet Hollywood hotel and casino than try Yolo's.

kWkYUHabraNpl1uUHP-YAw.text: Fun little Cantina inside Planet Hollywood if you're craving chips with salsa and guacamole with some Margaritas! We have never actually tried the food here, just usually stop by and sit at the bar when we have been walking around all day and want to just people watch.

nMAc2OWLcIeQih_0vCBNow.text: I visit this location and was excited to try some Mexican food and unfortunately was disappointed. We ordered the Chile  reyeno and burrito and both did not taste anywhere near authentic. All the food tasted prenase which would make sense why it came out within 5 mins of sitting. The barbocoa meat was beyond dry, everything tasted as if it was previously frozen.

dxCAz2Xx-mJtN0_9TiQMUQ.text: Amazing food! Big fan! The drink selection could have been better but the nacho appetizer le and fajitas definitely were 10/10!!! The quesadillas were fantastic!!!

GjrD5rlTqcOGLHwd2SKJzA.text: Last week, while in Vegas, I made a trip to YOLOS. This was my 8th time there. I tried the enchilada and it was served with refried beans and some  Mexican rice. OMg... Ithought I had died and gone to Tex Mex heaven. The enchilada was huge and filled with ground beef, vegetables like green peppers.  The dining room was quiet, clean and the server, Maya, was polite and served our meals quickly and efficiently.  The meal was reasonably priced and I will return again, without hesitation. $5 margaritas at happy hour.

YdvtdmTvRZfOOEtZIFnyPw.text: The food at Yalos was disappointing. My entree was shrimp and chicken fajitas. The shrimps, peppers and onions were quite good, but the chicken was overcooked and dry. The rice and beans were lukewarm. I sent them back and received hot sides. My wife's order was ecletic - street corn, which was overcooked, 3 fried fish tacos that contained fish pieces no larger than her forefinger, and chicken wings, which were good. Her rice and bean sides were lukewarm, but she did not send them back.  Of more concern was the glassware. My martini-style margarita glass had a piece broken off of the stem base, making for a sharp edge. My water glass had a small, albeit sharp, spot on it's rim. Thankfully, I did not cut my lip.  The bright spot was our waitress. She was excellent and handled my "problems" courteously and efficiently. I saw her speaking with a person who I assume was the manager. Clearly Yalos tried to make things right. We were not charged for our cocktails and our meals were discounted by 20%. This was a well appreciated gesture, however, the food was not very good overall. I rate Yalos overall at 2.5 stars for the food. I rate our waitress at 5 stars. Unfortunately I did not  get her name.

9BIFDHTIZTAin-USfdsR9A.text: I came in here twice and went to a meet and greet at one of the concert there an in between both nights we came in here because I heard they had excellent pork tamales and let me tell you something they were out of this world The last time I was in there there was this African-American guy who was serving us they have really nice bartenders and it's humped up atmosphere  Pretty cheap to for a hotel restaurant

L-onu7DafhDAxiQVkomT7Q.text: Mexican food is on my top 3 favorites so when I come to a restaurant and the food is just not up to par it really disappoints me.   Although reviews weren't so great, we decided to check this place out before the BSB concert. We sat at the bar, it was pretty busy but we were able sit automatically. Ordered a few drinks, those were pretty good. I got a drink that was like a strawberry lemon drop with an edible flower. Super cute and delish.  I got the ceviche. My friend got carne asada tacos and their fresh tabletop guacamole. Nothing special about the food. Meat on the tacos looked dry. The guacamole was just regular, needed more salt and lime. The ceviche was alright needed something more.   Service was good no complaints. Food was mediocre.

cFnhR1PlTystmRhIkDGZ-Q.text: Overpriced food and drinks. One big waste of time and money. They even make the place a lame, wannabe nightclub after the restaurant closes. Music is way too loud as well.

_McbfudEgqumWkQEK0RxyQ.text: This is a hit or miss Mexican Restaurant in Planet Hollywood.  The sevice was excellent.  Eric was on it.  We had the fresh guacamole which was made tableside, great.  Next we ordered the Posole soup and Chicken tortilla soup, Posole great but the tortilla was okay. For entree we had the Chicken taquitos, cold in the middle and the Ground beef burrito with Red Chile sauce, rice and beans.  That was okay as well. Burrito was salty, never had Mexican rice with peas and carrots.  Dessert was Flan,  which I normally always order.  This one was disappointing, really disappointing! It is usually smooth, silky, and custardy.   This one was DENSE with some kind of cake bottom.  Flavor was okay but texture was not. 2 drinks and one soda grand total $105....WHAT?

EWA5Sg0rxVg7fwo8YiHTjw.text: I was pleasantly suprised here. The food was fresh and tasty, the prices were definitely fair, and the service was good. We started with the chicken nachos, which can easily feed 4. Lots of cheese, juicy and flavorful shredded chicken, and fresh chips. Enchiladas we full of the same juicy chicken, with cheese and cilantro rice on the side. I had the street tacos, which were pretty authentic. You can mix and match the 3 tacos you get - I chose mahi, steak and carnitas. They were all good in their own right.  If you have a craving for good mexican food in Vegas, this would be a solid place to try. I'd go back.

zpVaJKx1mM3HuOe_pjA9Gw.text: Had a busy work day and was very scared to grab food from the strip. I stopped at Yolos and was taken care of by Tice. Even though she seemed very busy, she never neglected to make sure that I was doing ok. Every time I looked around the staff was very friendly. She recommended a chipotle chicken dish and I was a little skeptical but decided to try it. It was AMAZING. I will def. come back and recommend this spot to my coworkers. This place gives out such a great vibe so I will see you all soon! Thanks Tice and staff!

8BIvD5KuCbzCfgS4Gf3YhQ.text: Expected the worst, was pleasantly surprised! We happened upon happy hour and enjoyed decent margaritas! Didn't taste like overly synthetic bar mix and were sufficiently boozey! We ordered some taquitos and flautas which were pretty great! The pork was juicy and flavorful and the taquitos were crispy and nicely seasoned. Served with a ridiculous amount of sour cream and some tasty guacamole. Overall a great place to get tipsy before you gamble away all of your hard earned pennies.

rd_GR1d4yt2NCA_Xmc1pag.text: We decided to go to Yolos today after a bit of shopping.  Our server, Margie took great care of us.  I had the shrimp tacos & they were delicious!!  My husband had the shrimp fajitas & he loved them too.  The cilantro rice was so good, I should have gotten a second order of it! I  really like that you get guacamole on your plate with your food & it isn't an upcharge. We are locals & we will recommend Yolos when people come to town!

67f8muGcEncKHe2UGr0RFg.text: happy hour margaritas! steak tacos amazing! chicken fajitas oohhh yumm!  next time i'm in Vegas i will be returning  here for sure!

rQfbKNt9a5aKtJy7X6yJLg.text: Good street tacos!  Good service too. Went here for a light dinner one night in Vegas.  Didn't have any drinks here but they looked good.  Their salsa was really good as well.  Service was speedy and attentive.  I'd definitely go back!

1erZzyo1aEus18iRdlPNKg.text: Got a veggie enchilada and the mahi mahi. The veggie enchilada was kind of bland but the mahi mahi was good. I would definitely get the Mexican rice. The other was dry and tasteless. Would probably give it another shot.

I7yBqymHqkaN4FKKPsznvA.text: One of the best places I ate in Vegas.  I recommend ordering the guacamole appetizer. It was worth it to watch our waitress make it fresh right in front of us -- plus if you don't like something they can easily leave it out. I had mushroom fajitas and they were awesome! Strawberry Margarita was not that great. I expected more from a Mexican restaurant. Waitress was very attentive.

IuUg9mAbkiH_TgVyy02XvQ.text: Loved the Margarita Corleone!  The fresh guacamole made table side was fantastic!  Great place to eat and reasonably priced, which can be tough in Vegas. Try it, you will definitely not be disappointed!!

8b7Ic5Clqjo6B01RCyPOGg.text: drunkin chicken nachos .... a MUST !!! I have been here a few times and every visit is better then the time before! food Is great , fun environment and awesome staff!!!!! when you are in the mood for good Mexican I recommend trying it....   assume rent is high in a place like Planet Hollywood... pricey mexican american food in a casino so thus the 4...   still think the drinks are awesome and the bartenders are actually knowledgeable so I try to revisit them when in PH

GQmraFbaoa2iEVG0a5bAaQ.text: Came here on Sunday during some big football game going on so it was pretty busy!   Our waiter was very nice, and we didnt wait at all for a table.  I ordered the drunken chicken nachos...they were Sooooooooooo good!! Probably the best nachos Ive ever had!!  Before the nachos we had a small bowl of tortilla soup...the presentation of it was awesome!  They bring out the shredded chicken and tortilla strips on a plate, then the waiter comes over and pours the broth over it in front of you!!  Sooo cool, and it was very yummy!!  Service was a little slow at times, but uderstandable because it looked like each waiter had to cover a lot more tables than normal.  All in all I cant wait to go back and have the nachos again!!

vT5GclyRkLsIwig3CzB3gQ.text: I went to this restaurant a couple of weeks ago. The service was super fantastic. Nadjanna and Guillermo were my bartendars for the night and they hooked it up nasty. The raspberry margaritas are to die for (but strawberry is my favorite!)  Suffice to say I walked out of their feeling really good. Im actually going back their this weekend and I cant wait to drink! :P

nqd6w_4XonEbFMlMBH4Oug.text: drunken chicken nachos a must every time im in sin city ! cilantro rice is amazing ! fresh guacamole at your table reasonable prices considering its atmosphere

RCUaknTuiXtzqA41NOFwZA.text: Every time I'm in Vegas I stay at Planet Hollywood, and almost as soon as I can I eat at Yolo's. I adore their cilantro rice and would kill for its recipe. I've tried to recreate it at home but never even come close. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is that they keep changing the tortilla soup. It was amazing the first time I had it, and was different every other time. One time they didn't even have it on the menu and had some corn chowder type thing instead.

PTwloijNz_D0IZKCFQz6UQ.text: I will never truly know if this food was actually good, or if I was just that hungover.  But, at the time, the freshly made guacamole was fabulous, as was everything else.  Felt like the wait staff was too minimal though and it took quite a while on refills.

SZRsk-6IKfiVE0Iad4ESLg.text: So I was not in the mood for Mexican but I went with friends.  The chips and salsa was yum and then the salad was SOOO dang good. Attentive wait staff, accommodating to special requests.  Friends had the fajitas that came out sizzling hot and they were very happy as well.

uQfEsWdxFL5n7ANiMeYc7g.text: im sorry i found this mexican resturant inside the planet holly wood casino. i like this mexican resturant so much i ate here 2 days in a row for an early dinner. about 4:00 p.m.  service was good but could be better. i really enjoyed the sizzling mushroom Fajitas with beans on the side . i told them no thanks to the rice so i dont know how the rice is.   its a very good choice if youre a vegan and nightmare if youre on a low calorie diet because you are guarented to gain weight.  i finished eating 4:10 p.m. its 10:47 p.m. and im still full.  thanks yolo's for destroying my diet with youre above average delicious food.

ShcfAjKq84e1IsnD3t_zgg.text: service was horrible, went for lunch very few tables were occupied and took forever for drinks, food and check.  Food was so-so.. and pricey,  as a local I sure won't recommend this place to anyone. Better restaurants on the strip

UduOFGsX2ucH2cdYi88YWA.text: I went there with three of my coworkers while we were in Las Vegas. The atmosphere was pleasant, and the food was tasty and filling. The guacamole was a definite hit.

BSktiUzwasP0IfvrV_YbuQ.text: Awesome nachos! Even more awesome bartenders! We stayed at Planet Hollywood for about a week and went to Yolos every day. I'm 100% serious when I say this - I thought about their nachos all day (specifically the drunken chicken nachos). The steak nachos were quite yummy as well. Christina, Chris, Nadjana, and Guillermo provided great service and were a lot of fun. Even the manager, Hillary, joined in on the fun for a bit. Loved it so much, I bought a Yolos tank top.

arWaQWmjzXIgo-eLI8jPTg.text: I do not normally do reviews...but this place inspired me to do so...simply great service and food! I grew up out west and love Mexican food...this place really is top tier. And I like hot and spicy -- if you do as well make sure to ask for the Diablo sauce, costs an extra couple of bucks but has serious kick!   I visited this place by myself and ate at the bar...bartenders were helpful and very nice...my server named Nadjana gave me her honest opinions on the best items on the menu and was dead on accurate...and just a genuinely nice person!   I would absolutely endorse this restaurant if you like great Mexican food...and no kidding...some of the best service for a restaurant on the strip...and I am in Las Vegas at least 1x month!! True gem!

Vx8m09xHHXoXcE_zl5rSrQ.text: The food is good and the price is decent. I wasn't too hungry so I ordered myself a strawberry margarita and a plate of the habanero hot wings ($8) because I was curious about the dry rub.  The hot wings were hot!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I'm a fan of hot hot wings so I was satisfied, but no one else at the table wanted to touch them. If you've ever ordered atomic hot wings from Wing Stop, they're not quite as spicy but they definitely compare. But enough about hot wings from a Mexican restaurant...  The margarita was really good. Wish I had one right now... I had bites of chicken nachos, a carne asada plate, and beef fajitas--delicious as well. The fresh guacamole is great, too, although I heard complaints about the endless chips being too salty.  I don't know if I would come back to Yolos since there are so many other places to try in Vegas, but I would recommend it to a first-timer looking for fairly-priced Mexican food on the strip.

oyTtnge-GGX2xO0L4wQStQ.text: While staying at Planet Hollywood, we checked out Yolo's for lunch while waiting for friends that were gambling.  Ordered some wings as appetizers along with some soft tacos.  Pretty decent stuff, and I'd eat here again if given the opportunity.    Service was very good for our table, and everyone was very hospitable.

vMin1z_2oxfp3ow36016aw.text: Stopped in for week night dinner and was seated right away. From the beginning I liked our waiter. He was attentive, knew the menu and drinks, but didn't pester us. He was just right in my book. We started with a couple of margaritas that were quite tasty but not overly boozy along with chips and salsa. Had the crab cake gordita appetizer that I really liked. Then the carnitas street tacos which were very good. My wife had the Shrimp and cheese stuffed chili relleno which was quite tasty too. She really liked it. I'd go back here again for sure.

SiRA3F7Bhc_SbYQLAc1NsQ.text: Fantastic food! I loved that our lunch tasted so fresh and yummy! We went in there at an odd hour (4:00pm) and everything was great. Service, food and such.

0YTtpsQRq8RwkAJ86GzjGQ.text: Cool bar in PH. Good food and drink specials. Even better the service. Make sure and ask for one of the beautiful bartenders, Christina or Nico. If they are not there when u visit u can see them on posters or the marquee outside

GZpim7AA1rcwRzRsHxDB4A.text: Dude, I can't even lie.. I usually won't touch a Mexican spot inside a resort, casino, tourist attraction.. I just have too much self respect for my stomach. I was in Vegas last weekend and met a few of my Dutch friends, and of course they saw this place and wanted to get their grub on.. so who am I to turn down a tourist wish?   The place is actually pretty nice, a full bar right at the front and the layout is pretty clean. I ordered the Mahi Mahi fish tacos with black beans and rice, and I gotta say.. they were the BEST fish tacos I've ever had. Believe me when I say.. I've had me some fish tacos during my life.. but these were just so damn tasty. The dutchies at the table enjoyed their food too, so all in all it was a damn good meal. Only 4 stars because the price was a bit high, but otherwise I'll be back.

i5-cYEYqlF3ulvBkYrDqLw.text: The food is good and so are the cocktails. I had their Mahi-Mahi Tacos :-) and loved the cilantro rice. They have cool interior and lighting...very modern and fun/cute.  On Fri/Sat nights, they turn their space into a dance floor and play latin music. Don't expect salsa tho...more top-40 type songs. And the crowd is a lil ghetto...we didn't stay long.

lpxUKK0QhrqGiCCKQLobwg.text: Our bartender Nady was extremely nice and made us feel comfortable. The drinks were fabulous. We attended the bar every night during our stay in Vegas.  Service and food were pretty goods..From NYC

A-eVNctxAcuFV3WYDbp47A.text: PROS: I love Mexican-American food. You know, with that black bean and cilantro rice kinda twist? Yup. I had shredded beef enchiladas and Coronas galore.   CONS: My poor friend had a steak tostada and I guess it was terrible, so maybe don't order that. unB0RTfgooL4b82pYXo5hg.text: Love Yolos! Every time I'm in Vegas I have to make a stop here! Very casual little spot in the Planet Hollywood hotel. I always have the steak nachos. DELICIOUS! If you're in the area, a must try!

X7nDm1Tvr6DaDtBCNe9eZg.text: So I was just at yolos and I must say... Great spot.. Food was good but portions could be bigger.. Then again I love to eat so maybe i'm wrong. Lol.
