ds6Z4Nr-QFLtERQP4DxHxQ.text: Food was sub par, one step up from taco bell. The drunken nachos were ok, but hard to eat. The main courses were not spectacular. Mojitos tasted like a cheap sugar mix... Overall it was $80 for two people, I wouldn't think it was worth $40.

3PjFs1RQUqoF_Py9J-pICA.text: Had lunch there today and enjoyed everything about it - the recommendations from Margie were great, the food was delicious, the ambience was fun, and the 15% discount with my True Rewards card was an awesome surprise. What's not to like? I recommend it!

dyvWVwD1jIm2Rw3VSOY_gQ.text: We love this place.  Bartenders are very friendly, one beautiful young lady has worked there for years and she always remembers us, even what we drink! The best guacamole and tortilla soup around.   Nice  place to cool off, have friendly people help you and have some great food.

eIjLa8RilPCcoIvCkAMeTA.text: This weekend my friends and I were in the mood for some mexican food while on the strip.  We thought we'd try Cabo Wabo, but when we walked in, it was so crowded and we could barely fit into our table because the seating was so tight between tables.  Also, it was really too loud to have a conversation.  I remembered passing Yolos inside the Planet Hollywood casino, so we decided to go there instead.  It wasn't crowded at all, the food was delicious and we had a waiter by the name of Gustavo who was awesome!  Since we hadn't been there before, he made recommendations from the menu and totally took care of use while we had a long relaxing lunch.  I'd highly recommend it if you're in the middle of the strip and don't want the inconvenience of waiting around for a table...

kyj1ORBhxh8N7QRuoXCuQg.text: We were looking for a good lunch spot to get out of the heat, enjoy some more upscale mexican food and say goodbye before we all left for the airport.   Made a reservation on Yelp after reading the reviews. Still had to wait when we got there, but we won $21.00 on the penny slots while waiting so it paid for part of the lunch ;)  You have to pay for chips and salsa and we had 3 die-hard salsa fans, so we ordered two orders - which got pricey, especially because there is not a lot of salsa in each order (although what you do get was very, very good).   I had the vegetarian enchiladas and added guacamole (for an extra charge). The sauce could have used a little more punch in the flavor, but all and all it was really good. I enjoyed the cilantro rice as well.  The other two dinners ordered the chicken burrito and taco lunch specials and said they both loved their meal.   Cool drink menu presentation at the table (like an iPad type menu) and the service was good and attentive. I liked how dark it felt in there - good ambience to forget you are in bright, hot Vegas.   Decent meal - I am not sure I would rush back when I am back in Vegas, but recommend if you like a little upscale American version of Mexican food and some good salsas.   (I tried to forget the name was Yolo the entire time I was there - was that named intentionally or coincidentally?)

7FW82HTBGVEDSR_i1hhRig.text: Bar is ok. Prices are not too bad but I can't recommend this place for the karaoke it advertises. They even advertise free shots for singers. The DJ takes requests but seldom let singers sing. The DJ just plays dance music.

oJmxuyWqS-n2-CVtpLuh6g.text: tasteless, nothing special. they have good portion but very bland, I'll be generous and give them 3 stars but I don't think I would be back.

5FTI6Xt6QcZespyWtnqj-A.text: I've eaten at Yolos plenty of times and everyone I end up getting the chicken tortilla soup. For being a casual eatery open to the casino floor, they make a killer tortilla soup.   This isn't your average soup, you get an experience: The shredded chicken, tortilla strips, and toppings come out in the center of the bowl. Then the waiter pours in the soup itself. Why is this glorious???  Compare your cereal that's been sitting in milk for a bit vs cereal right when milk is poured on it. One is soggy and one is crunchy.   Tortilla strips are meant to be crunchy. Ask for a few slices of avocado and a squeeze of lime. It's the Mexican way to eat it. It adds greatness.   The guac isn't very good. It needs more salt, like, onion, jalapenos, there are no tomatoes, and it's over blended. Leave some chunks in there for texture. I wouldn't recommend getting it if you have guac opinions.   I've also ordered tacos from Yolos. They were surprisingly pretty good. I'd order them again if I wasn't so into the tortilla soup.   The drinks are good. The staff is welcoming and attentive. I've only sat at the bar area, but there is a restaurant area a bit more concealed from being right smack in the casino.

CfQWsv1XZWysyeBZ678sLQ.text: We sought out this bar after coming here the year before especially for the Margaritas that Chris and Alex make. They are beyond delicious!! The service was amazing and everybody was so friendly. Make sure to get the steak torta salad, delicious!

PH0hNOUdtVQvttjTjaC6cA.text: A week after my visit I was contacted personally by the manager of this branch. She called me on the phone and apologized for my having gotten sick and assured me that she would personally coach her team to ensure that this wouldn't happen to anyone else. She was sincere, professional, and kind and I appreciate that more than anything. I honestly would visit again now knowing how seriously she took this issue of allergies. The fact that she took time out of her busy day to contact me, refund my bill and assure me her team would be coached speaks volumes. I'm so happy that one day I can return and know I will be able to eat without worrying about getting sick!   Thank you Staci

0n35bWJ2r_vIbThf5B6tMw.text: You know how, generally when you're starving after being on the booze train and really anything will normally taste good then? Plus, I love mexican food so yes, I loved Yolos. However, make no mistake, I'm not saying this because of the booze and my love for the type of cuisine; the food is pretty good.   Their shrimp tacos are amazing and my burrito was very nice as well. It's a cool place to hang out over some food and drinks. The waiters and waitresses are very nice. I highly recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken taco me please! #yelpingusa

-rIyVKEqzicwcx7n-Ogv4Q.text: The guacamole here is awesome.  We visit this place every time we come to Vegas. Great food. We had great service from Gustavo. The place is run so well. Food is always fresh and tastes good and come out fast. The manager here is very hands on and does a wonderful job.

1CFyLH_0eL5Wmoqf-7xG6A.text: Las Vegas can be difficult, if you're dining in a larger group, want to have a nice time, but also need to keep the cost down.  We choose Yolos, because Mexican is usually a safe bet, and are happy we did.  We had a great time!  Yolos is not fancy . . . rather just slightly more elevated than your average neighborhood family place . . . but it's lively, hip and fun.  The decor is bright.  The energy is great.  The service is friendly, attentive and well-paced.  The food?  Actually, pretty good.  Drinks were tasty.  The "Drunken Nachos" were incredible.  The "Street Tacos" were flavorful, though more mainstream than those you'd actually find at a good street truck, and I personally loved my flank/hanger steak.  In short, the food was good, solid Mexican fare, well prepared and fresh, but not exceptional.  A good time.

3q-EPBgaw2WRizk2yaKTNQ.text: Had reservations for date night before the Britney Spears show... Originally wanted to check out the Gordon Ramsay burger joint but unfortunately there was going to be about a 45 minute wait and they did not accept reservations, yolos service was pretty decent wished they gave complimentary chips and salsa like usual Mexican restaurants we had to pay the chips were pretty stale nearly broke my tooth chewing them... I ordered the fish tacos which were just ok.. With black beans and cilantro rice.. Don't think I'll come back when there are better choices for Mexican.

kgC2PsLK5OS2f5qTE-lkmg.text: Stayed in Planet Hollywood for 6 days and this was the only bar I enjoyed!! I didn't eat here,  but came for the after hours! Karaoke is a blast and for Vegas,  the drinks are reasonably priced!! Alex is a great and friendly bartender and the karaoke DJs were entertaining! Not one bad night at this place!

ZHeQCzo_qlhHLM_mbGRY6Q.text: Really nice server. Kinda slow to get food and bill-not sure if they were low on staff, but it wasn't busy. Appetizers are pretty big and it tasted decent.

Hy0jiQPsUM5_NbJR-VaA8Q.text: I had the chile relleno with diablo shrimp. I love chile rellenos and this one was not worth the $19. It came with cilantro rice that tasted like the mexican rice my bf had. And 3 pieces of small sized shrimp. Service  was ok.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile relleno with diablo shrimp. $19

qa4Lyd3LThk8kK6mbcY8Yw.text: Post New Years Eve is the THE TIME to hit Vegas up for some deals.  At Yolo, we are talking happy hour $5 deals.  $5 drinks and $5 bites. The street tacos (had both the chicken and beef) were well worth $5.  You get two tacos stuffed with surprisingly yummy meat.  Since you get 2 tortillas per street taco, I suggest breaking them up into 4 actually bite size tacos!  I was salivating over the sizeable plates of $5 tequitos and $5 quesadilla, but trying to maintain my figure I worked so hard on before Vegas, I abstained.   Lots of $5 margaritas were flying out of the bar, but since I can't drink tequila, I stuck with the quite passable $5 white wine.    In the evening, house drinks jump to $10, which isn't too bad.  Especially when they come with a side of karaoke.  *sings* Total Eclipse of the Hotel California, Wanted Dead or Alive, a Sweet Caroline.........you totally just thought "Buh buh bah" didn't you.

3OtZ72jL5BkSimA-hUimrg.text: I visit Yolo's just about every time I come to Vegas. I get to "rock on" during the karaoke nights. The bartenders Chris and Alex are funny and attentive. It's a great place to people watch and live out your American Idol fantasies.

_P0MWoUUC_rd9osllHgfuQ.text: This review is based solely on their happy hour. I didn't eat but I did partake in 3 or so margaritas.   The margaritas during happy hour are 5 bucks which is amazing for Vegas and they are strong. I highly recommend them!!  The service is SLOW. They only had one waitress on so you have to be a little agressive and ask for drinks when they pass by but for five bucks, you can't really go wrong!!  Happy Hour is from 3-5 and it's the best one I found on the strip!

Fh-PgTJR0u4iFBNSybjbTQ.text: Yolos was a great Mexican choice. The food was delicious and the portion sizes were satisfactory. The staff was attentive and checked in multiple times to make sure the table had everything they needed. The margaritas were great with multiple tequila choices available. I would recommend this restaurant based on the service alone. Located inside Planet Hollywood, this place also had karaoke from 11pm-4am where every person who sang a song got a free shot from the bar. Great setting, great staff, great food.

HbfUa8jks9L97TQWfwenlg.text: Hard to recommend this place when there are so many great Mexican places in Vegas,  This one is just ok, nothing special.    Good place to watch a game while snacking and drinking.

Hb0H-qydcSKYv01WMZtc2A.text: Stopped by after work to grab a cocktail and Guillermo & Chris were amazing. Promote them! Customer service is amazing and drinks were delicious. If you're looking for a place on the strip where the food, people & drinks are great: this is the spot!

CxM8L4RRkwsVVa3s0Omwaw.text: Awesome guacamole made fresh at the table. Fish street tacos and cilantro rice were outstanding!! Great service.  I'll definitely come back.

sZCCBEB6LkAfMgJIvjay0g.text: So, of all the places I've been in Las Vegas, this is truly the worst yet.  I just couldn't find any positives at all.    Food - No joke, I got a fajita with maybe two-three pieces of steak.  It's like half of it dropped on the floor and they were like, oh well, only two pieces left.  Serve it up.  On top of that, it was truly awful!  No flavor at all.  I was eating onions and peppers on bread.  That's lovely.  Service - When the waittress asked me about this, I told her.  No complaint, just told her my thoughts.  Now, when the MANAGER came over, he looked completely unprepared, hungover, and like he was in over his head.  He stuttered like a fool, and just walked away.  There was no conversation at all.  Total busch league here.  No people, and I'm a bit shocked they're in business.  By the way, their signs say they have hooka starting at 10PM, which is a misprint, yet they keep the sign up.  Kind of funny.  Trying to be helping:  Go to Mesa Grill, which is the best in Vegas for Mexican (which is surprisingly bad in this city).

YQiTI8GGv51hWKQbsnMJlg.text: GREAT margaritas. I'm usually put off when I see a blended margarita coming out of a machine.... but this place at least adds tequila you can see and taste. Yummm!   The drunken chicken nachos are to die for! Unfortunately we ordered a 2nd appetizer -- the taquitos and clearly they were frozen food just tossed into a fryer. They tasted like something I could have pulled out of my freezer. That was disappointing, but besides that we had a great experience-- sat at the bar, good service, good margaritas. I'd go back for there for lunch.

RKBDwWq0tJD_zI9QkDDrSA.text: Pork tacos were fantastic. Service was good also. Not big drinker but the margaritas were flowing.

bRwdzGjoyvWtuzujLIFMSA.text: Omg karaoke!!!!!!  We stumbled upon this place doing karaoke while we were killing time.  I didn't eat so I can't comment on the food.  The karaoke girl seemed cool, but the sound system sucked.  The place was pretty empty so she had to put the rotation on hold for a long time.

Vqc_56p4dz0XHguFfOvS8g.text: I was in between meetings at Planet Hollywood and looking for a good lunch spot...Yolos was the perfect choice. We started with the chips and 3 dips...the chips were perfectly crispy with just enough salt and I loved the regular salsa and mango salsa. For my entree, I had tacos with cilantro rice. My favorite taco was the carne asada and my co-worker loved her fajitas. Everything was tasty and the service was super friendly and attentive!

2Q80CK0qtKTT_TTd-BpkMw.text: I LOVE this place!! I started coming here about 3 years ago when I first moved to Vegas.   The hostess was very friendly and made us feel welcome in our comfortable booth.  We had Regan as our server, and he was wonderful!  Being a server in the past, I have pretty high standards and know what good service entails. He was very knowledgable about the food and menu choices. We got the table-side guacamole which was freshly made and delicious by a very outgoing young woman who added onions and other ingredients to our liking. Then came our crab cakes and steak nachos as an appetizer. I can't even find words for how amazing they were...they are mandatory every time I eat there now. The service was impeccable, my drinks were kept full and and my server checked back after each course was delivered to make sure my dining experience was exceeding my expectations. The sea bass I ordered for dinner literally melted like butter. Highly recommended and easy to find in Planet Hollywood casino.

Dq1v4Sq6D31Sx5b8zS7gRQ.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE our visits to YOLOS!! We've been at least 5 times now,  and each time is better than ever. .. food is excellent,  atmosphere is fun, service is stupendous! Everyone is always super friendly, and our bartender,  Nadjana, is HANDS DOWN the best around--we loved her!! And our server,  Martin treated us like royalty---so cute and sweet and accommodating! Hope those 2 are there every time we return---wish we could pack them up and bring them back to Charleston, SC with us!!  Thanks for a great time as always, YOLOS! ! P.S.--We've connected with a manager there,  Stacie (sp?), and she's like no other. LOVE her!! Amazing personality,  beautiful, "spunky", a True professional AND a True Southern Bell! Always refreshing to find that in Vegas!!!

0n5BNdk4f4jLoJ-WFSIbLA.text: We decided to stop here for a quick appetizer and drink while gambling. I had a $5 lunch frozen margarita, which was very sweet. My fiance ordered a margarita on the rocks and said it wasn't too strong, but it had a better lime flavor. We ordered the ceviche to snack on and OMG, it was AMAZING! The bartender said it was the sous chef's mother's recipe. Arrived on 4 small corn tostadas and garnished with avocado. Delicious!

HgCqLOz9eOKwORiiE7FQ-g.text: Love it. Inventive, creative takes putting a spin on traditional Mexican. Timely and friendly service made for two great dining experiences.

SBnvgo7cXoZWxN2ZmoC6Qg.text: One of my girlfriend had recommended this place to me a long time ago.  Ever since then, when my hubby and I make our trip to LV it is a MUST for us to go to this cute lil restaurant in PH!  Their prices for their food can be a bit pricey, but very tasty.  I especially love this place for their delicious raspberry margarita!!  OMG so yummy.  Their bartender makes it with fresh fruit on the spot, two thumbs up!  Service is great here too. A must try!

jqBplvqLbfSmhoAPS6dXRg.text: My sister and I stopped in here for lunch because we wanted margaritas. Right off the bat, I loved the decor. It was fun and perfect for a couple girls wanting some drinks. We each ordered a regular margarita. Yummy. I also ordered another one that was pink; I think it might have been a raspberry margarita. I had to save it for after I finished my food because it tasted like that gum in the Zebra package I used to chew as a kid. Super sweet.  The food was pretty good. We order some dip; I can't recall if it was bean or cheese. The waitress warned us that it was pretty spicy, and she was right. But in a good way. I also ordered the enchiladas which were pretty darn good.  I do have to knock this place on a couple points, though. First, my sister's salad was weirdly salty; she couldn't even finish half of it. Second, the service really dropped off. It was great when we first walked in the door, but became nonexistent after the waitress brought our drinks.

xAEsF3jq-wJZgCETfObqMQ.text: Had a great time with good food, service, drinks and fun karaokeing! A great way to spend time with friends! A fun environment... even mixed it up with other karaoke'ers and had fun dancing too!

jI8DmEGgN-0i6PwdPuTDeA.text: Probably the best Mexican food on the strip! Fresh food great choices and everything tasted amazing. Be sure to flash your players card for 15% off. The wine selections are quite enticing and not super over priced. It's affordable food on the strip still with great flair.

NZOrDzd51d-llhZX3SisCA.text: *Just reviewing for the bar*  We had wandered in from The Strip looking for a nice bar to get a few drinks at. My homie was nice enough to buy everyone a round of Patron shots from the bar. It took a good five minutes for him to get noticed by any of the bartenders and it wasn't even terribly busy.  My main complaint? My Patron shot was warm. Yuck! Definitely not the way you want to drink Patron, All in all, not my favorite bar in the world. Hopefully, as a restaurant it's better.

wfpKeQGAiLjmD0xgpyCapQ.text: Wow! What a cool place! I had dinner there last week with my wife, the love of my life. We actually sat at the bar and enjoyed our time very much. Carlos the bartender took great care of us. He made us feel like we were special, great customer service skills. The food was excellent and served in a timely manner. We didn't know that it was Karaoke night night so when the DJ started playing that's when we really got fired up. We danced the night away and I actually mustered up the courage to sing a couple songs. Reyna, one of the managers, was kind enough to get us a table near the DJ. Over all we had an amazing time and we will be back.

YQwWHi9tgr0ton5hs531dw.text: I was in Yolos on December 26th with family. We reserved the table. When we came they offered us the table behind the column. When I was trying to ask if we can have the table next to that(the place was almost empty), the answer was: the table is reserved and we already attached every table to exact reservation(what a bunch of b..?!) Finally we got another table, after I said that I did reserve the table too.  And when the waitress was taking the order, we tried to translate her questions about rice preferences to our guests from Russia, she heard it and was trying to get away impatiently("you need the time, I'll come later"). What kind of service is that?? And than I saw that she brought the wrong check to the  table next to us! People were really disappointed! After we had the food, we were sitting for a while talking, and NO ONE cleaned the table full of plates for 30 min after we finished eating!!! She had asked if she can take the plates, but she didn't!!  We paid the check, she returned for it, and still didn't try to clean the table!?!  What the f.. service is that???  By the way, the food itself was good;)))) but the waitress... I'll never come back!

KP_f4AF-U6GBvCQsKYczIQ.text: This place is tucked right in the front corner of the Planet Hollywood Casino if you were to walk in from the strip. If you haven't been to the casino/hotel since they did a huge overhaul then you should come visit this whole area. As for dining experiences this wouldn't be at the top of my list. If you are on a budget however this is one of the better places to dine on the Strip if you aren't in a hurry to get somewhere.   A client invited us to dinner here for a dinner and some drinks and it was underwhelming at best. Our server ignored us constantly (even with empty beer glasses/liquor drinks) which you think he would be eager to refill for us. It was after peak dinner hours and he had 4-5 tables at best.  We are a pretty easy going group but walking by our table over and over again with empty glasses of anything is just unacceptable.   The food was an alright blend of Mexican food. Nothing too shocking or blow your socks off on the actual menu or unique items you will be eager to try out.   My favorite part of the meal without question was the table side guacamole they create for you and the salsa. These provided a great snack and I wish I only ate them for my meal. The enchiladas the server recommend for me we not as exciting as these chips/salsa/guac.   If your a tequila drinker (I am not) you can select from over 60 types at the bar here. The place seems like an appropriate place for a quick lunch when you hop off the roulette or blackjack table. The dinner we had here seemed mildly strange and not quite the right atmosphere or vibe. If our server wasn't so bad I think we could of chalked this place up to a 4 star but our lack of drink service put a damper on the night.

QofowW_c1Sidl2P2ZS8LiA.text: A gem of a find.  We were treated so well here by multiple waiters - we visited a few times for lunch.  Wait staff is incredibly accommodating, friendly and eager to please - say hi to Jose and Eric for us :-)  Food was fabulous!  Definitely order the guacamole - fresh, fresh, fresh; and even their chips were delicious!   Great variety in the menu for a Mexican Restaurant - tacos were terrific, and so was the Quinoa salad! All-in-all, an excellent value - something that is not terribly easy to find along the Strip, (outside of fast food)! Highly recommend you visit!

t4FNZIMKKu20YkgWknFOeQ.text: We sat at the bar and I had the shredded beef enchildas. Man, that was a lot of food. My husband had the pork tacos, so we traded bites of each others plates. I just loved all of it. Even the rice. The consistency was great, as well as whatever flavoring they add to it. A few nights after eating there, we stopped in for happy hour margaritas (only $4!), and I have to say, those were pretty damn good, too. I only wish we'd done a repeat dinner there instead of barfing up cash at Koi that night.

XB3Ma4a5dhkts6EWQDlm4Q.text: Food is pretty good for the price, friendly staff at the bar and karaoke there on Friday and Saturday you sing you get a free shot you can't beat that specially on the strip.

Bp_OaqzAJ8l20klrolno1Q.text: Good food. Nice service, decent price for the strip. Way less busy than other nearby similar Mexican restaurants probably because it's indoors only but good break from the heat! Great 10$ lunch special (15 with a margarita)

aVCat-yXupeAz2LaekI_gw.text: Went here for the second time and was impressed again.  My friend and I needed a quick grab before a show and I thought this was a regular mexican quick grab restaurant.  You can't really mess up burritos and tacos too bad.    So I ordered the steak salad for $16.  A few bucks extra, I thought, but on the strip, so oh well.  The salad was huge and had a lot of moist, perfect temperature, marinated, real steak.  Move on to needing a quick bite again at PH and I take my mom and cousin.  We ordered the guac...only 1 and a 1/2 avocados for $11.  A little skimpy on the portion.  But they made it table side and it was good.    Ordered the steak nachos...waiter does tell us it is only 7 nachos, not a pile...we say ok, well it was plated w 7 bites, but those bites had that same steak and about 2 1/2 bites of steak to each nacho.  I had to fork and knife the steak, but they were good and filling and we actually left one on the plate.  My mom ordered the steak burrito and again, it pretty much had a real, properly cooked medium rare, very pink, tender and marinated steak inside.  It was served with white beans and I prefer black, but otherwise a good choice.    Wait staff was ok, happy hour at belly up bar only and we called ahead to see if we could use our Caesars comp, but then they said no and we had an ordeal using our points, but the host came and fixed it...they need to communicate with each other...still not sure the deal on that issue, but we had the phone number on our phone where we had called ahead two hours earlier to ask.    This is my go to quick bite when at PH...just always say no to Blondies...beware...really bad.

a5wXXpIlgI1EmoozDyzVLg.text: I've been here about five times in the past five years and this restaurant never fails me. I always get the strawberry margarita blended and it comes in a cool glass. It isn't authentic Mexican food, more like Southwestern with a twist. The menu is limited and you have to pay for chips and salsa if you want them ($3 is all). I recommend the chicken enchiladas, caesar salad, and the flautas.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Light up cocktail menu

VldQI1lke2dZ1Uq-JcqcUg.text: The pork fajitas were very good!  Service was also really good.  Enjoyed the entire experience! Yelp reported this restaurant was closed but it definately wasn't!

U2B1_3FX0CX8YTLJmXyBgw.text: Eh! I was very disappointed in this place! FIRST OF ALL... DO NOT go here for hookah... It is overpriced and does not even last 5 minutes... They charge by the coal, in which you pay 25 dollars for only one coal.... Needless to say the whole time the hookah was burning....    Now off to the food... We ordered the chips and guacamole and when it came... there was just a to go box, with the top part cut off, full of chips...... We waited about 5-10 minutes waiting for the guacamole to come when we finally realized there was a spoon full in the middle of the tray hidden under the chips. IT WAS HORRIBLE!    The only reason this place gets a 2 instead of a 1 is because the manager was friendly. But I will not be returning to this place!

kCUbQP4fMzcBv_nlTvL0Gw.text: The phrase that best describes this dining experience can only be. "Aggressively mediocre." Our drink orders and meal orders were extremely slow and incorrect. Our check was not adjusted to reflect the corrections. We asked for salt and hot sauce that never came. We all described our food as "okay." All in all, a disappointing experience that took about an hour longer than it should have .

K26b70phJpaZ5s2gGyDD_w.text: We had dinner there after my lovely man had a good business meeting. Since I craved beans and we didnt want to drive off strip it was right there :)  The service is good, attentive for sure. The food is very fresh. I had the chicken fajitas and man had the steak fajitas. I liked the food a lot.  The spices were just right and the black beans delicious and very noisy later :) (yes I grew up in a barn)  The prices are higher than they should, but its the strip and these are tourist prices. But it was a good meal. I didnt sample the alcoholic cuisine since I drank too much the night before (and nearly invited a lady I made out with to the room...) so I stayed sober.  Its so convinient, in the middle of the casino of PH.

8W8SnAdHrWJHbrLObtuGeQ.text: For a Tex-Mex place in the middle of a casino in Vegas, Yolos was better than I expected (which was nothing).   The first time I went, I was grabbing a quick drink with my husband and a friend. Ended up ordering the chips and salsa as well. The different salsas were surprisingly tasty and the drinks were cold. Our waitress was beautiful with an attitude.   The second time we went was at about 1am. There were more of us and we were all tipsy and peckish. I sort of had a crush on our cute waiter from Brooklyn. We all ordered drinks and some chips and guac. Again, everything was just fine. Prices are reasonable. Music is super duper loud.   If I were staying at PH I'm sure I would grab a snack here again.

crhd_ilmat_pthOkFVw8EA.text: Your basic mexican grill place with burritos, enchiladas, etc.  A bit overpriced due to its location.  Food was good, not excellent, but the hours are great so you can get decent Mexican food fairly late.  There weren't very many people when I went, but service was very slow.

y2rZlzJtoY19crgtk-7DdQ.text: I love their guacamole! They make it fresh at your table. I love when it's real and not out of a bag. I wasn't crazy about the beef enchiladas, they were ok, but the tortilla soup, guac and salsa are delicious! I actually get excited when I go to Vegas because I get to go here :)

ow2lqBQo7rjVxPgyMRBWcA.text: Restaurant Review  Went here on a date last night. The food and the date were the same: DRY & UNAPPETIZING!  When we sat down they brought salty chips & salsa to the table. Gee thanks. Waiter takes order and disappears for the rest of the night...lucky. I should've done the same. Date ordered beer, (seemed pleased) I ordered water (I don't drink, but I should've bought an "Adios Mother F*cker" to ease the pain of this date!). For appetizers, The Man Who Will Now Have A Relationship With My Voicemail ordered a bean/queso dip concoction...FAIL!! He also ordered us taquitos. SURVEY SAYS: EPIC FAIL!!  For the main dish, we *gags* both ordered chicken enchiladas. Dear Cooks, Chefs, and Owners of Yolos,  WHEN IT IS YOUR JOB TO MAKE MEXICAN FOOD, AND YOU FAIL TO MAKE SOMETHING AS SIMPLE AS A CHICKEN ENCHILADA, IT IS TIME TO ASK YOURSELF: WHAT AM I DOING WITH MY LIFE?!!  Will Yolos and The Guy That Doesn't Have My New Number ever see me again? Probably not, and by probably...I mean definitely.

u55VSX_fk1vo72R7D-KERQ.text: If the portions were a little bigger or the prices were a little lower it would get 4 stars. The street tacos are very good. The cilantro rice is really good just not enough of it. The regular Mexican rice was tasteless and bland. The workers were pretty friendly. There just simply wasn't enough good too warrant 14$ for a plate that had barely any rice on it.

xoMev3DhtgQz16Bw26lfeA.text: Was in Vegas for business and did not feel like doing the "vegas" thing and wanted to instead do the relax and in suite spa thing. After looking at the room service menu and realizing that I am not P DIDDY I realized that there was nothing on the room service menu for me in my price range. So instead I went down stairs ordered some food from Yolos and never looked back. Took it to go.   I ordered the quesadillas which were really good. It came with side of sour, guac and salsa. It was big enough for me as a full meal. Plus it was about half the price of the room service food. And they were quick. The meal was ready in about 5-7 minutes.   You'll have to go grab a drink from an ABC store in the mall cause they have drinks too but don't have lids for their cups which when walking through a crowded casinos full of drunks is a necessary.   If I stay at the Planet again I will eat here again. Good food inside the casino.

tgaFkYK5ZD41a2_AlPxE-w.text: Came into Yolos for happy Howe st at the bar and the server came right in front of me did a bunch of things on the register and did not even acknowledge us even though I know she saw us. Many minutes later she came and took our order. The food here was amazing. We had the steak nachos and chicken quesadilla. very high quality meats and products used to make the food. If you dint mind the not so great service stop in and try the food.  I give the food 5 stars and the service 1 star

UqQwv9zw-39qqoRlOuKJcA.text: I am not too sure about the food or anything else on the menu, nor will ever dine in this establishment because of the lame DJ this place hires to be rude to customers of the hotel and casino. I ordered a slice of pizza from the establishment next door called Pin Up Pizza, since there were no spots to sit inside, my girlfriend and I took our pizza inside where there was a little ledge around the corner from Yolo's in the casino. This enormous slice of pie was picturesque, so I felt the need to snap a quick shot. This raging douche bag of a disc jockey took time out of packing his gear to come over and tell me "this is what our world is coming to that you cannot eat a meal without taking a picture and posting it on Instagram," he then proceeded to tell my girlfriend and I that we disgusted him. I then had some choice words for him and continued to take pictures just to piss the ass clown off, so if you decide to dine at this place, I recommend not going when this dumbass is "performing."

q9erOPY2Y360xw-Al00e9g.text: Walking thru planet Hollywood deciding where to eat we where given a flyer for a free tequila shot...so hey let's head over..it's "trendy" Mexican style food. Nachos consists of 5 individual nachos with steak and all the toppings.. but once you order off the appetizer menu the food is delicious. After 11pm this grill become a salsa nightclub, nice music and crowd but not the place to stay all night, even thou when we walked past this place at 6am to the parking garage people where waiting in line to get in.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DytYwLA2eKQGdcZew4yNvg.text: Im only reviewing based on drink specials  We had 6 margartias on the rocks, they tasted pretty good actually! N they were only 5 bucks each , happy hour is monday to thursdays (less busy days duhh) 3pm to 5 pm. Doubt i cant find better deal in vegas!  Cool place.

8eLbxVBHl3x0d-CBxaIdug.text: This reminds me of what TGI Friday's would be like if it were Mexican and actually used quality ingredients. It had that kind of campy, chain-restaurant feel. My shrimp salad was delicious, though! And the table-made guac was the real deal.  Drinks were weak. Wouldn't go out of my way to go here again, but definitely a solid meal if you are craving flavors from South of the border.

VryEFqsPZUX6gXNHe-csHg.text: Happy hour 3-6pm is a great deal. Get the guacamole that's made at your table, you won't regret it!

6t6yoyvEfMzPjr3uOA6icw.text: I went there yesterday for lunch,  we're walking around Planet Hollywood looking for some place to eat after a pool party, I'm glad we decided to try Yolos, great food, affordable prices and really good service....the hostess was super friendly, our server same thing ( a tall guy with glasses, I can't remember his name) , even the manager stop by our table twice to see if we needed something...I will definitely go back next time in Planet Hollywood .

NypxJytZFecYO-YgC9Gi1w.text: Get the flautas. You will not regret it!   We were iffy about getting Mexican food outside of San Diego, but a man passing by told us to try their happy hour menu as we were hesitating in front, so we did!  $5 margarita $5 steak tacos $5 chips and salsa with guac $5 carnitas flautas   Very happy with our selection. I can't say enough about the flautas, definitely my favorite of what we selected. Also, the music is so on point right now; I've heard three 'Nsync songs while we've sat here for 30 minutes  If you're considering a quick stop for happy hour appetizers, this is a safe bet.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good  flautas from happy hour menu
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour steak tacos! $5 GREAT steak

MyjNNcwZATJgLIdsKMhAaA.text: We stopped by YOLOS while we were waiting for our show to start. I started off with the cucumber/jalpeno margarita, it was just ok. I ordered the 3 taco combo, actually my husband and I both did. We both ordered one el pastor, one shrimp and one carne asada. I ordered refried beans and spanish rice.  Our food arrived and looked tasty. I started with a bite of the el pastor taco and it was love at first taste, great flavor.. I knew after filling up on chips that I had to at least take a bite of each one before I got too full to try all three. Geez, I just wanted to keep gnawing on the el pastor but I put it down and picked up the asada taco and sunk my teeth in.. bleeeh.. the meat had no flavor, very disappointing. I got over the disappointment of the flavor lacking asada pretty quick knowing I had that little pastor unit waiting for me to return to him.. I picked up the shrimp taco and took a bite of juicy deliciousness. Man was I wishing I hadn't filled up on chips. I pushed away from the table determined to let my food settle because I was not letting el pastor escape.. I didn't want to waste belly room on beans and rice but I did have to try.. beans had no flavor like the asada and the rice was just ok. Again, I was over that disappointment really fast because I was really just there for the tacos.  Try the el pastor because.. YOLO!

gtHsy3c452blgOVMJn5qSw.text: Ok..  if you guys come here you have to come meet Guillermo and Bryan the bartenders.. Those two will make your night..  I was riding solo that night because had to let go of the "three wheel" status.. And they made me feel like the most favorite person at the bar..  definitely definitely come meet these guys   Thank you Guillermo and Bryan for your service

8--_1AIG1nSK9Gcv788jGQ.text: Authentic is not a word that I would use to even remotely describe this food. The only seasoning used is SALT! The food is extremely bland and very generic. I'm extremely surprised of those who wrote good reviews. I wanted to give it a chance and really let the extra 1/2 star convince me and my friends to try this place while visiting Vegas.   The only reason i gave YOLO two stars is because of the drinks and the service. The house margaritas were only $5 and pretty strong and tasty! The service was also really good, but unfortunately not good enough to make up for the subpar food.   I just hope that those who dine here do not at all expect to eat authentic Mexican food and I'm pretty disappointed in myself that I have it a shot.   Sorry YOLO!

CIwG3vFaSXkVqO505fsGQw.text: YOLOS has always been a part of our "Vegas routine". However, after our last visit we will NOT be coming back again. We got someone else's chips and queso, then we got the wrong meat on our dish, and worst of all-- they didn't tell us that they'd discontinued the specialty item that we ordered!!! The very best thing on their menu has been the incredible delectable Drunken Nachos. I specifically ordered them and instead ended up with super crappy basic (cold!!) nachos. The whole thing was disappointing and frustrating. We will not be coming back.

CSkuCpzCZzELW75A59gICw.text: We really enjoyed our time at Planet Hollywood and Yolos is our new favorite bar since Halo Bar closed. The Bartenders and staff are excellent and take really good care of us. They are very friendly and made us feel welcome. We especially like Alex and Mo and Thays!

tT-C6dWwf-tpTOKATjF7Hg.text: Located inside of Planet Hollywood Casino area, YOLO's is one of those spots that you come to eat as maybe not the last resort but just under your first pick. I usually hate eating at little places like this inside of hotels because they literally screw you on prices but lets not spend too much complaining about that. It's Las Vegas, the Strip AND a casino! My crew wasn't really in the mood for the whole sit down experience so we took a seat at the bar and just ordered drinks.  I think our bartenders name was Alex he was pretty cool. The signature margarita that they offer is pretty good for I guess what it's worth. I had to add a side note to the bartender to make sure he makes it STRONG because I didn't want to be sober when I got the bill for this simple margarita. Nonetheless it got the job done and the oh so fantastic buzzed feeling slowly came after only a few minutes. Will I be back? Eh...

tbwzR0VvLbWYvGgtxn4E2g.text: We stopped in for a quick Margarita and taco before BRITNEY at the AXIS.  We sat at the bar as the table seating had a long wait.  Our bartender was attentive and got us in and out in 45 minutes.  Nice! I am not eating grains or dairy at the moment, so he had to check what I could order, I settled on the Mahi-Mahi tacos. They were delightful, served to me all separated in a"build-your-own" sort of way.  Everything was tasty!  I ordered a "Nor-cal" paleo Margarita, the bartender hadn't heard of them but I talked him through, and it turned out fabulous! This quickie easily enticed me to come back to try a full experience next time we are at PH (Planet Hollywood).

RDUUdwba61VAxa2jQJF-DA.text: Simple mexican food at its Vegas best...best at overcharging simple dishes.  We ordered the guacamole fresca and chicken street tacos.  Now the guacamole will be made right in front of you fresh, the server will bring out the ingredients in a mixing stone which already has fresh lime juice in it. At which he/she will mix it for you then place it on the table.  Food came out fast but it's street tacos, it's simple. Nothing really stands out with the Mexican rice and black beans. Same goes for the chicken as well. Overall it's something that an ordinary cook at home could make and that's exactly what it reminded me of.  I was eyeing the ribeye but I figured I'd save to eat a steak from a steakhouse.   For those two items and one soda total came out to $31. You could find better options nearby but if you're in a pinch to get food this place will do you some good.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simple chicken tacos.

FIa5CXu0fJUoIjSIaZquhw.text: Very disappointed in their new menu. No more grilled fish tacos or green rice. No more quac made at the table. Food was ok but more assembly line instead of prepared to order. Shame as this was a really good place.

Emqp_choGYVkuElDQJbTVQ.text: Great little Mexican spot located just inside Planet Hollywood.  The food is a little pricier, but good quality.  Awesome staff and great place for drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coronita+Margarita = delishballz

4c3_8clBmSzU8lLMXs9klw.text: Excellent food and the host Maya was VERY welcoming and kind.  We had a baby with us and she made us feel very welcome!  Reagan was awesome too, he was very accommodating to us and our needs.  Great job YoLa!!!

uSQnZYMEYBQr7C-Dxugh_A.text: Honestly, I can't even complain. We came here twice while staying at Planet Hollywood and it was great both times. We started the trip off with one of the best cocktails I have ever had, "The Patron Sidecar." So good. I ordered the Chicken Torta to get some food in me before our night out, and it was so tasty. I saved the rest for later to eat after we got back from a night of dancing, and still good. We then came back to have lunch on Sunday before our flight. We needed something to bring us back to life if you know what I mean. We ordered the nachos, and taquitos. They got the job DONE. Perfect little spot to have in Vegas. I will be back!!!

bR7GJ9u7ULq2snJpHXRNbQ.text: When I have friends in town I always take them here for Happy Hour. Cheap food, cheap drinks!  Some of their margaritas taste like dish soap though... so... I'd get a beer.

qDtyXsfuWplpY4i9fqTOPQ.text: This review is for the bar only.  Every time I am in Las Vegas I make sure to get a drink at Yolo's  It's right off the strip and easy to access inside of Planet Hollywood.  While the bar isn't stocked like other bars the bartenders here make great use of the available booze.  They can make amazing drinks on the fly that aren't on the menu.  Prices are better than most strip adjacent bars.  Plus the chips and salsa's are pretty epic. Yeah its just chips and salsa but damn they nail it.  The waitstaff and bartenders are very nice, attentive and fast!   Definitely come in and give it a try especially if you're staying at the Planet Hollywood.

xfbBXJU6DKJqHRFWk1lQKA.text: After finding out it would be a 2 hour wait at Gordon Ramday BurGR, we decided to hang out inside YOLOS (they had no wait) for drinks and appetizers. I was first impressed by the large, long booth we were sat at. That quickly changed when the people at our table kept kicking each other. There was no room under the table for us to sit comfortably. Our server was quick to take our drink order and gave us plenty of time to look over the menu.   We ordered a "Quesadilla" priced at $10 and "Empanadas" priced at $10 for our snackage. The quesadilla had jack cheese, onions and peppers inside. It also came with a side of salsa, sour cream and guacamole. The quesadilla was good, but average. If you want beef, chicken or shrimp in it then it will cost you $4-$5 more. The empanadas were well liked by hubby and I. They were stuffed with chorizo and had a green chile avocado salsa underneath them. The only complaint I have about that dish is the size of it. They put enough of the green chile avocado salsa on the plate so why not add just 1 more empanada to make it an even 4? If this were a cocktail party I could understand the small bites and portions, but this wasn't the case. With 4 people at our table it was awkward so hubby and I just ended up splitting one of them. The margarita did taste decent!   They have lunch specials during the week that right now start at $9.95 and a Happy Hour at the bar as well. Also beware about the music inside this place. it's very loud and it's hard to have a conversation with the people sitting right at your table.

fKf8fYvVuBVwat7n3lwH9w.text: Tried this place before our show and it had some highs and lows. First, we were seated right away and that was great because we were starving, but it was empty but for another table sitting next to is. The place was cute, clean, simple, and almost right on the casino floor so people watching was fun. The food was good but the rice was not warm at all, room temp at best. Our server Randal was great and informative and even mentioned I could take my beergarita with me if I couldn't finish it, it would've been nice to have him transfer it in to a cup for me as when I poured it myself I made a mess of our table. Overall, a better than average experience!

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread pudding bites

NRBueINkV1XSarMTJC3eIg.text: We decided to stop here while walking through planet Hollywood to dine.  (May 21, 2018 5pm)I've been inside the casino many times but decided to just give it a try.  Their food was bomb!!  I ordered the shrimp cerviche, wings and the albondigas soup.  The service was good too.  I would come back and recommend it to anyone who wants tasty Mexican food.

e1zN8pwPypPRi8CdY1MZ1Q.text: Delicious absolutely delicous, I got the nachos to share and the mrs got enchiladas de pollo and that stole the show!!

ZtPCfgltQjUjnRLvAGlZpw.text: Hope you like chewing on ice because you ain't getting a refill.. Good luck getting even a secondary request for anything, I had to politely ask for the bill by standing and walking to the front. They said they would send some one around.... Should've walked out and let them find me

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ktszkeGu40gHNJ0bQVUAyg.text: Eight of us really enjoyed this place last night. The margarita's were so yummy. I had the steak fajita's and they were tasty. My husband had the carne asada and it was moist and plenty of it. Others in our party had burritos and liked them. So over all a good dinner.

Kg8fVyQKpVuQlgBli73jLg.text: I highly recommend this restaurant. The feel is welcoming and the staff is friendly and inviting. The bartenders  (Chris and Alex) will usually hump in during karaoke night making for a good time and delicious food and drinks! Best place in town!

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UeW-FjViJ-X9hAjGCD3M2A.text: Great service and customer!  I got the Carne Asada tacos but the beans were horrible, they taste burn!!!

jB0k85A-YIKNq5wmQ3MbDQ.text: Great service, went two nights in a row while staying at Planet Hollywood. Sat at the bar both nights. Good service, food, and drinks.

NDeL_bdPARIu3OoAsnXwLw.text: Chicken burrito made me sick :/  Everyone that didn't get the chicken thought food was just OK.

XCrDOepgY0KHZFw4L_QzJA.text: I went here May 25, Friday for Latin nights. The crew/Dj were 1 hour behind schedule, no dancing till then. I stayed at the bar and ordered some drinks. I must say that the service/bartenders were on point, very courteous and worked as a team to take care of the customers, 5 stars to Alex and the rest of the bartender crew!!! As for the DJ(Ramsy), at first he did ok and played a good mixture but then got stuck on just playing Cumbia and Mexican music with the dance floor empty. I went to request a specific salsa song by Marc Anthony and his comment was disgusting! He proceeded to tell me with an attitude that he just played salsa 2 minutes ago and turned around and ignored me. A really good Dj takes the time to play what the audience/dancers would like. I didn't expect him to even play it right then either and just thought he was very rude and for that reason, I won't be going there any longer if I know he's the Dj! I will definitely be spreading the word to my clients and military friends to not waste their time and go elsewhere. That's too bad!!!! Someone really needs to have a talk with Ramsy and teach him common courtesy and respect.

U9_gR0PGrdWz_qMOPUAmZg.text: We tried this spot the first time we came to Las Vegas and loved it although it was a bit pricey. This time we happened to make it for happy hour which is 3-6 and got amazing deals. The happy hour menu has $6 plates and drinks. We tried the street tacos which were delicious! I would totally recommend eating at yolos!

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margaritas at Yolos

gtBel64izFws5KNG16UUDw.text: While in Vegas for a 21st birthday, decided to stop in at happy hour for some margaritas, easy to say, the absolute BEST waitress we've had so far on the strip. Our waitress Nady was simply amazing, fast friendly service, and we could easily see she works her butt off as she was the only bartender/waitress for happy hour! She made our visit very comfortable, and is fully deserving of al 5 stars!!!

briO7vVzNTDwi94qkySfBA.text: 1st time to vegas and this spot was our first choice to eat, my honey and i ordered the nachos and taquitos they were super amazing everything cook perfect and great customer service  Yolo bitches!!!

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really juicy meat when you bite into the tacos. Delicious!!!!
Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really good nachos. Best I ever had!

Zvo8o_xqcZAauhHOnWeLnA.text: Love this place! Great food and very professional, attentive service. My family and I ate here on Tuesday, 3/21/17. I had a vegan version of their vegetable enchilada and my wife and son had fajitas.   Great vibe, really nice ambiance. We'll definitely come back! Highly recommended.

PdGXAWUMepJS4qJucizZnQ.text: Amazing!  The street corn and veggie fajitas were awesome.  My husband got the chicken fajitas and he said it was the best he's had.

0xqjcQ26RfsG0nw4fyB2OA.text: Tried this restaurant before our show. The starters was chips and salsa which you pay for and they offer guacamole that they make  it's very good but cost an additional $12. I ordered the street tacos carne asada and cilantro rice, black beans. I personally didn't care for the carne asada the marina is with pineapple which gives a sweet taste. The cilantro rice very good. Restaurant is busy so you may get a little ignored . Overall a great place and worth the try.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carne asada street tacos with cilantro rice and black beans

Evun4W9yejX7tVuEPvKqrQ.text: I will admit first off that I did not try any of the food here.     We were almost scared away from this place by the name, but I am sure glad we stopped in because I had the best tasting beverage I have ever had in my life here.  It was the Jalapeno Cucumber Margarita.  I had never heard of such a concoction before so just had to try it.    After this I tried similar beverage at several other places but never found another that could compare.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeno Cucumber Margarita

vy3L1xHa35JwtG3pbTOAjg.text: This place is inauthentic, disgusting, greasy, and a waste of money. Unfortunately my friend didn't want to wait in line for good food so we went here because it was empty. That's obviously a sign it's not good.  Greasy nachos with chicken that looked unknown, greasy chips, and everything tasted like lard in a can. Tacos were bland. Service was okay considering it was half empty. This is absolutely atrocious. You would find better food at a Chipotle or something. There's a reason this restaurant is empty compared to a sandwich shop. Never again.

qK5-4kNvk1vf18Kguk6dzQ.text: Was pleasantly surprised at the food here, seeing the place otherwise seems about as authentic as...well, as anything else in Vegas I guess.  Shared the fajitas which came on a sizzle plate with all the sides for us to build ourselves and the meat was nice and tasty, and the sides plentiful. Staff were nice enough, prices reasonable, and all in all not a bad place to stop for a quick bite on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4Qt4g0eGI0l1xnJTVdsy9g.text: Very good service. Wait staff very attentive. Food presentation was 5 stars - very nice presentation. Prices were high but thats what you expect on the strip. Menu was short and sweet - your traditional Mexican dishes. Atmosphere was nice too.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very nice presentation

s_Nd6COfVs0LGSk3wv_Fmw.text: Amazing food and atmosphere!! Steak tacos are some of the best I've had.           Sat at the bar, very friendly waitress (Nadi)ask for her she's GREAT!! Lunch special going on right now... add a Margarita for only $5.00!! 5 stars for sure!!!

photos.caption: Photo of YOLOS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ArSk7mDRasNlptat72RhdQ.text: So much fun at this karaoke bar! The host and I didn't get off to the right start, but we ended up mending our relationship after he found out I was a rockstar singer.   Anyway, the people, atmosphere and bartenders are great.   Me and my boyfriend ended up coming back a few months later when I went back to Vegas.  This is my new 'go-to' Vegas karaoke bar!  :)

YIxkKUf4ciYc379GB1UMTw.text: Who wouldn't like to see a friendly smile? That is Nady. She is so friendly, professional and know what she's doing behind the bar. And... what a memory!!!! it's been awhile I have been at Yolos but somehow she knew who I was and Our conversation from last time. I always order the shrimp Tacos with cilantro rice and black beans. However this time I order the same thing with refried beans. I don't regret my choice. So good!!!! If you are at Planet Hollywood , you have to check Yolos and especially go to the bar.

WDx1XevsGmcPIepPGrwOjg.text: Average everything. Service was ok, nothing to write home about. Same for the food. Salsa was bland and the food was like warm. Again, just basic flavors and pricey for the quality.

n1Y7y647uGawGjoSZK1oxg.text: I absolutely love this place! The atmosphere is great, the staff is very friendly, and most of all, the food is amazing! Coming from Hawai'i, my mom, aunt, and I decided to dine here our first night in Vegas. We started off with a few Cucumber Jalapeno Margaritas and some Guacamole and chips. The Cucumber Jalapeno Margarita was so refreshing and tasty. I've never heard of such a drink, and I'm glad we tried it! The Guacamole was also very creamy and refreshing, just to my liking. Then, amongst the three of us, we decided to order the Sea Bass and the Shrimp Relleno. The food is fresh, tasty, and pretty inexpensive if you ask me. Great, quality food without emptying your wallet! When I do return to Vegas for a visit, I'll be sure to visit YOLOS at Planet Hollywood.

hYRpr8hgCvl2Lg8k3jE0JA.text: Came here on a Sunday night as we were just trying to grab a quick bite to eat. For a placed named YOLOS this is definitely not where you would want to go if you only lived once. Food was average and took a long time to come out. I'd say hit up any other Mexican place and it'll taste just as good and be cheaper.

XvgTXtkkkZnN3hXLH32nsg.text: Welcome to the ONLY Mexican restaurant that does not give you chips and salsa. Who the F does that??? Food was good, Small portions. Service was also good. Wait staff was very friendly.

2u_BlOEgckQ2ePU_ddoc0w.text: 5 Stars for this excellent Mexican grill.  The drunken nachos were AMAZING.  Try the Mexican Side Car as the perfect drink for Nachos!

xx1gEvb0Q-GOZ_W-8xWfGg.text: Came here for drinks after the Britney show. It's not a large place but the bartenders were nice. Super friendly and service was quick. Close to the restrooms - this is important when you're drinking. Trust me.

B7ULqAsw0-3Uu7PjDPXCZg.text: I know what my friends will say... Chris why did you go to a cheap secondary restaurant in Vegas when you ball so hard motherf***ers wanna fine me, That s*** crazy, That s*** crazy.  Well, a friend of ours got so loaded that he couldn't even articulate his name let alone probably be let into CUT over in the Palazzo.  So we went here and was surprisingly amazed at the quality of this food.  We started off with the Salsa Trio as a group and then I got the Street Tacos Dinner (Chicken Breast, Pork Carnitas and Mexican Gulf Shrimp).  Honestly so good.  This place is dirty cheap.  People who are getting upset regarding cost must be used to eating Fat Burger or In N' Out.  We had four guys who ordered meals and boozed and it was under $100 bucks.  DISCLAIMER:  I had been drinking most of the day (and previous night) probably had a slight sun stroke and was up around $400 bucks.  I was feeling pretty good so I hope this does not bleed over into my usual unbiased recommendations.

glQNxIk-ImIpP2XRbJKVUw.text: Best Mexican food!!!!! Awesome happy hour and delicious margaritas! Not to mention the killer service we received from Aaron! Go there !!

cZxoqvzBc2speh7BzpKvMA.text: Sat at the bar and had great service. The food all lacked flavor which is disappointing bc you expect so much flavor at a Mexican restaurant. We had shrimp fajitas and the shrimp were cooked perfectly but it needed some spice and/or seasoning. Same with the guacamole, no flavor. Good salsa and chips though.

nAbRnDqtsw_RaLNwCSZi4g.text: My friends and I had a good lunch here. Our server's name is JD, and he did a great job. He was quick, courteous, and friendly. We didn't have any drinks here, but the salads my friends and I had were delicious. The chips and guacamole was really good. Thankfully, the guacamole wasn't bland.

IdEh-i5mj0KZCJpqLuxMHg.text: This place is over priced for what it's worth. Mediocre meals, over cooked, cold when supposed to be hot meals, and over all horrible customer service. Don't eat there. You probably won't get noticed 20 mins before the hostest realizes you've been waiting, then your server probably won't take your order til they talk to their friends for an hour before taking your order, and by the time your food comes out it's most likely cold and stale.

iorw7LZb1Dt2fL3jc19RPA.text: Went with a group of 15...we did the 5 course package and unlimited drinks for 2 hours.  Total for a person...$69!  Yes $69 bucks for ulimited drinks and 5 course meal!   Chips and Salsa...Very tasty, they did the trick Appetizers...Taquitos/Yummy...Wings/Awesome...Kabobs/Good Salad...I skipped Entree...3 choices.  Salmon/Chicken/Steak!  I did the steak, very good. Dessert...I skipped Drinks...Umlimited beer/wine/margaritas  Hip joint in Planet Hollywood.  Great price, food, and service.

hAc5BtZ7d6l_0LH10XfF6A.text: Yolos is the best restaurant in Vegas!!!! Every time we go to Vegas that is the only place I have to go to. If you go request Thays she is the best server..... We live in California and for her to remember us and what we order every single time is the best. She is one of the reasons why we keep going there... Please bring yolos to Orange County!!! And make Thays the general manager!!!!! We will see you guys in a month

cgEkVp8V6xlQIBFxgZrEAw.text: Cool little spot. Nice ambience. The food is ok. One friend ordered the chile relleano and sent it back. She said it was dry. The other two friends ordered the taco trio. Both said fish taco was dry, but the shrimp and carnitas was good. I ordered the drunken chicken nachos. Excellent flavor, but a little skimpy on the chicken for $14. The highlight of the night was the flan! Very good. Music is on point! Friendly service and fast. Almost a little too fast. Made me wonder if the food was just sitting there.

pLR9dozATnc3NS39KIVfVg.text: This place has awesome food . The tortilla soup is amazing. Very quick service and extremely pleasant and accommodating service. From the hostess to the server I had a great experience at Yoli's.  Every time I come to Vegas I have to eat here.

ynlRH_o1dQTJjFGefRdZVA.text: Good food, average prices. Our drinks (blueberry mojito and dragon berry tea) were very strong, but the food serving sizes were great. We ordered the carne asada tacos, tostada salad, and chips/salsa and everything was very tasty. Food and drinks came quickly too. They have a large assortment of tequilas for a build-your-own margarita, as well.

5yQq-MnFvHmurU3DuDgBeA.text: Can't wait to go back I live here in vegas and am always looking for good places to eat if Mex food the better...this place won't disappointed you, Best happy hour in town you  get $5 street tacos $5 Guacamole the come over your table and make it there, super friendly staff and love that is very nice but restaurant style, but cool...must order the flautas, to die for yummm...

MkXqenplknhy0FBRgBXoTA.text: I ate here primarily because A. I stayed in this hotel and B. they had televisions for the World Cup. I ordered their sangria which was tasty. I had the tostada which was just fine. The ambiance is decent enough for a Vegas eatery. I'd go back.

xy68470BdZPexcYnzQnSpw.text: Save your money this is the worst Mexican food I've ever had! Got steak fajitas and tacos no flavor on the rice or beans

Y7ndSHqGJ-AU7Z8wPgD2tA.text: Don't go there! I had the street fish tacos, they were so dry I had to order a side of sour cream and it still didn't taste anything.  My friend she had a tostada salad and it was a colorless salad she had to look for the avocado and there was barely any chicken in it. To top it all off they had forgot to throw dressing on her iceberg. Worst ever!

UrSn6o0_iapUeF-mFeripQ.text: Fantastic gluten free options. The server was knowledgeable about what was gf on the menu. Enchiladas were amazing. Service was good. Margs were delicious!

sVDKQ_ZnfpyEvSiuYZ28cQ.text: Good place to eat in Vegas if you're looking for something casual and on the cheaper side. We had their margaritas, which are typical Vegas prices. They were pretty strong and had some fruit soaking in them.  I got their quesedilla, we split the salsa platter (really good!) and everyone enjoyed their food. Good service as well.   It didn't get 5 stars for me because the overall impression with the place was good, not great.

576Ifg8Q6KSB-7eGxQe92g.text: Ate here and had high expectations.  A bit pricey so I thought it would be better than aversge but not so....ceviche appetizer was not flavorful and while chicken enchiladas were ok rice was dry and hard.  Its good for a drink and music but not food!

-cFsRt-sSGkrSa11aFlGwg.text: I love this place. The staff treats you like family, the food service, and drinks are amazing. Highly recommend. The atmosphere is great. Definitely a good place to hang with friends.

E4iIm0cKzxeFYtFKL89GSw.text: This place quickly became my "go-to" during my 4-night stay at PH. It was one of the few places I found to be "all-inclusive." Want a drink? Yolos. Pretty good Mexican food? Yolos. Karaoke WITH PEOPLE DANCING TO THE KARAOKE and a lively clientele late into the night? Yolos. Super friendly bartenders (especially the sweetheart Nicolette)? Yolos. My only complaint was that they closed at around 11pm on Monday night, which probably just meant it was me who needed to get a life, as it seemed to be a pretty standard closing time on the strip in general.

KklzZlxE9E2ZsqHCT2p46Q.text: Our bartender was great! but the food made me feel yucky.  The salsa and guac was good, but the GREASY chips made me sick.  They ruined the taste of the salsa and guac.  I shoulda went to earls!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! dangit...

ZImT8q-oBcfRvdIC-XBqrQ.text: Came here before a pool party with my friends. We had bathing suits on but were still covered in wraps. The hostess told us we could sit at the bar. And then the bartender told us we just had to make sure we stayed covered. After ordering and getting a few drinks the terrible manager lady came by and told us we had to leave because we had swim attire. After telling her we weren't staying at that hotel and were already told two people we could stay there it wasn't right that she was making us leave. She gave me a dry apology and said she could make our food to go. Poor service and poor attitude. If you're not going to serve people in certain attire and you're a half bar in the casino not even a real restaurant on its own at least have a sign posted. Or honor what your employees already said could be done. Period.

T_dzlgQ38Q1bxtEWgQC9mQ.text: Anyone who gave this place 5 stars must work for the restaurant...  This place sucks!  Everything about our meal was bad. We had a reservation and still had to wait 20 minutes The margaritas were an absolute joke.  We had to send them back... they came back with new ones and they tasted just as watery as before.  Chips and Salsa  - mediocre Drunken Chicken Nachos - not good.. watery.. no flavor Mahi Mahi Tacos - not bad.. a little bland but not terrible.. the beans that accompanied it were awful though Margarita - arguably the worst margarita i've ever had

BXfoAavJQXijM-rbmZ2nuw.text: I found Yolo's to be a relatively decent restaurant offering pretty traditional mexican fare in the middle of a huge casino. The prices are very reasonable for strip food (about $15-$20) a person, and the portion sizes are just the right amount. Top that with chips & salsa as well as hand made (in front of you) guac, fantastic drinks, and snappy service, and you've got the makings of a sleeper.  I found the chips and salsa to be very good for snacking - they offer a very good house made salsa with warm chips that really offer a sweet and salty mix.  We also ordered two blended drinks, of which the name eludes me because we were faded as hell - but one tasted like starburst, and the other tasted like a lighter less sweet pina colada (which is damn good).  Ordered the chicken nachos, which I found to be a little weird because the chips were soggy, not crispy (which probably meant microwave cheese melting action as opposed to tossing it in a oven). The chicken was shredded and plentiful, and the cheese covered the spice covered chips very well. I only wish we had some extra sour cream, some house salsa, guac, and some sweet chilis.  Everything else on the table looked very good, and everyone left very satisfied and full.

HejjAb7NcH8fEYGhp9LCGw.text: Mediocre food, mediocre staff, relatively expensive for mexican food. To many other choices to go back

NuVibVQyNxqHVtdaiGtRbA.text: Great Mexican joint. May have been the best guacamole I have ever had. The Beef Steak tacos were very good. I would definitely recommend!

SMmOk56OlnA--6I3ZksCaQ.text: Average Mexican food! Prices were good but nothing too special. We were sat right away which was nice. We were staying at PH and needed to get a quick dinner before going out. I got enchiladas which were tasty and bf got pork tacos. Pretty average.  OH- I had a fruit fly in my drink! Not that big of a deal.. but still kind of gross. I would have thought they would have done more than just not charged me for my drink. Whatever, wouldn't be back either way.

i_4oa13rqcKjMhRPKIYd8Q.text: Saturday night dinner here at Yolo's only had us waiting about twenty minutes.  Typical mexican restaurant fair with street tacos, burritos and even gaucho steak.  Hubs got the gaucho streak which was ginormous.  He didn't speak much during dinner, so I know it was that good!  I got the grilled mahi mahi street tacos with a side of black beans, guacamole and pico de gallo.  It was ok.  They had this spicy mango salsa that complemented the fish just right.

hiJyrHvkiMHhVZb9cc-QhQ.text: We wanted to do girls night out right by starting off with dinner and drinks. Yolos was in our hotel so it became our dinner destination. Be sure to make reservations because it can be quite a wait come dinner time.   Like most Mexican restaurants, they start you off with chips and salsa. Salsa was good although a bit garlicy. Chips were fresh and not greasy so that was nice. We had a couple appetizers (crab cakes and shrimp ceviche) and fajitas. Everything tasted good and service was great. The drinks, although good were, too sweet for my taste.  The decor is cute too. I felt it had more a girly vibe because of the all the hot pink. Convenient location and worth trying if your staying at the hotel.

DI-_5dVi8M0gDp2MVmzZdg.text: Yolo's is a lame name, but decent food! We had the street tacos and they were really good! Their guacamole was some of the best that we have ever had and it is fixed table side! The salsa was disappointing though. The only strange thing is that to make a to-go order you must do it there, they can't do them over the phone. Which is inconvenient because we were staying at the hotel it was in. That aside it was a pleasant experience, we even ate their twice during our stay!

jKffsZqFPKfJUq6rgK3k6A.text: Love this place! My husband and I were in Las Vegas over the weekend and this was the third time we had eaten at Yolos. It is one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas. With Mexican fare seasoned perfectly, guacomole to order and prepared table-side, and very good service we always make it a point to eat at least one dinner here. Our waitress, Theya was attentive and prompt in every aspect. When we return we will ask for her!

wuea6fW6aFBto3CJLSq_IA.text: Happened by Yolos tonight as we walked down the strip hungry and looking for something great to eat.  As vegetarians it is difficult to eat out confidently.  There is always a fish sauce or chicken stock in different sauces and sometimes you never know until you feel ill after eating.    Starting with the hostess we asked about Yolos vegetarian accommodations and we were assured that sauces and beans were all prepared vegetarian.    Our server, Todd, was very helpful, friendly and informative about what dishes we could eat and what he personally enjoyed.  The menu also makes it easy to decide as there are easy choices for non-meat eaters.    The food tastes great, the atmosphere is inviting and the staff is really good at what they do.  We had the adobo vegetable enchiladas, queso fundido and quesadilla.  everything was tasty and satisfying.    I recommend Yolos.

U2-tefJ31tmqv9qBb6CXUA.text: Some of the best fajitas.. Mmm!! The chicken tortilla soup is bomb too. I LOVE the tableside Guac but prefer sitting @ the bar, table service is very iffy.

q3ktGHG7MDRcbEZLf3Mk4w.text: We've been to Yolo's every year for 4 years now for the superbowl and it's a great time. The wait staff is incredibly helpful and prompt. The food is good and the drinks are great as well.  They do a super job!  Staci is kind and helpful as well!

_BD9O4h7cGE7oRORL2xdEQ.text: The only and one star is due to the service. The waiter was nice , but the food was not good at all. The drunken chicken nachos had to much going on. And the enchiladas have no taste, the rice is hard it's not Mexican at all.  But the worse part was when i got my "pina colada" drink.  It tasted like old canned lemon. It was very acid not drinkable.  Don't spend your money here! It's not worth it. Sorry.

vjiOEcjhMf1OLBxfbTGaWQ.text: Woohoo!  We were looking for something delicious but nice that wouldn't break the budget on the first night of our trip.  After doing a lil' Yelp research, we decided on Yolos, which is tucked away inside Planet Hollywood.    So glad we decided to come here!  We sat at the bar, so there was ample people-watching for me - everyone in the restaurant PLUS the open side to the casino.  The prices weren't terrible - could have been a lot worse elsewhere - my chicken enchilada was around $12 (and delicious!).  Entrees like fish and steaks were $18+.  Sadly, they made us pay for the chips and salsa, which I think were around $4 - BUT the chips were pretty good and they came with a nice selection of four salsas, each very different from each other.    Definitely recommended!
